speaker: Ephraim
text: How do you intend to use the Sacred Stones, Lyon? Do you really think you can tap into its power?

speaker: Lyon
text: Mm... My research isn't complete yet, but there's no mistaking the power the Sacred Stones contain. And the Stone of Grado seems especially responsive to my dark magic. I suppose it's because it contains both sacred and demonic properties. Regardless, if I can just press my studies a little harder... Well, I think I might be able to use it to heal my father's illness. If that works there's no telling how many other people I can help as well.

speaker: Eirika
text: Do you think this is wise? The power contained within the stones is beyond our understanding... My father tells me that the stones posses a power not to be trifled with.

speaker: Lyon
text: Uh-huh... Father MacGregor is also against it. That's why they still won't give me direct access to the Stone of Grado. For the time being, I've made do with the radiant energies surrounding it. They're nothing compared to the raw power of the stone itself, but... If I can show Father MacGregor some real progress, perhaps one day...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Using the Sacred Stones to study magic...

speaker: Lyon
text: Ephraim, Eirika, what do you two think? Using the divine power of the Sacred Stones in this way... You don't think it's a very good idea, do you?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...It's just that I know nothing at all about magic. I would that there were some way I could help you, but I simply can't. But, Lyon, I've seen how hard you've worked to help others. I know how much you want the power to make others happy. I know these things, and because I know you, I trust your intentions.

speaker: Lyon
text: Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: If you hope to use the power of the Sacred Stones for good, I trust you can. I'm behind you all the way.

speaker: Eirika
text: I'agree with Ephraim entirely. You spend every night in the library, studying cures for your father's illness. The power of the Sacred Stones is too powerful to be used for personal gain. But you, Lyon... I think you'll be fine. You're the kindest person I know.

speaker: Lyon
text: Thanks, both of you. Hearing those words means a lot to me. Actually—and this hasn't been made public yet—but... I've already saved someone using the knowledge I've gleaned so far.

speaker: Ephraim
text: You have?

speaker: Lyon
text: Uh-huh... A while back, a fire ravaged Serafew, and a little girl got trapped in the flames. Her burns were terrible: not even healing staves were able to cure her injuries. But just a sliver of the stone's power restored her life and healed her wounds. We saved the that girl's life, Ephraim! Oh, if you could have seen the tears of joy in her mother's eyes!

speaker: Ephraim
text: You really did it, huh? You are special, Lyon. Congratulations!

speaker: Lyon
text: Well.. thanks. But there's still so much more to be done. I am happy, though. To be honest, I just want to be able to help people. I want to put the ancient magics to use for common good... That's how I feel.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon...

speaker: Lyon
text: And as my research moves forward, I'll be able to do much more, too. We have only the barest understanding of how dark magic operates. Maybe we can use it not only to heal wounds, but also to stop diseases... What if we can read the future, predict disasters, move mountains!?

speaker: Eirika
text: Hold on, Lyon. You can't take too much on yourself all at once. What good is helping people, if you sacrifice yourself to do it?

speaker: Lyon
text: Oh... Yes, of course. Sorry. I got carried away.

speaker: Ephraim
text: You have a soft heart, Lyon. I bet you haven't taken any real time off at all. So this is what we're going to do. Today, we're going into the city. And you're coming with us, Lyon.

speaker: Lyon
text: What? But, Ephraim, you've got a history report due.

speaker: Ephraim
text: We're taking today off. C'mon, let's go.

speaker: Lyon
text: Bu-but, Ephraim...

speaker: Eirika
text: It's just one day, and I won't tell anyone. Won't it be fun for the three of us to spend a day in the city?

speaker: Lyon
text: Ephraim, Eirika... Thanks so much. I'm lucky to have the two of you as friend.

speaker: Ephraim
text: We have the Stone of Renais. The final Sacred Stone is in Rausten

speaker: Eirika
text: L'Arachel, can you tell us anything about the Stone of Rausten?

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Naturally! As Rausten's very own princess, I know a thing or two about our stone. The palace reliquary currently houses of Sacred Stone. Follow me, I'll take you there

speaker: Innes
text: I sent the Frelian army ahead before us. They should be en route to Rausten. If we hurry, we can join up with them at the banks of the Narube River.

speaker: Ally Soldier
text: Do not falter! Show them the might of Frelia!

speaker: Woman
text: Lady S-Syrene... the enemy is headed this way.

speaker: Syrene
text: Are you serious? Grado's been defeated, and still they fought on? And they're tough.

speaker: Old Man
text: You Frelian fools have been wiped out by those guys... Oh, no... Now we're finished as well.

speaker: Syrene
text: Everyone, please remain calm. If you panic and flee, the enemy will simply surround you. If you remain here and don't move I promise to protect you all.

speaker: Woman
text: Lady Syrene...

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother! Look there!

speaker: Ephraim
text: A skirmish!

speaker: Innes
text: Is that Syrene? What's going on? We must go to her aid.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Everyone, hold! Something evil is afoot...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon?!

speaker: Lyon
text: Eirika... Ephraim...

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon... Where have you been all this...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika, stop!

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon... We met recently in Grado Keep, right? Do you remember what you told me then?

speaker: Lyon
text: ...... Of course, I remember. What of it?

speaker: Ephraim
text: You...

speaker: Lyon
text: I can repeat it for you now if you would like. The ruin of Renais? The murder of your father? It was all my doing. I, Lyon, prince of Grado, made it happen.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon... You lie! That can't be...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Don't be fooled, Eirika. Keep your guard up. That's now Lyon.

speaker: Lyon
text: ...... What amusing things come babbling out of your mouth. You always thought of Lyon as kind, gentle, and weak, didn't you? Admit it.

speaker: Ephraim
text: No! Lyon, Eirika, and I were friends. There were things we kept to ourselves of course, but we shared so much. And no matter what happened, no matter how much time passed... We're still friends. Lyon would never betray us. Not in a million years. You're not Lyon.

speaker: Lyon
text: ...I see. So I have no reason to continue hiding my true identity, do I?

speaker: Ephraim
text: None!

speaker: Lyon
text: You are correct. This body no longer belongs to your young Lyon. I devoured his pathetic heart ages ago.

speaker: Ephraim
text: You monster! Who are you?!

speaker: Lyon
text: Do you really not know me? What a poorly educated prince. Think about it. Remember the legends of your pitiful kind... What was sealed within the Stone of Grado? What is the name of terror?

speaker: Eirika
text: No... It can't be!

speaker: L'Arachel
text: It's as we feared after all. That can only be...

speaker: Ephraim
text: The great adversary of antiquity... The Demon King...

speaker: Lyon
text: That's right. You know to fear my name. Prince Lyon was a weakling. Now, he is dead.

speaker: Eirika
text: That can't be...

speaker: Lyon
text: Prince Ephraim of Renais... You hold a Sacred Stone. Give it to me. I have no wish to see a warrior die a pitiful death beneath my feet. Bend your knee. If you pledge services to me, I may yet let you live.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Do you take me for a fool?

speaker: Lyon
text: You've made your choice, have you? A poor choice... But it does afford me a chance to show you something special. A force no human flesh can withstand. A horror beyond words. A power that will place this sad world under my dominion. I am the Demon King... Behold my might.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon... We met recently in Grado Keep, right? Do you remember what you told me then? You told me that this was all your doing, that you had started this war.

speaker: Lyon
text: What? Ephraim... Why are you so angry? We haven't seen each-other in so long... What's happened?

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Wait, Eirika! You said it yourself. Lyon must be under the control of someone or something else.

speaker: Eirika
text: Don't be ridiculous! There must be something wrong with you, Ephraim! Lyon is one of our dearest and closest friends, remember? He told me that, no matter what happened, he was still on our side. Isn't that right, Lyon?

speaker: Lyon
text: Yes, Eirika. Of course it is. So, please, come here... Closer... Ah! Gah.. ahh... Uuuuhhaaah... ga...

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon?!

speaker: Lyon
text: Gah.... rrrrraaa... Ev... ahh... evil...  Stay... back... Eirika...

speaker: Eirika
text: What?

speaker: Lyon
text: Get away... from me... quickly... If you... don't... I will surely... ...destroy you...

speaker: Eirika
text: What? Lyon...

speaker: Lyon
text: Flee... qui-quickly... GO! Gah...... Aaaaaaarrrrggggghhh!

speaker: Eirika
text: Ly-Lyon. Hold on! What is it? What's happening?!

speaker: Lyon
text: Hi. It's been a while since I saw you two last, hasn't it?

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon? Is that really you speaking, Lyon?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Stay back, Eirika. Keep your guard up. That's not Lyon.

speaker: Eirika
text: Uh...

speaker: Lyon
text: I'm not Lyon? That's rich. A masterpiece. You always thought Lyon was kind, gentle, and weak, didn't you? Admit it.

speaker: Ephraim
text: No! Lyon, Eirika, and I were friends. There were things we kept to ourselves, of course, but we shared so much. And no matter what happened, no matter how much time passed... We're still friends. Lyon would never betray us. Not in a million years. You're not Lyon.

speaker: Lyon
text: ...Hmph. ...Looks like I was wrong to disregard the value of human emotions.

speaker: Eirika
text: What?!

speaker: Lyon
text: I've had my fun pretending to be human, but the need for charades has passed. You are correct. This body no longer belongs to your young Lyon. I devoured his pathetic heart ages ago.

speaker: Ephraim
text: You monster! Who are you?!

speaker: Lyon
text: Do you really not know me? What a poorly educated prince. Think about it. Remember the legends of your pitiful kind... What was sealed within the Stone of Grado? What is the name of terror?

speaker: Eirika
text: No... It can't be!

speaker: L'Arachel
text: It's as we feared after all. That can only be...

speaker: Ephraim
text: The great adversary of antiquity... The Demon King...

speaker: Lyon
text: Heh heh... ha hahahahah! Lyon... Lyon... O prince of misery... Come out. Be not shy... This body is lost to you... It is mine to compel...

speaker: Eirika
text: What's going...

speaker: Lyon
text: Your dreams, Lyon... I am about to make them come true for you. I am about to crush Prince Ephraim and take Princess Eirika for my own. Isn't this all that you've ever prayed for, young fool of a prince?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Ah!

speaker: Lyon
text: Rejoice, Lyon. The time has come... Ephraim, the man you envy... Eirika, the woman you desire... I will now grant you all of your darkest wishes!

speaker: Innes
text: Syrene!

speaker: Syrene
text: Prince Innes...is it... Ah... It really is you, isn't it, Prince Innes? Being rescued by you... It's like a dream...

speaker: Innes
text: Syrene? I need a status report.

speaker: Syrene
text: Oh... Oh, yes! Please forgive me! The Frelian troops we dispatched were ambushed and decimated. My squad is all that remains.

speaker: Innes
text: So many dead... You can rest easy now, Syrene. I'm here. Victory is assured. Let's go.

speaker: Syrene
text: Yes, sir... Prince Innes.

speaker: Tana
text: Syrene! Are you all right?

speaker: Syrene
text: Princess Tana! You must stay back. This place is dangerous!

speaker: Tana
text: No! I won't let you die! Hold on, I'm coming to help you at once!

speaker: Syrene
text: Princess Tana... You've grown so much. Very well. I'm yours to command, my lady.

speaker: Vanessa
text: Commander Syrene! Are you all right?

speaker: Syrene
text: Vanessa. What are you doing here...

speaker: Vanessa
text: I'm here with Prince Innes! We arrived to join the fray! We'll take over now. There's no need for you to exhaust yourself.

speaker: Syrene
text: Understood. The chain of command must be clear, though, so I'll take orders from your commander. Pass this message to whoever leads your forces, will you?

speaker: Vanessa
text: Right away!

speaker: Syrene
text: A moment, Vanessa.

speaker: Vanessa
text: What is it?

speaker: Syrene
text: You've matured since I last saw you last. And... you've grown beautiful as well.

speaker: Vanessa
text: ...Sister...

speaker: Lyon
text: Do you challenge me? You humans are so inconstant. You've forgotten what it is to fear me.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Where's Lyon? What have you done with our friend?! ANSWER ME!

speaker: Lyon
text: ...... Heh heh... How foolish. The one you seek is already dead. I have cast him into the abyss from which I crawled. The weakling is gone. Only the Demon King remains!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Grr... Monster!

speaker: Eirika
text: Please, Lyon! You must stop! I...I don't want to fight you!

speaker: Lyon
text: ...... The cries of children. Away with you, insects, if you wish not to die.

speaker: Lyon
text: Not yet... I have not the strength. But I am the Demon King... The world will be mine, as it was in the ancient days. Injuries such as those are not enough to stop me...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Demon King!

speaker: Lyon
text: Come, Ephraim. You should follow me. If you've the strength to defeat me, that is...

speaker: Ephraim
text: We will not let you flee! After him, Eirika! We have to find where he's gone. Search everywhere! I can't allow him to desecrate my friend's body any longer!

speaker: Innes
text: Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Innes?

speaker: Innes
text: There's no need to panic. The soldiers are following Prince Lyon's trail. Our trackers are excellent. They'll know his whereabouts momentarily.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Ah... Good point. Well made.

speaker: Innes
text: By the way, there's something I need to speak with you about. The messenger I sent to Frelia returned not long ago. She bought a package I'd request: Frelia's Sacred Twins.

speaker: Ephraim
text: You have the Sacred Twins?

speaker: Innes
text: Yes. Frelia may have lost her Sacred Stone... However, it seems the Sacred Twin relics remain undisturbed. I have bought them here. Behold!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Incredible...

speaker: Innes
text: Frelia's Sacred Twins. Nidhogg, the Serpent Bow, and Vidofnir, the Winged Lance. I want you to take them.

speaker: Ephraim
text: But these are Frelia's weapons. You should hold on to them.

speaker: Innes
text: No, I entrust them to you. You're the leader of this army. Use them as you will.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Understood. I'll make sure they wind up in worthy hands. Thank you, Innes. This helps.

speaker: Innes
text: Don't thank me. We're fighting for the same thing here: victory.

speaker: Woman
text: Lady Syrene! Thank you! We all owe you our gratitude...

speaker: Syrene
text: No, it wasn't my doing. We prevailed because of superior leadership.

speaker: Ephraim
text: No, I...

speaker: Old Man
text: We owe you a debt of gratitude that can never be repaid. It's not much. but please accept this staff as a small token.

speaker: Woman
text: And accept our thanks. We won't forget what you've done for us.

speaker: Lyon
text: Urr... Bah... Can't hold up to such as this? Accursed human flesh is too brittle, too weak...

speaker: Eirika
text: Hold, Lyon!

speaker: Lyon
text: Now, I know your strength. It is time to leave. I sacrifice this flesh and return to my body of old. This does not end. The world will drown again in darkness.

speaker: Vigarde
text: General Glen of the Grado Imperial Army, also known as the Sunstone...

speaker: Glen
text: Yes...

speaker: Vigarde
text: Your orders. Capture the leader of the rebel army in Carcino. Capture Eirika.

speaker: Glen
text: Eirika... Do you mean the princess of Renais?

speaker: Vigarde
text: Eirika invaded Carcino. She massacred the citizens of Port Kiris. Then, she fled south. Glen. Go. Crush the rebels who brought ruin to Carcino.

speaker: Glen
text: ...Understood, sire.

speaker: Cormag
text: What did the emperor say, Brother?

speaker: Glen
text: I’ve been ordered to kill the princess of Renais. Cormag, I want you to remain here in the capital. I’ll go alone.

speaker: Cormag
text: If that’s what you want, Brother, so be it. But you seem troubled... Don’t tell me you’re concerned about fighting the princess of a ruined land!

speaker: Glen
text: ...Hm... I never was able to slip anything past you, little brother. You’re right. This duty falls heavily on my shoulders, more then any other.

speaker: Cormag
text: Tell me, Brother, do you know this princess?

speaker: Glen
text: Yes. When Renais and Grado were still close... I met the girl– I met Eirika only once. We spoke briefly, but I felt she was a woman of great kindness. I cannot bring myself to believe Princess Eirika is evil. I cannot.

speaker: Cormag
text: ...Glen. The emperor has ordered–

speaker: Glen
text: There’s the rub, Cormag. That’s it exactly. His Majesty has never spoken a falsehood in all the time I’ve served him. And as a servant of the empire, I am duty bound to obey his orders. But I can see no reason to think Princess Eirika’s heart is any less gentle now.

speaker: Valter
text: What are these cowardly mutterings? It is because you three generals are weak that we others must work so hard. And yet you get the honor of killing the girl. How I long to do your duty for you!

speaker: Glen
text: Rrrr! Valter, you treacherous swine...

speaker: Valter
text: What’s this? Is this how you speak toward your peer knights of the realm? Lest you’ve forgotten, I, too, am a general–the same rank as you.

speaker: Glen
text: You wretch. You were cast out from the army for mistreating civilians. What lies have you told to receive pardon and reinstatement at the same tome?

speaker: Valter
text: Our beloved emperor felt my skills were needed, and his word is law. His majesty has earned my sincerest and most undying gratitude. And then we have you three. Duessel, Selena, and you... The three of you have proven to be unreliable time and time again. We were brought in to plug the holes, don’t you see? You ought to thank me, Glen!

speaker: Cormag
text: Valter! If you dare insult my brother further...

speaker: Valter
text: Come now, Cormag. And what would you do to me if I did? Would you fight me? Here? Would you show such disloyalty to the emperor?

speaker: Glen
text: Peace, Cormag. We are His Majesty’s men. We will honor his commands. Mark my words, Valter: your crimes are neither forgotten nor forgiven.

speaker: Valter
text: Hmph...

speaker: Gerik
text: Prince Innes. What do you say? Can you continue?

speaker: Innes
text: Yes, of course. Do you believe this is enough to make me give up? I am surprised you mercenaries haven’t turned and fled, though.

speaker: Gerik
text: Naw. You see, Gerik’s Mercenaries takes its name from me, Gerik. I’m the chief here. If I quit while our employer still fought on, they’d want a new name, you follow me? So... What’s the plan?

speaker: Innes
text: Same as before. We remain surrounded. They’re not going to allow us simply to walk out of here... I send a messenger off with news of our plight. However, even on the wings of a pegasus knight, Frelia is days away. We can expect no help from them.

speaker: Gerik
text: So we tighten our belts and survive, is that it? Or would you rather quit this place and rest in comfort?

speaker: Innes
text: Surrender? I’m the prince of Frelia. I don’t know the meaning of the words. The fate of the world rides on my shoulders, and I’ll make it to Jehanna. Even if I have to crawl to do it.

speaker: Gerik
text: Now, that makes me feel better. If you’re so determined, we may all live a little while longer...

speaker: Tethys
text: Hey, Chief, Prince.

speaker: Gerik
text: What is it, Tethys?

speaker: Tethys
text: I’ve got bad news...and then I’ve got worse news.

speaker: Gerik
text: What’s the bad news?

speaker: Tethys
text: We’ve no more weapons in reserve. What you’re holding is what we’ve got. Once those are gone, there won’t be much fight left in us.

speaker: Gerik
text: That is bad news... Well? What’s the worse news?

speaker: Tethys
text: They’ve begun to move. They’re going to attack again. Looks like they’re sending up the whole lot of ’em this time.

speaker: Innes
text: ...... Right. You two, you’re done here. Discharged. Fired. Whatever. You can surrender or flee. The choice is yours.

speaker: Gerik
text: What?

speaker: Innes
text: I’m the one they’re after. Throw down your weapons, and you’ll walk away alive. I don’t need you here. You’ll only be in my way. Who knows? You filthy sellswords’ll probably sell me out anyway.

speaker: Tethys
text: Hold on there! That’s not true, and you know it!

speaker: Gerik
text: Peace, Tethys. Hey, Prince. What are you going to do?

speaker: Innes
text: I’m going to get out of here on my own. I’ll break to the south and escape into the mountains.

speaker: Gerik
text: That ain’t gonna be easy. How you plan on doing that?

speaker: Innes
text: I’m not telling you. I’ve no idea when you’ll decide to betray me. Go on. Get out of here. I’d rather do this alone.

speaker: Gerik
text: Sounds like you’re trying to make sure you’re the only one who dies.

speaker: Innes
text: ...... Fool. I’ve no intention of dying. But there can be no false hope of reinforcements riding in to save the day. You and I are not the same. You’re a commoner, and I’m Frelia’s heir. We of noble birth do not shirk the duties to which we are born.

speaker: Innes
text: What are you waiting for? You may go.

speaker: Gerik
text: Well played, milord. I’ve always loved the melodrama of martyrdom... There’s no way I can abandon you after that fine performance. I’m staying with you. To the end.

speaker: Innes
text: To the– What are you saying? You dare ignore the orders of the one who’s paying your wages?!

speaker: Gerik
text: Tethys, I want you to go and surrender. Give my regards to Ewan and Marisa.

speaker: Tethys
text: Don’t be ridiculous. I’m not going anywhere. Now would the two of you kindly stop acting like such...men? And you! You’ve already fired us. You can’t order us to leave now.

speaker: Innes
text: Unbelievable... And you people call yourselves mercenaries? I thought you fought for money, not for duty.

speaker: Gerik
text: Yeah, that’s one of the rules. Guess we’re lousy mercenaries, eh? Now let’s get thinking. We still need a plan to get us all out of here alive. You’re supposed to be a good tactician, so I figure I won’t die easily. Tell us what to do, Prince. We’ll follow your orders.

speaker: Innes
text: ...... Hm. Very well. I’ll see what I can do to avoid getting us filled with arrows.

speaker: Tethys
text: Ah... Say, Prince. If, by some miracle, aid were to come, from what direction would it arrive?

speaker: Innes
text: ...From the north. But there’s little or no hope of that. Even if Frelia were to send us aid, they would not arrive until...

speaker: Tethys
text: This may be good news... Then again, it may be more bad news. There. On that northern mountain path... Someone’s coming.

speaker: Eirika
text: Prince Innes!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, the prince is surrounded by the mercenary armies of Carcino. He looks vastly outnumbered. I doubt he can hold out much longer.

speaker: Eirika
text: I can see that. Let’s hurry!

speaker: Pablo
text: Heh heh... My plan to get rid of Klimt has yielded some unexpected fruit. The head of Frelia’s Prince Innes will make a fine gift to Grado.

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Pablo, Prince Innes and his men have taken refuge in a mountain stronghold. Do we have your permission to finish them off?

speaker: Pablo
text: Yes. Flush the prince out and cut him down. We’ll find Klimt later and roast his old bones as well. Heh heh heh...

speaker: Man
text: Lord Klimt, Pablo’s troops are moving toward the stronghold. It looks like they’re planning on chasing down Prince Innes and his men.

speaker: Klimt
text: Pablo, you mad, reckless imbecile... If Prince Innes dies here, the bond between Carcino and Frelia is sundered forever. Carcino will be nothing more than a vassal paying tribute to Grado... We must find some way to aid Prince Innes.

speaker: Man
text: Wait, my lord Klimt! Pablo is after you as well. If you reveal yourself here...

speaker: Klimt
text: Ahh... May fortune keep you safe, Prince Innes...

speaker: Soldier
text: Hey! You’re up! You’re getting paid a lot more than us common soldiers. Time you earned your gold!

speaker: Marisa
text: I hear you. Where do I start killing?

speaker: Soldier
text: Th-that way! The Frelian troops! Don’t point that blade in our direction!

speaker: Marisa
text: I’ll do what I can. No promises. Good day.

speaker: Soldier
text: Whew... So that’s Marisa, the Crimson Flash of Gerik’s Mercenaries... She’s a beauty, but I’ll keep my distance...and keep my head.

speaker: Tana
text: Brother!

speaker: Innes
text: Tana?!? What? How did... What are you doing here?

speaker: Tana
text: I came with Eirika. Wait here, Brother. It’s my turn to protect you.

speaker: Innes
text: Stop playing the soldier, Tana. You will return to the palace at once.

speaker: Tana
text: I will not! Eirika, Ephraim, and you are all risking so much... I can’t sit at home and watch! I have to do something to help.

speaker: Innes
text: Tana... ...We’ll talk about this later. For now, we join forces with Eirika.

speaker: Tana
text: Thank you, Brother.

speaker: Eirika
text: Prince Innes! Are you well?

speaker: Innes
text: Eirika... Is that you?

speaker: Eirika
text: We’ve come to aid you. You must be exhausted. Please fall back and rest. We’ll take care of these dogs.

speaker: Innes
text: I cannot allow that. I will not run and hide while a woman protects me... We will continue the fight. You can join us.

speaker: Eirika
text: If that’s how you want it. Let’s go then.

speaker: Innes
text: ...Eirika, a moment.

speaker: Eirika
text: Prince?

speaker: Innes
text: I would give you my thanks. You, the princess of Renais, came to my aid... ...I am in your debt.

speaker: Innes
text: Reinforcements have arrived, Gerik.

speaker: Gerik
text: Lucky us, eh? Good thing we held out as long as we did.

speaker: Innes
text: That was your doing. Thank you.

speaker: Gerik
text: Don’t let your guard down now, Prince. There are still enemies to fight, and it’d be such a shame to die now.

speaker: Innes
text: I agree completely. Let’s go.

speaker: Gerik
text: Hey, Tethys. Looks like help is on the way.

speaker: Tethys
text: Really? Perhaps faith is a good thing. I’ve never had much before, but perhaps good things do happen to good people.

speaker: Gerik
text: Good things? I like the sound of that. What do you suppose might come my way?

speaker: Tethys
text: Ha ha... I wonder...

speaker: Innes
text: Reinforcements have arrived, Tethys.

speaker: Tethys
text: Really? Perhaps faith is a good thing. I’ve never had much before, but perhaps good things do happen to good people.

speaker: Innes
text: Faith had nothing to do with this. Let’s go. We must join them.

speaker: Tethys
text: What a strange nobleman.

speaker: Tethys
text: Say, Chief. I’ve got good news, and I’ve got better news.

speaker: Gerik
text: Eh? What’s the good news?

speaker: Tethys
text: Within our band of mercenaries... There are two women enamored of you.

speaker: Gerik
text: Huh? What’re you talking about? You a fortune-teller now? And what’s the better news?

speaker: Tethys
text: Help has arrived. Looks like we may survive after all.

speaker: Young Lady
text: Elder Pablo used his fortune to build his own private army. Now he’s using it to wrest control of Carcino from the council’s hands... Please...help Lord Klimt, so that he can help us.

speaker: Man
text: You know we have no king in the Republic of Carcino. We’re governed instead by a council of elders. It’s a lot better than any stuffy, old monarchy, I can tell you that. You see, anyone can be a leader in Carcino if he’s old enough. Of course, maybe that’s why the country’s in such a mess right now.

speaker: Young Man
text: I’ve heard that Prince Innes of Frelia is a fantastic tactician. Grado took Renais with no trouble, but Frelia still has yet to fall. They say it’s because Prince Innes has spies reporting every move the empire makes. At the same time, all enemy spies in Frelia are exposed and executed swiftly. That means that none of Frelia’s secrets are ever reported back to the empire. I’ve never met Prince Innes, but he doesn’t sound like a man you’d want as an enemy.

speaker: Gerik
text: Is that you, Marisa?

speaker: Marisa
text: Chief.

speaker: Gerik
text: What a mess... Looks like the guild bungled. They’re usually diligent about making sure this sort of thing doesn’t happen. But here we are, two people of the same troop, working for opposite sides.

speaker: Marisa
text: What should we do?

speaker: Gerik
text: Aye, well, that’s a good question... As a mercenary, your loyalty should always lie with the person paying your wages. You decide. We can cross blade if you want, but I’d rather you retreat. ‘Course, if you betray your employer, you’ll soil your sterling name.

speaker: Marisa
text: C’mon, Chief. What would YOU like me to do?

speaker: Gerik
text: Well, that’s easy. I’d like you to come over and join my side.

speaker: Marisa
text: Right. Done.

speaker: Gerik
text: Ho-hold on... Is that it? Just like that? You know what this will do to your reputation, right?

speaker: Marisa
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Pablo
text: No one can withstand the might of Grado... Logic dictates we join now or be subjugated later. I made the rational decision. The only decision!

speaker: Pablo
text: Urrgh... N-no. I cannot die when there is such wealth to be had... Re-retreat! Mercenaries, to me!

speaker: Valter
text: ...I’ve found you, Eirika. Seems you’re as skilled as reports say. This is going to be fun. Yes, yes, yes. I do so love strong women.

speaker: Soldier
text: Shall we attack, General Valter?

speaker: Valter
text: No, we’ll pass on dessert for now. Allow them to escape. We’re leaving.

speaker: Eirika
text: Prince Innes, are you well?

speaker: Innes
text: Eirika...I’m sorry for troubling you.

speaker: Eirika
text: No, it was no trouble.

speaker: Klimt
text: Oh, Prince Innes! Thank goodness, you’re unharmed!

speaker: Eirika
text: Who are you?

speaker: Klimt
text: Oh, where are my manners? I am a member of Carcino’s Council of Elders. My name is Klimt.

speaker: Eirika
text: A council member?

speaker: Innes
text: So you’re one of the traitors who ordered–

speaker: Klimt
text: P-please, please! I have no intention of opposing you or quarreling with you. I, too, have been marked for death by Pablo...

speaker: Eirika
text: What is this all about?

speaker: Klimt
text: It’s a shameful tale... Carcino is a nation divided. As you know, Carcino has no king but is ruled by a council. But now the council has broken apart into factions mired in discord...

speaker: Eirika
text: Factions... You’re saying that the whole of Carcino has not betrayed Frelia?

speaker: Klimt
text: Correct. The moderate factions prefer to preserve our alliance with Frelia. Pablo’s faction wishes to endear us to Grado, to surrender us to their armies. Once Pablo realized he couldn’t ply us with brides, he began to have us assassinated. Those of us who remain have taken refuge underground. We oppose him where we can. If you hadn’t shown up, I’m not certain I would still be breathing...

speaker: Innes
text: I do recall enemy troops combing this area when I arrived... They were searching for you, is that it?

speaker: Klimt
text: Pablo has usurped rule of the council. We had no choice but to hide. Not all of Carcino’s council has gone over to Grado’s side, though... You must believe me–the whole of Carcino does not believe as Pablo does.

speaker: Innes
text: ...I see.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lord Klimt... I understand the hardships you’ve endured. I am pleased to hear all of Carcino is not our foe.

speaker: Klimt
text: I will depart at once for Frelia to explain our circumstance to the king. I think it is best if you return to Frelia as well. Pablo has considerable wealth, and he commands a vast mercenary force. I’m sure he’ll send more of them this way as soon as he is able.

speaker: Gerik
text: Prince Innes. Tethys and I are staying with you. Is that gonna work?

speaker: Innes
text: Yes, I would appreciate the help. Starting now, you’ve got a new contract, though–the pay’s double. If the two of you hadn’t stayed with me back there, I would not have survived. Gerik, Tethys... Thank you. You have my gratitude.

speaker: Tethys
text: Tell me something, Prince. Did you get...er...hit on the head during that last skirmish?

speaker: Innes
text: ...That’s unkind. My neck is not so stiff that I cannot show gratitude. I would ask for your continued support in the days ahead.

speaker: Eirika
text: We both ask for your help.

speaker: Gerik
text: We’ve got a deal. Let’s keep each other alive.

speaker: Ewan
text: Ah! There you are, Sister.

speaker: Tethys
text: Ewan! How is it... What are you doing here? I told you to wait in the inn and behave yourself, didn’t I?

speaker: Ewan
text: Yeah, but you always run off and disappear. It’s not fair. I want to have adventures, too.

speaker: Tethys
text: You are such an imp... I am not out here running about having fun, you know?

speaker: Ewan
text: I know. That’s why I came to see you. I can help. My teacher finally got around to teaching me some magic. Check this out.

speaker: Tethys
text: H-hey! Knock it off! You shouldn’t be using magic here!

speaker: Ewan
text: Well, I just thought maybe I could help you work is all. I can protect you now, sis. Come on, take me with you. I don’t wanna stay in that inn anymore.

speaker: Tethys
text: Oh...all right. I’ll go speak and speak to the Chief and Princess Eirika. Don’t wander off while I’m gone.

speaker: Ewan
text: Yahoo!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, Prince Innes. I think we should follow the advice we’ve been given and return to Frelia. Continuing on through Carcino like this is too great a risk to your safety.

speaker: Innes
text: The peril is self-evident. However, I have to reach Jehanna, and the only way is through Carcino. If I don’t hurry, nations will fall, one after another, to Grado’s hunger.

speaker: Eirika
text: Innes is right. And the road to Rausten leads me through both Carcino and Jehanna. However, pressing on will only invite more mercenary attacks.

speaker: Ewan
text: Hey, I’ve got an answer. I know a way that leads over the mountains straight to Jehanna! Want me to guide you?

speaker: Eirika
text: ...And who might you be?

speaker: Tethys
text: Ewan! Shush! You know better than to interrupt people when they’re talking. I’m so sorry. Please let me take my brother out of the way. Come on, Ewan. Let’s go.

speaker: Eirika
text: No, no–wait, please. Do you really know a route through the mountains?

speaker: Ewan
text: That’s what I said. At the top of that mountain, there’s a village named Caer Pelyn. That’s where my teacher lives. I’m sure he’ll lead you through if you ask him nicely.

speaker: Innes
text: What is your teacher’s name?

speaker: Ewan
text: My teacher? His name is Saleh.

speaker: Innes
text: Saleh... I’ve heard that name on the lips of Frelia’s spy network lately. He’s a powerful wielder of magic who has been fighting bandits and monsters. The spies mentioned something about a Caer Pelyn, if I remember.

speaker: Eirika
text: What do you think?

speaker: Innes
text: Hm. If my spies are accurate, this Saleh is someone we can trust.

speaker: Eirika
text: Very well, Ewan. Will you take us to meet your teacher?

speaker: Tethys
text: Are you sure you can do this, Ewan?

speaker: Ewan
text: Not a problem! All right, everyone. See if you can keep up!

speaker: Seth
text: We’re approaching Serafew, at the border of Renais and Grado. Once we cross, we’ll be in Grado... Renvall won’t be much farther.

speaker: Eirika
text: That is, assuming we can cross the border without mishap... Oh! Look! Over there!

speaker: Eirika
text: Those strange figures... What...What are they? Are they...human? I’ve never seen anything like it. What could they be?

speaker: Artur
text: What have we done to deserve the trials before us? What is happening to us? How could such abominations walk out lands while the Sacred Stones protect us?

speaker: Artur
text: Lute, please, it’s dangerous outside the walls. Stay here in the village.

speaker: Lute
text: Those are revenants, aren’t they? They were the vanguard of the Demon King in the days of darkness. The Tome of Nazania describes them in chapter 2, section 7, paragraph 8.

speaker: Artur
text: You know of them?

speaker: Lute
text: Duh! I’m a prodigy. I can recall almost everything I see or hear. According to the book, revenants attack using razor-sharp claws. Sounds painful, wouldn’t you say?

speaker: Artur
text: Yes, er, well... Be that as it may, I must go aid those travelers outside. You should stay here within the safety of the village.

speaker: Lute
text: Very well. I don’t mind staying here. In fact, it seems that smarter choice.

speaker: Lute
text: Magic is far more powerful than any monster’s claws. The thickest hide and the strongest armor are useless against magic’s power. Yes, I supposed I could have studied swords, but only magic is worthy of me. Even if this village were to be assaulted by monsters, I could defend it perfectly.

speaker: Artur
text: Travelers, you must listen to me! The ancient forest of Za’ha is dangerous. Head south and pass through this place before the fiends surround you!

speaker: Eirika
text: Who are you?

speaker: Artur
text: My name is Artur. The temple has assigned me the task of cleansing the forest of these...things. There are so many of the fiends, though. I wonder if I stand much chance alone. So if you would, please flee now while you have the chance.

speaker: Eirika
text: Fiends? You’re not talking about the same fiends that served the ancient Demon King? That can’t be right... They’re nothing but legends and fairy tales...

speaker: Artur
text: Yes, I felt the same say when I heard. And yet here they are. This place is filled with them. I wonder how far they’re spread... Surely they’re not in Renais alone.

speaker: Eirika
text: But..why are they here? How?

speaker: Seth
text: Beware, Your Highness! Something approaches!

speaker: Artur
text: Please allow me to deal with this. Evil shade! May the blessed light drive you from this land!

speaker: Seth
text: We ought to help. He can’t fight them all alone. Do you have orders?

speaker: Artur
text: One of my companions is in that village to the south. If you can get there swiftly, I implore you to watch over her safety.

speaker: Man
text: Do you see that old snag to the south of here? Bet it would make a handy bridge if you could knock it over. Take a weapon to it and give it a few good whacks. That should do it. Here, take this and give it a try. It ought to do the trick.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, my! Those travelers are being besieged by the agents of evil!

speaker: Dozla
text: Ha ha ha! Right you are, Lady L’Arachel!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: I cannot allow this to happen! Come! We must charge down these cliffs and rush to their aid!

speaker: Rennac
text: We charge down these cliffs, and the only thing we’ll be rushing to is death. How about we find us a nice, gentle path down, hm?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Ah...Yes, well...Let us hurry nonetheless. I simply cannot abide those wicked beasts running amok!

speaker: Artur
text: Lute, help has arrived.

speaker: Artur
text: Lute?

speaker: Lute
text: Your flesh shows no sign of putrefaction. It seems you’re not a revenant.

speaker: Artur
text: Well, I should hope not! I wanted you to know help has arrived. Please be patient a bit longer...

speaker: Lute
text: No, no. I insist on joining you in combat. I’ve been reading up on these revenants. They are, quite simply, no match for me. I am superior after all.

speaker: Eirika
text: Hm?

speaker: Lute
text: Your flesh shows no sign of putrefaction. It seems you’re not a revenant. I’ve decided to join you in battle now. My name is Lute. I’m a mage of superior wisdom and rare ability. I’ve been reading up on these revenants. They are, quite simply, no match for me. I am superior after all.

speaker: Seth
text: We’ve killed all the monsters. Still, we’d best burn the bones to ash to be sure they don’t return.

speaker: Eirika
text: I still can’t believe what we’ve been fighting here... I’d thought those fiends nothing more than myth and legend.

speaker: Seth
text: Those revenants are said to be the least of the dark creatures. And yet, the weakest of them could outmatch any normal man. We cannot take this enemy lightly.

speaker: Lute
text: Oh, yes. There are much worse then those revenants and the entombed... Let’s see, there’s the bonewalkers, mauthe doogs, gargoyles, baels... Why, I’ll bet you just about any creature of lore could be walking again. Yes, we’re in for some trouble. Even my fabulous power may not be enough.

speaker: Artur
text: O divine light, show me... Is this a sign of dark days to come?

speaker: Eirika
text: By all that’s holy, what is happening?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, perhaps it would be wise to return to Frelia and regroup. Pressing forward seems foolish in light of recent events. We cannot face both Grado’s forces and more of those terrible things.

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth, I follow your point, and nothing would please me more then running for safety. But what of my brother? He and his men are still trapped in the same situation we are. I know full well that I may be leading us into even greater danger, but... Please try to understand.

speaker: Seth
text: I do, my princess, and I vow to see you through this safely.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Aha! Foul creatures, beware! I, L’Arachel, bestow upon you the honor at banishment at my blessed hands!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh...Where are the monsters?

speaker: Eirika
text: Well, we just finished...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Ah, glad tidings indeed! The heavens must be rejoicing! I am.. a tad disappointed however. After all, I did rush all the way here to show you the splendor of my might.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! It’s a real shame, innit, Lady L’Arachel?!

speaker: Rennac
text: What’s shameful is the way you drag us around the countryside.

speaker: Eirika
text: Pardon me, but...who are you?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Me? Since you ask, please allow me to introduce myself. It is I, the true light and glory of the sacred realm of Rausten...

speaker: Dozla
text: Stop! Lady L’Arachel, you mustn’t continue! You cannot reveal your true identity here!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, yes, you’re right. Oh, I get so careless sometimes! Now, I must ride off in anonymity. Oh, how beautifully romantic!

speaker: Eirika
text: Uh... Right.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Fare thee well, strangers. Perhaps our paths will cross again. Come, Dozla! Rennac! We ride!

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! Let’s go, Rennac!

speaker: Rennac
text: All right, all right.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...What was that about?

speaker: Joshua
text: Well, well. There’s an arena in this town. Perfect. My pocket’s feeling a bit light. Say, is that a cleric? It is! And a gorgeous one at that.

speaker: Joshua
text: Something amiss, Sister? You look flustered.

speaker: Natasha
text: Ahhh! P-pardon me.

speaker: Joshua
text: No, pardon me! I never meant to startle you. May I offer my apologies....

speaker: Natasha
text: No, it’s not necessary... It was my fault. Excuse me, I must be going... Good day to you.

speaker: Joshua
text: ...And there she goes. Not my lucky day... She was quite the beauty, too. Ah, such is life. I think I’ve time still to visit the arena, though.

speaker: Glen
text: Captain Saar of the Serafew Border Guard. How fare you? I bring orders from His Majesty. Rumor has it that Princess Eirika of Renais is making her way to Grado. You are to find her and to place her in custody immediately.

speaker: Saar
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Glen
text: One more thing... A traitor to the empire has fled Castle Grado. We’ve received reports she is hiding somewhere here in Serafew. I don’t care if you have to tear this town apart. Find the turncoat.

speaker: Saar
text: Yes, sir, General Glen! If she resists, do we have permission to execute her?

speaker: Glen
text: ...Yes. Permission granted.

speaker: Saar
text: Understood! Grado’s will be done. The Grado Empire will repay the debt of betrayal with blood!

speaker: Glen
text: ...His Majesty relies upon you, Captain. Be sure his trust is not misplaced. That is all.

speaker: Saar
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Glen
text: Such loyalty to the crown. If only I could hold such conviction in the righteousness of our emperor.

speaker: Cormag
text: Something troubling you, Brother?

speaker: Glen
text: No...Pay no mind to me. Come, Cormag. Let’s go. From here, we ride northeast, back to the fort.

speaker: Cormag
text: Very well.

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s been so long since I last visited Serafew. My brother and I used to pass through here en route to Grado. I remember the harmony in which the people of both countries lived. No walls divided our borders. No soldiers stood guard in high towers. The border town... It was to me a symbol of the trust between Grado and Renais.

speaker: Seth
text: ...And now, it is firmly under the thumb of Grado’s emperor.

speaker: Eirika
text: The peace I remember in this city... It seems like something from another time. It seems lost now... Forever.

speaker: Seth
text: ...The city doesn’t seem to be very heavily patrolled. They must feel it’s not worth guarding with Castle Renais under their control. We must try to not draw attention to ourselves. The west gate is undermanned....

speaker: Saleh
text: Pardon me, may I ask you a question?

speaker: Eirika
text: What is it?

speaker: Saleh
text: I’m looking for someone. Have you seen a young girl with indigo hair?

speaker: Eirika
text: Indigo hair? No...Sorry.

speaker: Saleh
text: Hmmm... Thank you. Sorry to intrude.

speaker: Eirika
text: There was something very odd about that man, wouldn’t you say?

speaker: Seth
text: He did seem unusual. He didn’t strike me as a Grado spy, but...

speaker: Soldiers
text: Catch her! Don’t let her escape! That way! She went that way!

speaker: Eirika
text: What’s that?

speaker: Seth
text: It’s coming from over there.

speaker: Eirika
text: Let’s see what the commotion is.

speaker: Soldier
text: Traitor Natasha! Surrender peacefully. Come quietly, and you may have the chance to explain yourself before His Majesty.

speaker: Natasha
text: Wait, please. You must listen to me!

speaker: Soldier
text: Take her.

speaker: Natasha
text: No, you must believe me! The emperor is not himself. You MUST be able to see that!

speaker: Soldier
text: Impugn the emperor at your peril! We’ve been ordered to execute you if you offer any resistance. But your words condemn you!

speaker: Eirika
text: That cleric is a traitor to the throne of Grado? What madness is this?

speaker: Natasha
text: Ah...

speaker: Eirika
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Natasha
text: Who are you?

speaker: Eirika
text: I’m from Renais. Why are these Grado men after you?

speaker: Natasha
text: You’re from Renais...Oh! I have something I must tell you. It’s about Grado–

speaker: Eirika
text: Wait–Grado soldiers are coming this way. We’ll have to talk later. Now we must fight!

speaker: Joshua
text: So much for my dreams of making my fortune here... First the girl, now the gold. It really isn’t my lucky day.

speaker: Soldier
text: You there! Mercenary! What are you doing here at the arena? Get back to the staging area now!

speaker: Joshua
text: C’mon, why don’t we both hit the arena? It’ll be good training, If you’re going to risk your life anyway, you may as well try to earn some gold.

speaker: Soldier
text: I’m reporting you to the captain! You’ll be lucky if he just docks your pay! Don’t forget–You can be replaced in an eyeblink, you filthy sellsword!

speaker: Joshua
text: Don’t worry, little man. I won’t forget. Work’s work, but I don’t like fighting women... Now then, what’s the rest of the day got in store for me? ...Tails huh? That’s nothing but bad luck and more bad luck...

speaker: Natasha
text: They may not want to hear what I have to say, but... I must speak with one of the Grado soldiers. Oh, if only one of them will listen to my words... Please! Grant me strength.

speaker: Brigand
text: Look at this. Now’s our chance! C’mon, lads! Let’s join the fights and steal our way through this pathetic town!

speaker: Tethys
text: Oh, hello. Did you come to see me dance? I’m sorry, but I just finished a few moments ago. Oh, by the way…Would you be interested in one of these items? A wealthy patron left me a small ransom in gifts after watching my performance. You can sell one for gold if you’d like or use them to improve your skills. I simply cannot carry all of this by myself, so please, take this one. Wealth is useless if you can’t use it to bring happiness to others, right? Thanks for dropping my. Perhaps we’ll meet again someday.

speaker: Man
text: Life in Serafew’s been harder since the Grado occupation force took over here. Serafew’s got Renais citizens as well as Grado, but it’s been hardest on us. They’ve singled out families from Renais for the most awful atrocities. Please, traveler, take this sword. It’s an armorslayer. It’ll cut through even the strongest armor. Take it and strike down that blackheart, Saar.

speaker: Natasha
text: You...You’re that man I met... Are you here to capture me? You’ve been hired to silence me, haven’t you...

speaker: Joshua
text: Yeah, Grado’s paying the bill. They want you dead, you know? But don’t feel bad. It’s not personal.

speaker: Natasha
text: Wait, please... It doesn’t matter what happens to me, but you must hear my words. The emperor of Grado is changed. He is not the man he once was. The other nations must be warned before he extinguishes all light from out lands.

speaker: Joshua
text: Hey, no offense, but I’m just a mercenary. I don’t care about Grado or its emperor. Everything you say may be true, or it may be lies. I don’t care either way.

speaker: Natasha
text: But that’s...

speaker: Joshua
text: Even so...killing a beautiful lady like you would leave a bad taste in my mouth. Tell me, do you like to gamble?

speaker: Natasha
text: What?!

speaker: Joshua
text: Gambling’s what I live for. Even when I lose, I never want to stop. Let’s have us a little wager. If you win, I’ll believe you. Heads or tails, you call it.

speaker: Natasha
text: You can’t... This is no time for games...

speaker: Joshua
text: Would you rather I get on with the job I was hired for?

speaker: Natasha
text: ...... Um, heads... No! Tails!

speaker: Joshua
text: All right. So I’m heads, and you’re tails. Here we go. ... ... ...

speaker: Natasha
text: ...... Which...Which is it?

speaker: Joshua
text: What do you know?! It’s tails. You win. Figures. I haven’t won anything all day. Well, Lady Luck has spoken. Guess I’m on your side now.

speaker: Natasha
text: Are you serious?

speaker: Joshua
text: Yeah. Sure, I might cheat, but I never worm out of a bet. It’s a rule of mine.

speaker: Natasha
text: Oh, thank heaven! Thank you, blessed light, for your protection!

speaker: Joshua
text: I got nothing against heaven, but I’m right here if you want someone to thank... No? Well , get behind me then. I’ve got to take care of these fools.

speaker: Old Man
text: In my youth, I was a knight of some renown, I’ll have you know. I’ve even crossed blades with one of Grado’s most famous generals, I have. Ah, but I’m an old man now... I’m starting to worry... What if I die without passing on my techniques? So I decided to write down what I’ve learned in a book. I have it here. You seem like a strong warrior. I’d be honored if you would accept it.

speaker: Amelia
text: Hope everyone’ well back home in Silva. Just a bit more, and I’ll be in the empire. Let’s see, I’ve got vulneraries, antitoxins... Oh! And I can’t let myself forget torches for when it gets dark. Yep! I’m all set! Now I just need to get to the capital. I’ll be the finest soldier the Grado army’s ever seen! I swear it!

speaker: Eirika
text: Hm? What’s this...

speaker: Saar
text: Enemy of the empire! Death’s too good for you!

speaker: Saar
text: Emperor Vigarde... Glory to His...Majesty...

speaker: Eirika
text: That was a tight spot.

speaker: Natasha
text: Yes, yes it was... Thank you so much. I don’t know how to repay–

speaker: Seth
text: You’re from Grado, aren’t you?

speaker: Natasha
text: Yes... My name is Natasha. I was a servant of the people at Grado’s Imperial Temple.

speaker: Eirika
text: Then why the trouble with the soldiers? Would you tell us your story?

speaker: Natasha
text: Of course... A few days past, my mentor was arrested without warning. They executed him. They said he as a traitor... But those were false accusations. The emperor had him killed–a holy man!–to keep him silent.

speaker: Seth
text: Keep him silent?

speaker: Natasha
text: Yes. My mentor told me with his final breath. The emperor plans to destroy the Sacred Stones.

speaker: Eirika
text: The Sacred Stones? Destroy them?

speaker: Natasha
text: As you must know, the Sacred Stones drove back the power of evil long ago. Even now, each of our nations is home to one of these legendary treasures. There’s one in my homeland, Grado, and one in your Renais...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, the Sacred Stone of Renais is still housed in our royal temple.

speaker: Natasha
text: The emperor plans to destroy the five stones, one by one...

speaker: Seth
text: Why would he do such a thing? Legend says the Sacred Stones are even now all that keep evil at bay!

speaker: Natasha
text: I cannot begin to guess his motives... You must know, our emperor was a gentle man. But one day, he changed. Utterly. Before my mentor died, he said the keepers of the Sacred Stones must be warned. I tried to slip across the border, but the soldiers spotted me...

speaker: Eirika
text: Is that what happened... What do you think, Seth?

speaker: Seth
text: I think we can trust no one from Grado. Not in these times. Not without proof. However, if what she says is true, we cannot ignore the danger we face. Destroying the Sacred Stones... We cannot allow that to happen.

speaker: Eirika
text: I agree. If only we knew if there were some reason for the emperor’s actions. I must tell you, her story chills me to the bone. I pray it is false...

speaker: Man
text: A moment, please. Are you perchance... Princess Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: I am.

speaker: Man
text: Oh... Thank goodness you’re safe! I can’t tell you how happy I am. And please accept my gratitude for driving off that Captain Saar. That Saar treated all the citizens of Renais with such contempt and brutality....

speaker: Eirika
text: Not here...not in this city. My brother and I spent such happy times here with Lyon...

speaker: Man
text: I beg your pardon, but it will not be long before Grado sends more troops. Please, you must go quickly.

speaker: Eirika
text: I’m so sorry. There’s nothing I can do for you now. Please forgive me.

speaker: Man
text: Do not be troubled. Princess Eirika... We will survive and wait for the day of liberation to come. There will be a day when you, Prince Ephraim, and all of Renais rise up... Until that day of glory comes, we will wait unbowed and filled with hope.

speaker: Eirika
text: L'Arachel... May I ask your advice?

speaker: L'Arachel
text: What is it, Eirika? There's no need to be so formal.

speaker: Eirika
text: It's about Lyon... My brother was right. Lyon's been possessed by the Demon King. He... He's no longer the Lyon I once knew. But I can't help feeling... there must be some way to bring him back.

speaker: Eirika
text: Please help me, L'Arachel. I want to save him. Rausten is the spiritual heart of Magvel. They keep the ancient lore. You're their princess. You must know something about the demons of legend. Is there anything that can save Lyon?

speaker: L'Arachel
text: I'm so sorry, Eirika. To the best of my knowledge, there is no way to aid him.

speaker: Eirika
text: That can't be! There must be something! Any clue, no matter how slight...

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Our oldest legends tell us just this... Only one person has ever been able to shake off the Demon King's domination. Rausten's founder, Saint Latona the sure-hearted, shattered his fetters. If one possesses a strength of will beyond that of normal men... Only then can one throw off the shackles of the Demon King. But you saw it for yourself, Eirika, with your own two eyes. Your friend Lyon's body has already been claimed by the Demon King. Once it's gone that far, there's nothing that can be done. When the Demon King takes over someone, he devours his spirit, their very soul. Even if his hold on Lyon's body could be released, that body would have no soul. There is no power in Rausten... not even the Sacred Stone... that can perform so great a miracle as to restore a shattered soul.

speaker: Eirika
text: But... Lyon...

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Eirika... I understand how you feel, but the prince is gone. The Lyon you knew no longer exists. It's more important now that you care for yourself. If we pursue the Demon King, we're likely to suffer for it. I want you to return to Rausten Palace and rest yourself.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, L'Arachel. However, I must stay with the company. I have to believe there's something I can do to help him. Lyon was always so kind. He wanted nothing more than to help people. It's too terrible to picture him imprisoned by the Demon King. Imprisoned... with no hope of salvation.

speaker: Soldier
text: This way! The enemy went into the recesses of this valley.

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother. Do you smell something?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Smell?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. An unpleasant odor, like sulphur. It's emanating from this valley.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Are those... eggs?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Gorgon eggs... There are so many...

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother! The eggs! They've started to hatch!

speaker: Ephraim
text: No... He's led us into a trap! Watch out! Everyone, steer clear of those eggs!

speaker: L'Arachel
text: E-Ephraim. I must ask that you slow down! If you travel so swiftly, we cannot keep up.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I'm riding ahead. I can't waste any more time. I must catch the Demon King as quickly as possible.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: And when you find him? Tell me, what then?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...... ...L'Arachel. Rausten is the spiritual heart of Magvel. They keep the ancient lore. You're their princess. You must know something about the demons of legend. I do not need consolation or peace of mind. I need facts. Lyon, as he is now... Can he be saved?

speaker: L'Arachel
text: I'm sorry... To the best of my knowledge, there's nothing to be done.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Your friend Lyon's body has already been claimed by the Demon King. Once it's gone that far, there's nothing that can be done. When the Demon King takes over someone, he devours his spirit, his very soul. Even if his hold on Lyon's body could be released, that body would have no soul. There is no power in Rausten...not even the Sacred Stone... that can perform so great a miracle as to restore a shattered soul.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Is that so... I understand. Let's go, L'Arachel.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: W-wait a moment. Hmph! Were you listening to me at all? I'm sorry, but the prince...

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...I heard you. There's no hope of saving Lyon. And if I cannot save him... I will bring him peace with my own hands.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: ...... But... Can you do it? Even if you get the chance, can you bring yourself to kill him? It would be best if you and your sister left this to the rest of us.

speaker: Ephraim
text: No...I'm going to do it. Lyon is my friend. The Demon King stole him from me. I will be the one to kill him.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: If your mind's made up, there's not much I can do, is there? Let's go then.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I'm sorry, L'Arachel.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: There's no need for you to apologize. Your words alone have won my forgiveness.

speaker: Eirika
text: Wait!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Hold, Eirika! Don't go anywhere alone!

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon's back there! I won't abandon him!

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon! Lyoooon!

speaker: Lyon
text: Ei... Eirika...

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon? Where are you?

speaker: Lyon
text: I'm... here.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon... Hold on. I'll save you!

speaker: Lyon
text: Forgive me... Eirika... It's over... for me... The Demon King has devoured my soul... I'm mad... and I'm going... to die...

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon... What should I do? How can I help you? Tell me! I'll do anything, but you have to tell me!

speaker: Lyon
text: ...The Sacred Stone... Give me... the stone...

speaker: Eirika
text: What?

speaker: Lyon
text: My body... is being ravaged by the Demon King. If it continues unchecked, nothing can save me. But if I had the power of a Sacred Stone... I could save... my soul...

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon...

speaker: Lyon
text: Please... Eirika... I don't want to die yet... I want to live... with you... If I had the Sacred Stone... I could... heal myself... Please...

speaker: Eirika
text: Could the Sacred Stone really do that? Could it heal you?

speaker: Lyon
text: Yes... Please... Eirika...

speaker: Eirika
text: I... trust you, Lyon. I have a stone right here.

speaker: Lyon
text: ...... Ah... It's true... A Sacred Stone... Ha ha...... Heh heh heh... An abominable Sacred Stone... Here in my grasp.

speaker: Eirika
text: What? Lyon? No... You're--

speaker: Lyon
text: Ha ha... heh heh heh. How disappointing for you. This body is mine now. Nothing remains of your dear boy's soul.

speaker: Eirika
text: You only pretended to be Lyon... You deceived me. Return him! Return Lyon now!

speaker: Lyon
text: I'm afraid there's no hope of that. You see, I've devoured him. Bite by bite, slowly. How I savored it. Nothing remains but this suit of flesh I wear. There is nothing to heal. Not even the power of a Sacred Stone can craft something from nothing. He cannot be saved.

speaker: Eirika
text: That... can't...

speaker: Lyon
text: Ha ha... Bwah ha ha ha! I love how humans look when they're drowning in despair. Now is the time to be done with this stone.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika!

speaker: Lyon
text: Oh... caught up, have you? Hmm, I've changed my mind. I'll leave the girl alive. Take her. There are memories of you in this flesh I wear. And I hunger to see your face bear more suffering and pain.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika! Wake up! Do you know who I am?

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother... Lyon? Lyon's...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika... I know. Don't speak.

speaker: Eirika
text: I... I... Lyon is... He's really...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Let's go back. L'Arachel will be worried. Eirika... You can weep now. As much as you need. Weep for me, as well...

speaker: Seth
text: ...It appears the enemy fled over this cliff.

speaker: Eirika
text: I see no way we can pursue him now...

speaker: Ephraim
text: So he got away, is that it?

speaker: L'Arachel
text: There's no cause to be discouraged. Beyond these mountains lie the heart of Darkling Woods. Before we enter, we must head north to Rausten. After all, we still need the Sacred Stone of Rausten. As long as even one stone remains, all hope is not lost. Come on. We cannot give in to despair when victory draws so near!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Hold! Demon King!

speaker: Lyon
text: Hmph... You again?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...I’ve one thing to ask before I slay you. Where is Lyon now? When I kill you... will Lyon return?

speaker: Lyon
text: Heh heh... How little you understand. Lyon is no longer part of your world. He cannot be restored. I have devoured every last delicious scrap of his small soul.

speaker: Ephraim
text: You monster!!!

speaker: Lyon
text: Why does this upset you? What does it matter what happens to that weakling now? He was a sickly cretin whose trivial dreams were nothing but hopeless–

speaker: Ephraim
text: SHUT UP! He was my friend. We’ll always be friends. I made a promise to him. You stole Lyon’s soul and corrupted his dreams! I’ll crush the life out of you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Gwaa...ah... What?! My body–!

speaker: Lyon
text: Don’t resist. Soon you will be unable to move at all...

speaker: Lyon
text: So you had the Stone of Renais with you after all. If you’ll just give me a moment to destroy it...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Stop...urgh!

speaker: Lyon
text: And that’s the end of your Sacred Stone... Now then, Prince Ephraim. Are you prepared?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Curse you... Do it!!! Finish me! With my dying breath, I’ll cut you to ribbons.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What are you waiting for?! Are you frightened?

speaker: Lyon
text: ...Tell me, Prince Ephraim of Renais. Why do you fight on? Do you think you accomplish your sad desire? Can you restore your homeland from the grave? Overthrow evil? Or protect your sister?

speaker: Ephraim
text: You won’t kill me. I’ll do all these things, fiend... All these things and more. For my friend Lyon... I will avenge his soul. I won’t let his gentle image be defiled...

speaker: Lyon
text: ...... I guess it’s true... You haven’t changed, Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Huh? What’s– What did you say?

speaker: Ephraim
text: What’s going on? You’re the Demon King... You’re the ancient evil... You told me you’d devoured Lyon’s soul, that nothing remained. So why did you... How do you know about me? It’s not... Could it be...you...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Is that you...Lyon?

speaker: Lyon
text: Uh-huh... That’s right. It’s me, Lyon, Prince of Grado. I’m not the Demon King. Sorry, Ephraim. That whole thing about the Demon King eating my soul and me dying? That was all a lie.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Wha– Why?! Why would you say such a thing?!

speaker: Lyon
text: Listen, Ephraim. I’ve always loved you. I’ve always hated you. I’ve always looked up to you. I wanted to be just like you. Then one day I realized... Someone like me could never become someone like you. You and Eirika are...overpowering. You blinded me with your radiance. How could I live in your shadows and not seethe with jealousy?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon...

speaker: Lyon
text: Before I ever touched the Dark Stone... I had a vision. A vision of the future of Magvel. I saw myself standing with two roads stretched out before me. One led to the Demon King, devouring both my body and soul. The other showed me the power to fight the Demon King’s dominion. And I, well.. ...Gaa...urgh.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon!

speaker: Lyon
text: Then I acquired the Dark Stone. The Demon King began to eat my soul and corrupt my flesh. I almost vanished beneath the Demon King’s mantle. The I remembered you... My mind blazed into wakefulness. All at once, my mind shouted out, I will not be devoured! Just as I was about to lose myself to the Demon King. I was able to drive him back. The Demon King’s desires are simple–foul, but uncomplicated. He wants nothing but the destruction, conquest, and subjugation of man. These shallow desires are nothing to the dreams of the human heart. And of the two roads I had seen, I chose the latter.

speaker: Lyon
text: But I didn’t want to appear before you here in the role of Lyon. Lyon, the piteous victim... The Demon King, the fiendish villain... It was all an act–high drama for you all, to suit this grand occasion. That’s right, Ephraim. I’m the Demon King... The Demon King is me.

speaker: Ephraim
text: You lie... It can’t be. It’s not possible. Lyon was... My friend was kind and caring... He was a good person... But you... You are not that person!

speaker: Lyon
text: Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: You... You’re the Demon King. Lyon is gone, and you are a liar! You’re trying to trick me. You’re trying to confuse me! I’m right, aren’t I?! Tell me I’m right, Lyon! TELL ME!

speaker: Lyon
text: I’m sorry, Ephraim. Ephraim, listen to me. Ten days from now... When the moon is swallowed by shadow... In Darkling Woods, I will perform a ceremony... Through this ceremony, I will gain immense power. Power not change not only Grado, but the entire world.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Change...the world?

speaker: Lyon
text: But after that... I cannot save myself. I’ll become the Demon King of old and try to destroy all of mankind. Ephraim. If you want to stop this, you must come to Darkling Woods. I want you to come. I need you to stop me. You must promise.

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother! Are you... You look ill.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...Is that you, Eirika? Don’t worry. It’s nothing.

speaker: Eirika
text: B-but...you’re so pale. What happened?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: Y-yes?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon is... Lyon’s my friend. Forever and always.

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother... Let’s get out of here. L’Arachel and the others are worried.

speaker: Seth
text: ...It appears the enemy fled over this cliff.

speaker: Eirika
text: I see no way we can pursue him now...

speaker: Ephraim
text: So he got away, is that it?

speaker: Vigarde
text: The Stone of Frelia has already been taken care of... How is it the Stone of Renais continues to elude us? Glen. Valter. Find the children of Renais. Find them and take from them the bracelets that they wear. Glen, take Eirika. Valter, take Ephraim. Find them. Conquer them.

speaker: Glen
text: Yes, Your Majesty...

speaker: Valter
text: Ha ha... Eirika, eh? She's a ripe little peach. And her brother, Ephraim... He's better prey than I'd imagined. I can feel my blood rushing at the thought. This might be fun after all.

speaker: Vigarde
text: Caellach. Riev. Shatter the remaining Sacred Stones. Caellach, take Jehanna. Riev, take Rausten. Go. Crush the Sacred Stones they house.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... As you will. I'll begin making arrangements for Rausten's downfall immediately...

speaker: Caellach
text: Bah! Why am I stuck with Jehanna? Accursed ill luck. I became a mercenary to escape that wretched place, and now I must go back?

speaker: Vigarde
text: Duessel. Go to Frelia. Punish the Frelian army and their commander, Ephraim.

speaker: Duessel
text: Begging your pardon, Your Majesty... Now that you've conquered Renais, what are your plans for her citizens? The country is in ruins. Thieves and bandits swagger about as if--

speaker: Vigarde
text: Leave them...

speaker: Duessel
text: But, sire...

speaker: Selena
text: Sir Duessel. The emperor has spoken. Please...

speaker: Vigarde
text: Selena. Remain here in the capital. We shall have new orders for you shortly.

speaker: Selena
text: Understood.

speaker: Duessel
text: Please, Your Majesty! Grant me the privilege of a single question.

speaker: Vigarde
text: ...... ...You vex us.

speaker: Duessel
text: Your Majesty, you know that I will gladly lay down my life for an honorable cause! But these orders--and all of our recent actions--they are not just! If I saw any way in which this invasion protected Grado, I would hold my tongue. But now, Renais is left ungoverned to drown in chaos, and we gain nothing! Why do you wage this war? What is it you hope to achieve? You've sent our men to fight and die for nothing! This isn't war--it's murder!

speaker: Vigarde
text: ...Duessel. This decision is ours to make. You have no voice in these matters.

speaker: Duessel
text: Punish me if you must, Your Majesty, but I implore you! Please rethink this!! If this continues, Grado will--

speaker: Vigarde
text: Duessel. Go to Frelia. Crush the Frelian army and he who leads them, Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Duessel
text: Your Majesty!

speaker: Vigarde
text: Have you gone deaf? Duessel. Go to Frelia. Crush the Frelian army and he who leads them, Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Duessel
text: ...... Yes, Your Majesty.

speaker: Soldier
text: Commander Gheb! We captured a pegasus knight snooping about outside.

speaker: Tana
text: Let me go! Stop it! That hurts!

speaker: Gheb
text: Ooooh... You didn't tell me she was such a treat for the eyes. Heh heh... This is a prize worth catching.

speaker: Tana
text: I-I came for Ephraim. If you do anything to me, he will not be merciful.

speaker: Gheb
text: Heh heh... I like her. Throw her in a cell. I'll spend the evening giving her a thorough interrogation. Heh heh heh...

speaker: Tana
text: You b-beast!

speaker: Seth
text: That is Fort Rigwald. It has stood unconquered for generations. Its defenses are legendary. It is the jewel of Grado's fortifications, and its walls have never been breached.

speaker: Ephraim
text: And if we don't capture it, any attack on the capital will be pointless. Tell me what you see, Seth. Do we have the power to take it?

speaker: Seth
text: It's a daunting task. The enemy has the advantage of both terrain and numbers.

speaker: Ephraim
text: But what about in morale?

speaker: Seth
text: Do you suspect the soldiers may be unwilling to fight?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Anything's possible. This war is a sudden thing, but Grado and Renais had long been friendly. Before these hostilities, our nations were allies... No, closer even than that. This is the emperor's war, but the hearts of the people are not so swift to change. For example, General Duessel, one of the Imperial Three they call Obsidian... He was the one who taught me what I know about fighting with the lance. Duessel's sympathies are sure to remain with Renais--and with our cause. He is loyal to Grado, but he has no love of war. I'm sure he will speak with me.

speaker: Ephraim
text: And more than that, Prince Lyon has been my friend for years. He can be timid at times and perhaps was unable to oppose his father in this. But I'm sure he detests this fighting and shares my opinions.

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: There must be some Grado soldiers within the castle who do not want to fight. If we can rush the fort and seize the throne room, I believe they will surrender.

speaker: Seth
text: ...Optimism here may be deadly. Still, it's a far better plan than challenging the main army face-to-face.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika is on her way to Rausten to help end this conflict. We cannot afford to wait here for much longer. We must take this fort and then press on to the capital itself. Let's go!

speaker: Fighter
text: Attack! We're under attack! ...Looks to be Frelian troops. Their commander is... Prince Ephraim of Renais!

speaker: Soldier
text: Renais? This whole thing stinks. My younger sister and her husband were living in Renais... What is the emperor thinking, starting this war? I think--

speaker: Gheb
text: ...Hey.

speaker: Soldier
text: Ah!

speaker: Gheb
text: Yeah, I heard you. Talking about not fighting, are you? Losing your nerve? The punishment for treason is harsh. You'll burn at the stake.

speaker: Soldier
text: B-but-- It's not just me! Even General Duessel is opposed to this war!

speaker: Gheb
text: Duessel? You'd side with that washed-up coward? And who is your commanding officer? Is it Duessel? Come on, out with it!

speaker: Soldier
text: Y-you are, Sir Gheb.

speaker: Gheb
text: That's right. So that should make it clear whose orders you follow, eh? You got that, dolts? If you do, then shut up and get in formation. No one cares whether you minnows live or die anyway. Got it?

speaker: Amelia
text: W-wait a moment! That's a horrible thing to say!

speaker: Gheb
text: And who are you supposed to be? Your name! Out with it!

speaker: Amelia
text: I-I'm Amelia... I was assigned to this fort today! I am a soldier of Grado. I am not a slave!

speaker: Gheb
text: What's this now? You're a girl? You've got a lot of nerve talking like that to your commander, recruit. Looks like I'm going to have to teach you about the chain of command.

speaker: Amelia
text: Ah...

speaker: Soldier
text: Commander Gheb! Enemy troops approaching!

speaker: Gheb
text: Grrr! Stinking interruptions... Form up, you useless worms. Don't let those dogs near the throne. Grado cannot afford to lose a brilliant tactician of my stature! No one will blink if any of you worthless toads dies. But if I die-- You should be happy to fight, kill, and die in my service!

speaker: Amelia
text: I became a soldier to honor the emperor, General Duessel, and the people of Grado. But this...this is wrong!

speaker: Soldier
text: That's the lot of a soldier. We're pawns in the games of kings and emperors. We fight as ordered, and we die as ordered. That's it. C'mon, time to go.

speaker: Tana
text: Oh, what a fool I've been... I came all this way to help Ephraim, and I end up getting captured again. That General Gheb had the creepiest eyes...and that laugh! Oh! Hurry, Ephraim... Please. Hurry and rescue me.

speaker: Franz
text: You...you're a girl?!

speaker: Amelia
text: Ah! Don't make fun of me! I'm a soldier of Grado! Prepare yourself, Frelian dog!

speaker: Franz
text: W-wait a minute!

speaker: Amelia
text: Oof...

speaker: Franz
text: Are, are you all right? It's not surprising you fell over from that stance. Can you get up?

speaker: Amelia
text: Sh-shut up!

speaker: Franz
text: Did you hurt your knee? I know how it feels. I did it often enough as a recruit myself. To be honest, I still do it more than I should.

speaker: Franz
text: I'm Franz. I'm a Knight of Renais. What's your name?

speaker: Amelia
text: I'm Amelia.

speaker: Franz
text: Amelia, do you think I could ask you to surrender? This may be odd, but I really have no desire to fight you.

speaker: Franz
text: I get the feeling you don't want to fight either. Am I right?

speaker: Amelia
text: I... B-but... I've heard Prince Ephraim takes female prisoners and uses them as palace slaves. If I surrender, will I be forced to work in the palace, too?

speaker: Franz
text: N-no, don't be silly! Prince Ephraim would never do such a thing...I think...

speaker: Amelia
text: You think?

speaker: Franz
text: No, he wouldn't! Of course not. You have my word of honor.

speaker: Amelia
text: ...Well, you seem sincere. I'll trust you, Franz.

speaker: Ephraim
text: You're a Grado soldier? But you're just a child.

speaker: Amelia
text: I am not a child! I'm a soldier of Grado, and I will defeat every soldier of Frelia I meet!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Is that so? Guess I'm ready then.

speaker: Amelia
text: Um...

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...Is that the stance you're going to use? You'll drop your lance that way. I'm Prince Ephraim of Renais. Why don't you surrender and come with me?

speaker: Amelia
text: Wha-what are you going to do to me?!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Calm down. As long as you don't try to stab me, I won't do a thing to harm you.

speaker: Amelia
