text: You lie! You're a liar! Everyone knows about Prince Ephraim of Renais. He's a beast who attacks any woman he sees...

speaker: Ephraim
text: ......Right, this has gone far enough. I am not going to hurt you. If you're scared, throw down your weapon and run away. But...if you're willing to listen, I'd like to ask for your help. You must realize this whole war is madness, right? Something is wrong in Grado.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Tana?! What are you doing here?

speaker: Tana
text: I came here in hopes of helping you in some way. But while I was looking for you, I got captured by Grado troops.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Is that so? Well, I'm glad to see you're unharmed. Tana, you should head back to Castle Frelia immediately. King Hayden must be worried about you.

speaker: Tana
text: No! Ephraim, I came all this way so I could help you!

speaker: Ephraim
text: And yet, here I am, helping you.

speaker: Tana
text: Ah, well... Yes, that may be true, but-- But I've been so worried about you, Ephraim!

speaker: Ephraim
text: I see. Oh, please don't look at me with those teary eyes. If you're really determined to help, then you're welcome to come with us. But you must promise me not to try anything reckless.

speaker: Tana
text: Ephraim... Thank you. I knew that you would understand how I feel.

speaker: Gheb
text: Y-you wench... You're that recruit, aren't you? Do you think you can betray me and get away with it?

speaker: Amelia
text: Your threats no longer hold any power over me. I-I am not your pawn!

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, the rest of the enemy troops have been routed.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Bring me one of the prisoners. I have a question I need answered.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I'm going to ask you a question. If you've no wish to answer, remain silent. If you wish this conflict to end quickly, however, you will cooperate.

speaker: Soldier
text: ...... ...What do you want?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Why has Grado invaded Renais?

speaker: Soldier
text: ...I can't say. This war began on the emperor's orders. Soldiers like me haven't the foggiest idea what he's after.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Then tell me this: where is General Duessel?

speaker: Soldier
text: In the capital. The general's been opposed to this war from the start. He's been pleading with the emperor for days now, but the emperor ignores him. They say some are questioning the general's loyalty. He's putting his standing--and his life-- in danger by being so vocal.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Is that so... Well, it appears General Duessel remains the same true man I knew before. What about Prince Lyon? Where's he been through all of this? Why didn't he do anything to temper his father's aggression?

speaker: Soldier
text: ...... According to rumors... Emperor Vigarde was convinced to start this war by none other than the prince himself.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What did you say? That's ridiculous! I know Prince Lyon well. No one hates fighting more than he does. He would never do anything to trigger all this bloodshed!

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, please calm down.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...I'm sorry.

speaker: Ephraim
text: We leave the prisoners and the fort to the Frelian troops. Seth, I intend for us to press on toward the capital. At some point, I expect we'll find either Duessel or Lyon. I'm sure we can convince them to join us in stopping Emperor Vigarde.

speaker: Seth
text: Understood. But I have misgivings, my prince. General Duessel and Prince Lyon are both men of Grado. If we are forced into conflict with them...

speaker: Ephraim
text: It won't happen. Duessel was my teacher, and I know he is a man of character. And I've known Lyon since we were children. He, Eirika, and I are old friends.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I understand your concerns. If worse comes to worst and steel is drawn, I will not hesitate. I'll fight and kill anyone who thinks to oppose me. Are you satisfied, Seth?

speaker: Seth
text: Yes... I apologize for my rudeness. Your father is gone, and that means you are king of Renais. There is no other. I just ask that you not throw yourself into needless danger.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I hear you. The decisions I make affect more than my own life. Once this war is finished, I will rebuild Renais with Eirika. That is my mission.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh.

speaker: Myrrh
text: What is it?

speaker: Ephraim
text: You must return to Frelia. I cannot take you any farther on this journey.

speaker: Myrrh
text: What? No. I want to stay with you...

speaker: Ephraim
text: No, Myrrh. I'm continuing on to the Grado capital. It's going to be very dangerous. I can't protect you--not as well as I'd like to, anyway.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Everything comes from that direction. I can feel my lost dragonstone... And that's not all. The dark energy still flows unchecked... I cannot go home while it stains the air...

speaker: Ephraim
text: But...

speaker: Myrrh
text: Please, Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...Very well. Ah, I simply cannot refuse you anything. Your eyes remind me too much of Eirika. You must not stray from my side, do you understand?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Yes, I will not stray...

speaker: Vigarde
text: Selena. Your orders.

speaker: Selena
text: I am ready, Your Majesty. In your service, I am prepared to do--

speaker: Vigarde
text: Duessel has left for Bethroen. Take a battalion and follow him.

speaker: Selena
text: Understood. When I arrive, I will place my troops at his disposal.

speaker: Vigarde
text: No... You will not. You will strike Duessel down.

speaker: Selena
text: Wha...

speaker: Vigarde
text: Duessel is a traitor. He has abandoned his country and sided with Renais. The punishment for treason is death.

speaker: Selena
text: B-but... General Duessel a traitor? That's just not possible! There must be a mistake...

speaker: Selena
text: No... I did not mean that you are mistaken, Your Majesty. But...but...

speaker: Vigarde
text: Selena. You have your orders. You will execute Duessel.

speaker: Selena
text: ...... ...Your Majesty. Will you allow me to ask you a question?

speaker: Selena
text: When Your Majesty saw fit to make me a general, you shared with me some words of wisdom. I remember the moment quite clearly. You told me the role of an imperial general is that of the shield, not the blade. We are here to protect our citizens, you said--not to threaten our neighbors. I have never forgotten your words, Your Majesty. I have held them to my breast. They govern my every action as general. Your Majesty, that sentiment is still alive, and--

speaker: Vigarde
text: Go.

speaker: Selena
text: ...... I humbly acknowledge your orders. Your Majesty... I am the empire's servant. I am Your Majesty's vassal. I am General Selena, the Fluorspar of the Grado Empire.

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, are you well?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika!

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Oh...Seth?

speaker: Seth
text: Yes, it’s me. Please, you must rest. If we continue like this, you’ll...

speaker: Eirika
text: No... it’s all right. We’re all suffering... We’re still completely surrounded by Grado’s armies... We may all die at any moment... I can’t lose focus now. Has anything changed?

speaker: Seth
text: Unfortunately, no. On every front, our forces meet with defeat upon defeat. Rausten’s knights are scattered and worn, and the enemy is closing in around them. And this accursed sand... Most of the units can’t get proper footing and are being slowed down. Mounted units are having the worst time, as their movement is severely limited. Princess Eirika... I ask that you leave for safety. We’ll use flying units and magic users to hold the foe here.

speaker: Eirika
text: No. I will not retreat. If I give up now... My brother would not forgive me. I’m the princess of Renais. I will fight, either to victory or to death. Brother, I...

speaker: Ephraim
text: There’s Jehanna Hall... It’s nothing but a ruin now. Blast! I don’t know what’s happened, but... I’d better get to Eirika and the others as soon as possible.

speaker: Seth
text: I’ve discovered which of Grado’s generals lead the forces surrounding the hall. Valter the Moonstone and Caellach the Tiger Eye. Two of the strongest of the empire’s generals, with near-peerless forces. Above all else, we must rescue Princess Eirika, and yet... If you fall, Prince Ephraim, we’re all finished. And this accursed sand... Most of the units can’t get proper footing and are being slowed down. Mounted units are having the worst time, as their movement is severely limited. Some of us can move better than others, though... A combination of magic wielders and sky riders should give us some advantage. Whatever we do, we must move cautiously.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I understand. This is just like the battle for Renvall. We either rescue Eirika or defeat all the enemy troops. If we accomplish either goal, victory is ours. Let’s move!

speaker: Riev
text: Valter... You should stop playing around. If you don’t’ finish off Eirika’s forces swiftly... Her brother’s left the capital. He should be arriving here shortly. You don’t want to be fighting her still when he arrives. Trust me. We are equals here in Grado’s army. Would you like me to assist?

speaker: Valter
text: All you need to do is vanish, you disgusting old man. Eirika is mine. I won’t let you have her. She is so strong, so beautiful... She’s the prey I’ve dreamed of.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Your fangs are still sharp, eh? Good. Very good. Ah, Valter... You’re a beast. You’re bound to no country. You care nothing for friend or foe. Kill a man, claim a woman... You live for nothing more, you wretched beast. That’s your strength. That’s what makes you stronger than any many alive. A beast acts without remorse. Man’s morality cannot win. It’s nature’s way... The stage is all yours, Valter. Do not fail to get the girl’s bracelet. Our master demands it...

speaker: Valter
text: The time is nigh, Eirika... Come to me!

speaker: Lyon
text: How goes it, Caellach?

speaker: Caellach
text: Ah, Prince Lyon. Thank you, Your Highness, for gracing me with...your royal...er...

speaker: Lyon
text: You can stop. There’s no need for you to put on airs. You were made general for your military prowess, not your flowery speech.

speaker: Caellach
text: And an honor it is. You know, Prince Lyon, you’ve got a lot of nerve. You’re really worked over your dear friend the princess of Renais. Are you satisfied?

speaker: Lyon
text: Is there some reason you ask?

speaker: Caellach
text: No, not really. I just wanted to see how you’d react. That’s all.

speaker: Lyon
text: She... Eirika has always been a very important person in my life. Both she and her brother have been friends of mine for a long time. Tell me, Caellach, do you have any friends to speak of?

speaker: Caellach
text: Huh? Yeah, I got one. An old mercenary I fought with, went by the name of Joshua. He was a fool and a scoundrel, but now that he’s gone, I miss the lad. I don’t know where he’s at or what he’s doing, but...

speaker: Lyon
text: Do you miss that life? Do you ever want to be a mercenary again, to see him?

speaker: Caellach
text: Nope. The time we worked together was fun and all, but... No. I don’t want to end up another no-name mercenary lying dead in a ditch. I’d rather serve the Grado Empire and make a name for myself. I’m going to see how far my axe will take me. And then, one day...

speaker: Lyon
text: One day, you’ll kill me and be emperor in my stead. Is that it?

speaker: Caellach
text: Uh... That’s...

speaker: Lyon
text: It’s all right. Think whatever you like if it helps you do your duty. As long as you do what I assign you to do, I’m happy. But for now, I’m going. You know what you need to do.

speaker: Caellach
text: Yep, leave it to me. I am General Caellach, the Tiger Eye of the Grado Imperial Army, after all! Once my prey is within my reach, I never let it escape. Too bad for the princess, but they’ve no chance of winning. None at all.

speaker: Ephraim
text: That building beyond the dunes is Jehanna Hall. I expect that’s where we’ll find Eirika and her companions. Duessel, Knoll. It’s time we rescued Eirika. I’ll need all your strength.

speaker: Duessel
text: Of course, Your Highness. I’ve pledged my service and my axe. You shall have both.

speaker: Knoll
text: Princess Eirika... She’s a friend of Prince Lyon’s, isn’t she? I’ll do what I can to help you. I feel like that is what Prince Lyon would want.

speaker: Ephraim
text: The enemy’s numbers are great, but we do not need to face them alone. We must move quickly to join forces with Eirika and her company. I’m sure Seth and Innes will be there waiting for us. Let’s move!

speaker: Eirika
text: Prince Innes... And Saleh. I’m sorry. I’m absolutely powerless here...

speaker: Innes
text: Eirika, you have nothing to apologize for. We’re not defeated yet. Jehanna Hall has fallen, that much is true. But if we can hold out until Ephraim arrives, we still have a chance of victory.

speaker: Saleh
text: And reports place Lady Myrrh at Prince Ephraim’s side. It is my duty to protect her. I will not die without having fulfilled my obligation to her.

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re right... I made a promise, too. I told Ephraim I would live to see him again. We just have to pull together. All of us. We just have to hold out a little longer. If we pool our strength now, I vow that we will all live to see our friends again.

speaker: Man
text: According to this ancient document... ...There was a huge battle here long, long ago. Every day, I’m out here digging up ancient weapons and artifacts out of the sand. There are still more to be found, of that you can be sure. It’s even said a long-dead sage left a copy of Metis’s Tome out here... Oh! But I won’t give that to anyone if I find it. Not a chance!

speaker: Young Man
text: All the highest generals in Grado’s army receive titles named after gemstones. The emperor currently has six gemstones fighting in his service. Caellach, the Tiger Eye, commands the forces fighting here. The Moonstone, Valter, is taking part in this battle as well. Glen, also known as the Sunstone, died in the mountains of Carcino. Selena Fluorspar was killed in western Grado. Duessel, whom they call Obsidian, is missing in action... The Blood Beryl, whose real name is Riev, has also gone missing. Hm? How do I know all this? I know I may look young and naive, but this is my job. I’m here to pass this information along to help you out. And it’s good information, too, so don’t waste it.

speaker: Old Woman
text: Jehanna Hall...has fallen. I wonder what’s become of Queen Ismaire. You there... Take this, and do some good with it.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika!

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother? Is that really you? You’re not some phantom, are you?

speaker: Ephraim
text: No, it’s really me. Hold. Enemies approach.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Ephraim. Even when we were children, you were always there to protect me.

speaker: Innes
text: It’s been a long time, Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Innes, is that you?

speaker: Innes
text: You arrived sooner than I’d expected. Eirika is safe. You’ve no need to worry.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’ve heard that you’ve been watching over Eirika. I should like to offer you my gratitude.

speaker: Innes
text: It’s not necessary. Besides, there’s still a war to be won. We can’t rest easy till every last Grado soldier’s been defeated.

speaker: Ephraim
text: You’re right. Let’s go!

speaker: Tana
text: B-brother.

speaker: Innes
text: Tana? Why are you here? I told you to remain at Castle Frelia.

speaker: Tana
text: Don’t talk to me like that. I’m a fully sworn knight of Frelia, you know? I came all the way here with Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Innes
text: What? With that man?

speaker: Tana
text: Brother! Ephraim’s a good person. We can talk about this later. I still see enemy troops about. I think we should join forces and fight together.

speaker: Innes
text: Working together is, of course, the best strategy. But don’t do anything foolish, Tana. Who knows what Father would think.

speaker: Tana
text: I understand. You try not to be overly heroic yourself, Brother.

speaker: Tana
text: Oh, Eirika! Here you are!

speaker: Eirika
text: Tana! You’ve come as well?!

speaker: Tana
text: Yes, I came all the way with Ephraim. I’m just so happy to see you’re safe.

speaker: Eirika
text: Tana. Thank you so much for coming to my aid.

speaker: Tana
text: Well, of course I came. That’s natural. We’re friends after all!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, are you well?

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth! If you’re here...

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim is safe as well. Princess Eirika, we will stop the remaining enemy soldiers here. Would you please take caution and think of your own safety?

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, Seth. You’ve saved me so many times since the fall of Renais...

speaker: Seth
text: It is my duty. Let’s go, Princess Eirika.

speaker: Ewan
text: Ah! Teacher.

speaker: Saleh
text: Ewan? What are you doing here?

speaker: Ewan
text: I came with Prince Ephraim and his friends. I’ve done a lot of good work, Teacher.

speaker: Saleh
text: Is that so... Well, if you all hadn’t shown up, I’m sure we’d be dead now. You’ve saved us, Ewan. Thank you. I am in your debt.

speaker: Ewan
text: Do you mean that? As a reward, will you teach me some more powerful magic?

speaker: Saleh
text: ...I suppose I should at that. But all in good time, Ewan.

speaker: Ewan
text: Yahoo!

speaker: Caellach
text: You’re a stepping-stone... And I’m moving up. Don’t take it personally.

speaker: Caellach
text: Bla-Blast... A bit more, and...a crown... would have been...mine...

speaker: Valter
text: I’ve no use for these bloodless minnows... Give me prey that will sate my bloodlust... I hunger!

speaker: Valter
text: Urggh... Gaaaah!

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika!

speaker: Eirika
text: Oh, Ephraim... I’ve missed you so.

speaker: Ephraim
text: And I’ve missed you. I can’t tell you how happy I am to see you safe. Oh, I almost forgot. I have something to give you.

speaker: Eirika
text: What are these?

speaker: Ephraim
text: These are called Sacred Twins. We took these relics from Grado. The dark tome Gleipnir and the black axe Garm... I doubt either of us can use them, but... Why not see if one osf your companions can use them. They might have better luck.

speaker: Eirika
text: They’re from Grado? Does this mean Grado Keep has fallen?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes. I conquered the capital and defeated Emperor Vigarde. But still...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Eirika, may I make a suggestion? We’ve been able to join forces here so... How about if we all get together and trade information. There are people on both sides waiting after all.

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother!

speaker: Ephraim
text: You’ve done well, Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thanks to you, Ephraim. Ah... Wait a moment. I’ve something to give you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: These are...

speaker: Eirika
text: These are the Sacred Twin relics of Jehanna. The ice sword Audhulma and the wind blade Excalibur.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Jehanna’s Sacred Twins? But it seems like we were too late... Jehanna Hall has fallen.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, and Queen Ismaire died resisting Grado.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Now that we have, at last, been reunited once again, perhaps this would be a good time to share information. I’m sure we all are most anxious to learn of what has happened.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I see unfamiliar faces among you here, so allow me to introduce myself. I am Ephraim, Eirika’s brother and crown prince of Renais.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: I’m Princess L’Arachel of Rausten. The pleasure is mine, of course.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’ll begin by telling you of how we’ve fared in our mission. We seized the Grado capital and defeated her emperor, Vigarde. Grado’s capital guard have, to a man, surrendered and laid down their arms. Pockets of resistance remain, but the war itself is over.

speaker: Innes
text: Is that so?

speaker: Ephraim
text: However, something remains that still bothers me. A Grado man named Knoll told me about something called a Dark Stone.?Their mages had uncovered lore that led them to craft a powerful magic stone. This Dark Stone may have been the catalyst of Grado’s transformation. It seems to be the source of that black wave of energy Myrrh described. Vigarde died some time ago, but the power of the stone played him like a puppet. The war and everything that passed since was planned by the Dark Stone’s master.

speaker: Innes
text: Well? Who is it?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...I still can’t believe it, but I’ll tell you nonetheless. According to Knoll, the man behind this is Lyon, the imperial prince. He said Lyon’s got the Dark Stone.

speaker: Innes
text: Figures it’s Prince Lyon...

speaker: Eirika
text: No, that doesn’t make any sense. Ephraim and I know Lyon better than that. We’ve been friends for years. Lyon’s not the sort of person who could start a war like this.

speaker: Innes
text: But, Eirika...

speaker: Eirika
text: I saw Lyon recently. Ephraim, you might know this, but after I abandoned the sea route to Rausten, I traveled overland with Prince Innes to Jehanna. We ran into trouble with Grado’s forces, and I chanced upon Lyon. He didn’t share the details of his situation, but he intimated that he was on our side. Despite all appearances, he was on our side. So Lyon...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika, I also met Lyon.

speaker: Eirika
text: Did you really?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes. But, he was like a completely different person. To be honest, he didn’t seem to be completely...human.

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim... What are you saying?

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’ll tell you what I saw. I found Lyon inside Grado Keep. This is what he told me: He said he was behind this war. He said he’d befriended us solely so that, one day, he could invade Renais... He told me he killed our father.

speaker: Eirika
text: That... That can’t...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I know. I can’t believe it either. I refuse to believe it. How could he have planned all this since he was a child... I simply can’t fathom it. I’ve heard Lyon changed when he acquired the Dark Stone. I’ve no interest in magic, but... There was something uncanny about him. It seemed almost as though he were being controlled by something himself.

speaker: Innes
text: The two of you might find this hard to accept, but... The state of Prince Lyon’s heart matters little. He has the Dark Stone. That rock is the cause of all that’s happened. The prince must be stopped.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Not yet. There is something that needs doing first.

speaker: Eirika
text: L’Arachel?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Prince Ephraim, I do believe you felt it as well. The Dark Stone held by Prince Lyon... It exudes a malefic miasma... We might be able to handle Prince Lyon alone, but that stone is beyond our ken.

speaker: Eirika
text: Then what do you suggest?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: The Sacred Stones.

speaker: Eirika
text: The Sacred Stones?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We’ve all heard the legend of the five Sacred Stones. They alone possessed the power to seal the Demon King away forever. So, of course, to dispel demonic magic, we must use the Sacred Stones!

speaker: Innes
text: You expect us to pin the outcome of this war on some fool legend?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...Not just the legend. We also have hope. According to Lyon, he has already seen to the destruction of Grado’s, Frelia’s, and Jehanna’s stones.

speaker: Eirika
text: Hm. That explains something... Grado forces attacked me, intent on destroying the Stone of Renais. If that could be the reason they chose to invade Renais... The power of the Sacred Stones may be greater than we’d ever known.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Yes, exactly! If we acquire a Sacred Stone, we’ll be able to oppose the Dark Stone’s might!

speaker: Innes
text: But three of the stones have been shattered, and our options are few. Do you suppose that, during the invasion of Renais...

speaker: Ephraim
text: No, I don’t think so. The Stone of Renais is hidden by the power of Eirika’s and my bracelets.

speaker: Eirika
text: Grado has made many attempts to take our bracelets. Every one has failed, and so the stone may still be safe.

speaker: Ephraim
text: We have to confirm that, of course. We’ve defeated Grado, and we must turn our eyes to our homeland. It’s time to return to Renais.

speaker: Saleh
text: Lady Myrrh.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Saleh...

speaker: Saleh
text: I’m grateful to see you well. The people of Caer Pelyn will be overjoyed that you’re safe.

speaker: Myrrh
text: I must apologize to you, Saleh. You were there to protect me from the very start of my journey. When we were attacked, I was separated from you, and... I’m so sorry to have worried you.

speaker: Saleh
text: Lady Myrrh. As long as you are safe, we have nothing to be worried about. It will be my honor to serve you until your mission is complete.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Thank you, Saleh.

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What has happened to our home? What has happened to Castle Renais? How did it come to be so ruined? So desolated?

speaker: Seth
text: Spies report that the castle is being held by the traitor Orson.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Orson... In retrospect, I realize he’s been acting odd for a while now. He seemed so... dispirited.

speaker: Seth
text: His wife passed away some six months back. The loss may have been too much for his mind to bear. His love and devotion for his wife were well known among the knights.

speaker: Seth
text: Now, he sits alone in the king’s former bedchambers. He makes no effort to govern. No one is allowed to enter the chambers, and he takes no meals.

speaker: Eirika
text: What could he possibly be doing?

speaker: Seth
text: I do not know. The spies had no insight into his behavior. He does nothing to deal with the dark creatures and bandits roaming the land. Reports say all of Renais is engulfed in chaos. Region after region is revolting, and Orson’s reign is already crumbling. Left alone, it may very well collapse under the weight of its own neglect.

speaker: Ephraim
text: We cannot allow the situation to reach that point. We’re going home, Eirika. We’re going to the castle.

speaker: Eirika
text: I hear you, Ephraim.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Um, Ephraim?

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it, Myrrh?

speaker: Myrrh
text: I-I will fight with you. Now that Selena has returned my dragonstone to me... I’ll do what I can until its power runs out. Let’s take back your home.

speaker: Eirika
text: Are you sure about this?

speaker: Myrrh
text: For the two of you... I simply want to help.

speaker: Ephraim
text: All right. I understand. But you must make me a promise. You are never to stray from our sides. Got that?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Of course...

speaker: Orson
text: What is it, Monica? You seem so happy today. Of COURSE I know what today is. I’d never forget your birthday! I have a present for you, dear. I think you’ll like it....

speaker: Guard
text: You know something? That Orson... He gives me the creeps. What do you think he’s doing back there? I’ve heard lots of bizarre rumors from the master of the mess hall. ...Do you think he needs help? Could he be dangerous?

speaker: Guard
text: I don’t care. I’m here for the money. As long as I get paid, I’m happy. But on the subject of rumors, have you heard the stories of the secret treasure? There’s supposed to be some fabulous wealth hidden in Castle Renais. I tell you, if I find it, I’m gone.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh

speaker: Riev
text: It does my heart good to see you looking so happy, Orson. See what joy your treachery has brought you? I told you treason would be sweet.

speaker: Orson
text: Get out. This is Monica and my place. I will not have our home disturbed by anyone. I did as you asked. I betrayed Renais. My promise has been kept.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh?How long are you going to continue this nonsense? Eirika and Ephraim have joined forces. Even now, their united forces march toward the capital, toward you.

speaker: Orson
text: Eirika?

speaker: Riev
text: You can’t imagine they’ll forgive you for your treachery, can you? I expect the sin of your betrayal has shattered you entire family’s name. And after all you did to free your wife from the cold clutches of the grave?It’s a shame she’ll be sent back there dangling from the hangman’s noose.

speaker: Orson
text: No! That can’t happen–

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh! Oh, but it can, and it will. Unless you do something to stop it. You understand what is required, don’t you? You have your orders, Orson. Heh heh heh

speaker: Orson
text: ...Monica, I’m sorry. I have something I must do. Please wait for me here. Oh, darling, don’t look so sad. I’ll be back soon, and then I’ll never leave. I must do this to protect our happiness. You understand that, don’t you? All right then. I’ll be back.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh! He believes that thing is his wife! Aren’t people amusing?

speaker: Lyon
text: Urr? Why? This terrible? Uh! Urr? gaa? Ahh

speaker: Riev
text: Oh my, your nasty little illness rearing its ugly little head again? There’s no need to worry. The pain will pass shortly. Leave everything to your humble servant, Riev. Heh heh heh!

speaker: Fighter
text: Huh? Who do you think you are? These are the chambers of Orson, steward of Renais. There's no place here for a street urchin like you, boy.

speaker: Soldier
text: You... You fool! This is Prince Lyon!

speaker: Fighter
text: What? This whelp is... I-I beg your forgiveness!

speaker: Lyon
text: ...... It's all right. I'm not sort of person others hold in esteem...

speaker: Fighter
text: ...Who in the world is that? What a creepy-looking man.

speaker: Soldier
text: Shh... He can hear you.

speaker: Fighter
text: You want to talk about creepy, that Orson's the one who chills my hide. What do you think he's doing back there? I've heard a lot of bizarre rumors from the master of the mess hall. ...Do you think he needs help? Could he be dangerous?

speaker: Soldier
text: I don't care. I'm here for the money. As long as I get paid, I'm happy. But on the subject of rumors, have you heard the stories of the secret treasure? There's supposed to be some fabulous wealth hidden in Castle Renais. I tell you, if I find it, I'm gone.

speaker: Orson
text: What is it, Monica? You seem so happy today. Of COURSE I know what today is. I'd never forget your birthday! I have a present for you, dear. I think you'll like it...

speaker: Lyon
text: Orson.

speaker: Lyon
text: Do you still recognize me, Orson, or are you entirely lost to this world? Yes, it's me, Prince Lyon. I'm the one to whom you are indebted for resurrecting your beloved wife.

speaker: Orson
text: ...Get out. This is Monica and my place.[sic] I will not have our home disturbed by anyone. I did as you asked. I betrayed Renais. My promise has been kept.

speaker: Lyon
text: Yes, and I'm very grateful to you. I came by today to offer you a piece of advice. Nothing more. Ephraim is coming, Orson. He's on his way here to steal the happiness you two share.

speaker: Orson
text: Prince Ephraim?

speaker: Lyon
text: That's right, Orson. And he's angry. I don't think he'll forgive you for betraying Renais. You've done so much to free your wife from the grave. It's a shame she'll die with you.

speaker: Orson
text: No! That can't happen--

speaker: Lyon
text: That's all I have to say to you. What you do now is up to you.

speaker: Orson
text: ...I won’t let you come between us. Monica and I will live here happily together. Forever...

speaker: Orson
text: Monica...

speaker: Eirika
text: Orson... Why would you betray us?

speaker: Orson
text: ...Princess Eirika. If anyone could understand my feelings, it might be you. For the one I love... I betrayed everything. My country, my lord and master... Everything...

speaker: Orson
text: Prince Ephraim... You never did know when to quit. Renais is already lost. It's too late...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Orson... You will move from that place. That is my father's seat. It is his throne... You've no right to sit there.

speaker: Orson
text: Seth... So you've come, have you?

speaker: Seth
text: Sir Orson.

speaker: Orson
text: You're an impressive knight, Seth. You would sacrifice your life for king and country. Not even a moment's pause. It's a pitiful, unrewarding life, through and through.

speaker: Seth
text: It is my charge. It is my hope. Sir Orson... Prepare yourself.

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, Princess Eirika. The castle has been secured. And...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it?

speaker: Seth
text: ...This way. This is the room Orson was holed up in.

speaker: Monica
text: ...Darling...

speaker: Ephraim
text: You, you’re Orson’s...

speaker: Monica
text: Darling. Darling. Darling...darling...darling...darling...

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...What?! This...is horrible...

speaker: Ephraim
text: This same magic was used to control Emperor Vigarde. She’s already dead, and her corpse was used to...

speaker: Eirika
text: Who? Who could...

speaker: Ephraim
text: You needn’t look any longer, Eirika. Let’s go outside.

speaker: Monica
text: Darling. Darling...darling...

speaker: Seth
text: ...You can’t say this thing is truly alive anymore. I’ll...

speaker: Ephraim
text: No... I’ll do it. ...The two of them spent every day in here, did they? Orson was mad. But I think he was happy...

speaker: Ephraim
text: We’ve finally made it back. Yet...

speaker: Eirika
text: Mmm... We can repair the castle, and what was stolen, we can do without. But the wounds and suffering inflicted upon the people of Renais...

speaker: Ephraim
text: It’s too late to undo their pain. Once I become king, I must set our country right. I doubt the people will give me a warm reception, though. I did abandon them. All I can do is try to win back their trust, no matter how long it takes...

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, Prince Ephraim. You should look outside.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Outside?

speaker: People
text: Prince Ephraim! Princess Eirika! The king has returned! Our king! Glory to Renais! Long live King Ephraim!

speaker: Seth
text: ...They’re not cheering for you. They cheer because Orson’s misrule is at an end. They cheer the possibility of a better tomorrow, not the deeds we did today. But how will the hearts of the people move tomorrow and the next day? That is for you to decide.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I will not let their hopes and dreams be shattered again. I will be king. Like my father before me, I will dedicate myself to their happiness.

speaker: Eirika
text: And I will do all I can to help, Ephraim.

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, Princess Eirika. Before Renais fell, King Fado entrusted me with this message: Raise the twins?bracelets in the hall of kings. The seal will be broken. The resting place of the Sacred Stone will be revealed...?br>

speaker: Ephraim
text: I understand.

speaker: Eirika
text: So we’re supposed to raise our bracelets over our heads, right?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Let’s try it, Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: I’m ready, Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: This is the Stone of Renais...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. This is one of the five stones that defeated the Demon King.

speaker: Ephraim
text: If Lyon had acquired our bracelets, the stone would have been destroyed by now. Together, we protected the only power that can help us stop Lyon’s insanity.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. It’s the only hope left to us. Hope for you and me, and the last true hope for peace...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Let’s get back, Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Huh? Brother, look! Our bracelets, they’re...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is this? Are they reacting to the light of the stone? Eirika’s Lunar Brace and Ephraim’s Solar Brace glow in response to the Sacred Stone. With the power of the bracelets, the twins can now change classes.

speaker: Eirika
text: I can’t believe the bracelets contain so much power...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I wonder if Father anticipated all of this long ago. When I was growing up, I never thought about becoming king. I only wanted to be a good soldier, a good warrior. The best on the battlefield. Father never understood what I wanted, but... I never understood him, either.

speaker: Ephraim
text: It was the same when Grado invaded Renais. I should have stayed home to defend the kingdom... Instead, I raced off to fight for personal glory.

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother... I don’t think you know how well Father understood your feelings. When I last saw him, he was concerned for nothing but our safety...

speaker: Seth
text: Eirika is correct. King Fado asked after your exploits every day. He always told me what a fine king you would one day make.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Father...

speaker: Seth
text: Now Prince Ephraim, Princess Eirika. Please follow me. The Sacred Twins of Renais should be near the stone’s reliquary.

speaker: Seth
text: Ah, here we go. This lance can only be one of the Sacred Twins of Renais. Please, Prince Ephraim, take this sacred relic and feel its weight.

speaker: Ephraim
text: So this is one of our Sacred Twin relics, is it? I’ve never seen them. Look, there’s a name inscribed here. Siegmund, the Flame Lance.

speaker: Seth
text: And this blade is sister to the lance, the other Sacred Twin of legend. Princess Eirika, if you would?

speaker: Eirika
text: Of course. There’s a name carved here as well. Sieglinde, the Thunder Blade...

speaker: Eirika
text: These are the ancient weapons of our ancestors–the weapons of heroes. They were enshrined generations ago, to be used only by the king... and only in times of dire need. Such an awful power they possess, and yet we need them to restore peace. I’ve seen enough of the horrors of war, but I can’t turn my back on it. If we merely turn our eyes away, we surrender our world to atrocity. And so, I must fight. I’ll do whatever I must do to bring back the peace we once knew.

speaker: Ephraim
text: These are the ancient weapons of our forefathers--the weapons of heroes. They were enshrined generations ago, to be used only by the king... I don't know if this is a burden I'm capable of bearing... but I do know that this is no time to curse my fate. I will fight. For my father, for my country, and for my people.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What is happening? Have you found the Sacred Stone?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. Here it is...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Wow! It truly is spectacular. This goes some way to brighten the dark shadows that loom over us.

speaker: Innes
text: Our countries? Sacred Stones have been shattered by Grado’s men. The Stone of Renais is our last remaining weapon.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: No, it’s not. You have forgotten the stone of my beloved Rausten. Remember, there were five Sacred Stones for our five nations. The Stones of Grado, Frelia, and Jehanna are gone, but hope is not. We have the Stone of Renais, after all, and that of Rausten is safe. Our road is clear, my friends. I must guide you to Rausten.

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re right. L’Arachel, we’re counting on you to lead the way.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Of course. And you will all be welcome to stay in the palace. And, Eirika, you shall be my guest in my own private quarters! Let us be on our way.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: What is happening? Have you found the Sacred Stone?

speaker: Ephraim
text: We've found it. Here it is.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Wow! It truly is spectacular. This goes some way to brighten the dark shadows that loom over us.

speaker: Innes
text: Our countries' Sacred Stones have been shattered by Grado's men. The Stone of Renais is our last remaining weapon.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: No, it's not. You have forgotten the Stone of my beloved Rausten. Remember, there were five Sacred Stones for our five nations. The stones of Grado, Frelia and Jehanna are gone, but hope is not. We have the Stone of Renais, after all, and that of Rausten is safe. Our road is clear, my friends. I must guide you to Rausten.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lead the way, L'Arachel.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Of course. And you will all be welcome to stay in the palace.

speaker: Selena
text: So this is a dragonstone... The description was accurate. It looks like an ordinary gemstone. If only His Majesty hadn't ordered me to bring this to the capital immediately... I've heard reports that Prince Ephraim and a Frelian army have landed nearby. If I didn't have those blasted restrictive orders, I could--
...Return it...

speaker: Selena
text: What?

speaker: Myrrh
text: The stone... Please. Return it to me.

speaker: Selena
text: You... You're--

speaker: Myrrh
text: Return the stone to me... Please...I'll do anything.

speaker: Selena
text: Why do you want the stone? Who are you? You're not from Grado, that's for sure.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Without the stone, I... Please, give it back to me.

speaker: Selena
text: Answer my questions!

speaker: Myrrh
text: My name is Myrrh. I come from Darkling Woods. I was betrayed, and my stone was taken from me. I was imprisoned, caged, to be transported somewhere. Prince Ephraim came to my rescue. I've been traveling in his care ever since.

speaker: Selena
text: You're with Ephraim? I can't let you leave. Maybe I should take you back to the capital with me.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Wait... You're from Grado? Tell me, has anyone around you--Have you noticed any changes in the people around you recently?

speaker: Selena
text: Changes? What do you mean by that?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Anyone near you... Has anyone been transformed, either in spirit or demeanor? Does anyone act in such a way as to appear a different person altogether?

speaker: Selena
text: .......How could you know...

speaker: Myrrh
text: The darkness is to blame. I've come here to stop it.

speaker: Selena
text: ...You will tell me more. If I find you are lying, I will punish you. Do you understand?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Yes. Are you ready? I will tell you everything I know.

speaker: Selena
text: ...... ...I see. Myrrh, I think I understand everything you've told me.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Good.

speaker: Selena
text: But I cannot believe it. How can I allow myself to believe it? If it's true, then... then His Majesty is already--

speaker: Myrrh
text: Dame Selena... What's that?

speaker: Selena
text: It is a fluorspar... His Majesty presented it to me when I was promoted to general. This gemstone is proof of my commission. It's one of Grado's treasures... I received it years ago, but I remember that day like it was yesterday. His Majesty smiled so kindly. His voice was filled with dignity and affection...

speaker: Myrrh
text: Dame Selena, you love your emperor, don't you?

speaker: Selena
text: What are you--

speaker: Myrrh
text: I can see it. Dame Selena, I can see how much you treasure...

speaker: Selena
text: .......His Majesty is most compassionate. You see, I'm a commoner. I was raised in a desolate, impoverished village. My family couldn't afford our taxes. No one could. We were desperate. Some of us considered...horrible things to make enough money to survive winter. Then, supplies began to arrive. We were told they came from the emperor himself. He sent them to us, a poor frontier town who couldn't even afford to pay taxes.

speaker: Selena
text: Neighboring kingdoms must have thought the emperor mad, I can only guess. But His Majesty did not care about his standing among kings. He cared for his people. He saved us.

speaker: Selena
text: That spring, I went to the capital and became a soldier, then a knight. I wanted to dedicate my life to the emperor who had saved it. I felt I understood his dream. I felt I shared his vision...

speaker: Myrrh
text: Dame Selena...

speaker: Selena
text: Myrrh, this wave of dark energy you spoke of... Can its evil really change a person that completely?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Yes... All trace of this person would be consumed...destroyed.

speaker: Selena
text: How can the process be reversed?

speaker: Myrrh
text: ...I'm sorry. That is...impossible.

speaker: Selena
text: ...I see.

speaker: Soldier
text: Dame Selena. Enemy troops are heading this way! We await your orders.

speaker: Selena
text: Understood. Tell the men we meet them head on.

speaker: Selena
text: Myrrh. I release you. Return to Prince Ephraim's side.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Dame Selena...

speaker: Selena
text: I apologize, but I cannot return your dragonstone to you. I vowed never again to fail in my duty to His Majesty. If you want the dragonstone back, tell Ephraim he must defeat me.

speaker: Myrrh
text: But that's--

speaker: Selena
text: Go now! This place will soon run red! All troops to arms! For the glory of Grado!

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, the Grado troops are lining up to the fore. Their commander is a Grado general... It's Selena Fluorspar.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Selena... I've heard she wields the power of the thunderstorm...that she uses its might to attack from afar without mercy.

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, I urge you to exercise caution when faced with such magic.

speaker: Gerik
text: Prince Innes said they would be around here somewhere. Now where in the blazes is this Ephraim?

speaker: Tethys
text: From this distance, I can't tell which army is Frelia and which Grado. We'll have to move in closer if we're to sort this all out.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ah...

speaker: Gerik
text: Hm?

speaker: Tethys
text: Oh, what an adorable girl. It's all right. Come here...

speaker: Gerik
text: You're a bit young to be on your own. Did you get lost then?

speaker: Tethys
text: There's no reason to be afraid. This fellow's a bit scary to look at, but he's not so bad.

speaker: Gerik
text: Come now... Hmph. But she is right, you know. If you keep looking so scared, you're likely to hurt my feelings.

speaker: Tethys
text: Please, little one, tell us your name.

speaker: Myrrh
text: I am Myrrh. I wish to return to Ephraim's side.

speaker: Gerik
text: Ephraim? We're supposed to be guarding someone by that name... Can you help us find him?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Yes... He's over there.

speaker: Gerik
text: Hey! Hold on!

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh! You're safe. Thank goodness.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ephraim... I'm sorry. I... I...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh...

speaker: Myrrh
text: It's because I forced you to bring me with you... I didn't want to be a burden to you any longer. But all I've done is made you worry... I'm...sorry...

speaker: Ephraim
text: It's fine, Myrrh. I'm the one who should be sorry. I failed in my promise to watch over you. The battle's about to begin. I want you to move to the rear.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ephraim... Those aren't bad people. I spoke to one, and she listened--

speaker: Ephraim
text: All right. I'll do my best to persuade them to join us.

speaker: Gerik
text: Are you Ephraim?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes, I am, but...

speaker: Gerik
text: I'm Gerik, mercenary commander. Prince Innes bought our swords and sent us here to join you. Any problem with that?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Innes sent you?

speaker: Gerik
text: Yeah, and the prince had a message for you as well. He said, "I've no need of assistance, Ephraim, but I'm sure you do." That's all. I figured you would know what he was talking about.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Well, that's definitely from Innes. Regardless, your aid is welcome. Please join us in our fight.

speaker: Marisa
text: Chief.

speaker: Gerik
text: Oh, Marisa! So Ewan found you after all, eh? Sorry for the trouble. Appears the guild made an error. Blast it all. I should have double-checked everything myself.

speaker: Marisa
text: No worries. I’m with you now.

speaker: Gerik
text: Have you taken any wounds? They send you all the way to Taizel, after all. What ill luck that was...

speaker: Marisa
text: I’m fine. I’ll fight at your side.

speaker: Gerik
text: Ah, that’s comforting. We’ve been hired to guard a Prince Ephraim. Before we do, though, we’d better take care of these enemy troops, huh? Let’s move, Marisa.

speaker: Marisa
text: Understood.

speaker: Tethys
text: Ewan, you’ve completed the task you were given, haven’t you? This is a dangerous place. Please, go wait at the inn. I’ll be there to collect you as soon as I’m able.

speaker: Ewan
text: No way! I want to fight, too. I’ve become friends with Prince Ephraim, you know? We’re going to take out the big, bad evil empire.

speaker: Tethys
text: Wait just a minute, Ewan! Ah! Ooh, that troublemaker.

speaker: Woman
text: You must have gone through a lot to make it here. Did you come to warn us about the fighting going on? Thanks so much. Here, please take this staff. Oh, go on. Don’t be shy.

speaker: Girl
text: Dame Selena often visits our village when she’s on patrol. She even came to our aid when we were attacked by bandits. ...... Please, I beg of you. Don’t hurt Dame Selena.

speaker: Selena
text: Fluorspar... His Majesty gave me this name. Therefore, I...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Are you Selena?

speaker: Selena
text: Indeed I am. And you are Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I know you've spoken with Myrrh. Withdraw your troops. You must know the emperor is not rational!

speaker: Selena
text: Yes, I know.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Then why? Why do we still fight?

speaker: Selena
text: I am a general of the empire. His majesty's word is law.

speaker: Ephraim
text: That's ridiculous. You know the emperor is deranged, and yet you follow his orders?! Is that truly loyalty?

speaker: Selena
text: Prince Ephraim, you cannot understand. I know the path I'm given is foolish. Yet I am a knight, and I have no other.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Selena, please! I have no wish to see you die here!

speaker: Selena
text: Me? Die? Prince Ephraim, you misunderstand me. I have no intention of dying. Madness though it may be, I will be the one doing the killing today.

speaker: Duessel
text: Well met, Selena.

speaker: Selena
text: General Duessel... I must offer you my apologies. I called you a traitor, but I was mistaken. Your loyalty never wavered, not for an instant.

speaker: Selena
text: And yet you must know that I have no intention of withdrawing. So let us not waste words. Let us settle this with steel, my friend.

speaker: Duessel
text: That's how it is to be, then? One of us dies by the other's hands?

speaker: Selena
text: Yes. It's the path I've chosen. I have no regrets.

speaker: Duessel
text: I see... Well. I, too, must follow the path that I have chosen.

speaker: Selena
text: Very well.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Dame Selena...

speaker: Ephraim
text: .......General Selena possessed a curious stone. Myrrh, is this the dragonstone you lost?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Yes, it is. But I'm saddened by its return. My dragonstone is here and yet... My heart is heavy with remorse...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh...

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ephraim, can you tell me why this had to happen? Dame Selena was a good person. She was filled with joy when she spoke of the emperor. Why did Dame Selena have to die? Why did we have to take up arms against her?

speaker: Ephraim
text: I'm sorry... If I could have convinced her to lay down her arms, I would have. It was simply not possible. I had no choice. She had to die. I know you don't approve, but you must know I have my reasons.

speaker: Myrrh
text: My apologies... Ephraim, I... I am not seeking to blame you. It's just that...I grieve for her.

speaker: Myrrh
text: I ventured out of the forest, chasing after that dark energy. I thought perhaps that I could negate its evil force. Is your cause so different from Selena's? How many good people must die alongside the wicked?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh...

speaker: Myrrh
text: What can we do to end this without any more good people dying?

speaker: Ephraim
text: I don't have any answer for you. But I will continue on toward the capital, and perhaps I will find one there. I will learn the truth behind this madness.

speaker: Selena
text: Your Majesty... I have returned.

speaker: Vigarde
text: Selena... You coward. Why did you not execute Duessel?

speaker: Selena
text: Forgive me... It was that Valter...

speaker: Vigarde
text: Selena. Duessel has betrayed us. He has bent his knee to Ephraim. Are you a traitor, too?

speaker: Selena
text: Never! I am Your Majesty's vassal. I am yours, body and soul. Your Majesty, please, another chance, I beg you! Any order you see fit to issue, I will complete!

speaker: Lyon
text: .......Selena. I have something for you. If I may, Father?

speaker: Vigarde
text: Yes.

speaker: Selena
text: What is it, Prince Lyon?

speaker: Lyon
text: I want you to go to Za'albul Marsh and retrieve something for me. It is a dragonstone, a very special kind of rock.

speaker: Selena
text: A dragonstone?

speaker: Lyon
text: That's right. It's very rare. There are only two in the entire world. I've heard rumors of a collector there who has one for sale. It looks like nothing but a common gemstone. I need it for my research. If I have that stone....my... Urg...gaa...

speaker: Selena
text: My prince, are you all right?

speaker: Lyon
text: I'm fine. Don't worry about me. Now, please, find me the dragonstone. Will you approve my request, Father?

speaker: Vigarde
text: Yes. Do as my son asks.

speaker: Selena
text: Yes, understood. Your Majesty, I...would like to renew my oath of service to you here today. I pledge that I shall never again falter in my duty to you or to Grado. I beg your leave, my lord.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Is this the first time you've seen the ocean, Myrrh?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Yes. It's so blue, so vast.

speaker: Ephraim
text: It is at that. You know, this is my first passage on a ship. I've never appreciated just how enormous the sea is.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Really? I'd never have guessed you hadn't sailed before. You seem so calm.

speaker: Ephraim
text: If I'm to lead us, I can't allow any weakness to show through. I must appear competent and capable at all times, you understand?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ephraim... Um...
Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Excuse me, Myrrh. We'll have to continue this later.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ah, all right.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it, Seth?

speaker: Seth
text: There's a ship following us, just on the edge of the fog. Should I ready the company for battle?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Is it a Grado vessel?

speaker: Seth
text: It's hard to say. The fog makes it difficult to see clearly. However, her crew seems not to be...human.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Rise and rage, my precious children of darkness. Ruin the wood and ride the sea! Drown your foes, and devour their flesh! Come celebrate the glorious rebirth of your lord and master, the Demon King! Heh, heh, heh.

speaker: Ephraim
text: There! The enemy is closing. Prepare for battle!

speaker: Ephraim
text: They've pulled alongside us... Those creatures are trying to board! That's fine--it'll bring 'em within reach of my lance. Push them back! Board their ship and seize the blasted thing!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Another ship!? Stay calm, everyone! We take the fight to them!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Friends of justice! Allies of righteousness and order! Know that I, L’Arachel, have arrived! Now, I shall purge the seas of this vile vessel of villainy!

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! Nice alliteration, Princess L’Arachel!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: ...... Hm? I didn’t hear Rennac’s voice. How very odd. Dozla, where has Rennac run off to this time?

speaker: Dozla
text: Hmmm... He was with us at mealtime before we boarded, but...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: That man can be such a distraction. ...Oh well, never mind! Let’s get started destroying these agents of chaos!

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! Leave it to me!

speaker: Ephraim
text: You are...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Fear not, O weary traveler, for I am here to save you! I grant you the favor of my divine aid.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Who are you? What are you doing here?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Ah! Can it be? Do you not know the tales of my deeds? Have you not heard of the beauteous young woman traveling to defeat evil?

speaker: Ephraim
text: No, I haven’t.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: It’s nothing... Please pay me no mind. I just feel a bit like being alone and weeping for a while.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What? No, you can’t... This is no place for crying. I’m sure you’ve noticed, but we’re under attack by monsters. If you can do anything to help, we would appreciate it.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: That’s a good idea! I’ll do it. Now, I want you to observe closely my graceful actions!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Dozla.

speaker: Dozla
text: Yes? What is it, Princess L’Arachel?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We’re going to be working together with those people. I want you to stay close by. Are you ready?

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! Ready as always!

speaker: Seth
text: We've destroyed the remaining monsters. The ship appears to be empty.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: And once again, the forces of righteousness prevail!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Thank you. We owe our victory to you.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Don't mention it. My name is L'Arachel. I'm on a never-ending quest to defeat evil in the name of virtue and order. Wait... Your face has a certain familiarity. I recently met a young woman who greatly resembles you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Do you mean, Eirika? She's my sister.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Eirika? Isn't that the name of the princess of Renais? And you have a very regal air about you yourself, don't you?

speaker: Ephraim
text: My name is Ephraim, Prince of Renais. We're fighting to end Grado's invasion. To be honest...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh my! In that case, I must accompany you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Do you understand that we alone are facing all the armies of Grado? We face untold numbers, and our odds of success are embarrassingly small.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: You clearly do not know who I am. Do not be startled by what I'm about to disclose to you... I am the princess of Rausten, theocracy of the righteous!

speaker: Ephraim
text: You're the princess of Rausten? Hm. You certainly don't have the bearing of a commoner, but...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Ah, of course. My natural nobility gives me away every time. Truth to tell, dire circumstances have led me to begin this journey in secret. Prince Ephraim of Renais, please by assured that Rausten is your ally. Let us stand together against the villainous Grado Empire!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: ...Well, that's that, Dozla. We will now be traveling with Ephraim and his companions.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! Understood! For you, Princess L'Arachel, I would dive headlong into a sea of evil! Why, I'd even tie myself up with ropes and chains first!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Such fabulous devotion! You are truly my most loyal attendant. Let us be off then.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha!

speaker: Ewan
text: We’re almost there! Come on! My teacher lives just up ahead.

speaker: Eirika
text: Slow down, Ewan. Let’s stick together.

speaker: Innes
text: ...This fog’s getting thick. I don’t expect any more surprise attacks, but that doesn’t mean we–

speaker: Ewan
text: Quick worrying, mister! You’re gonna get left behind.

speaker: Innes
text: ...Don’t speak to me, boy. I don’t tolerate insolence.

speaker: Eirika
text: Innes, he’s only a child. There’s no reason to be so rude. He is helping us after all.

speaker: Ewan
text: That’s right. Without me, you’d never get where you’re going. So come on already!

speaker: Innes
text: Stop. Don’t take another step.

speaker: Ewan
text: Huh? That’s gonna make it awfully hard to get where we need to go.

speaker: Innes
text: ...What do you know about that fort? It looks like it’s been abandoned for some time. Is anyone using it?

speaker: Ewan
text: Nope. It’s really run-down. Nobody ever goes there. It’s been empty for ages. I’ve been inside, so I know.

speaker: Innes
text: Is that right? Then what’s that sound, and where is it coming from?

speaker: Ewan
text: Huh? What sound? Hey, you’re right... I do hear a weird noise. You could hear that? Neat! You’ve got really good hearing. I wonder what it is...

speaker: Eirika
text: There it is again. Prince, is this...

speaker: Innes
text: Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes?

speaker: Innes
text: Get your troops ready. Tell them to prepare for battle... We’ve been spotted. Monsters are coming.

speaker: Tethys
text: Ewan, it’s dangerous here. Get behind me.

speaker: Ewan
text: No way. I’m gonna fight too.

speaker: Tethys
text: No. You’re too young. You’re not ready for this. Are you going to do as I say or not? I don’t know what I would do if you were to get injured.

speaker: Ewan
text: Oh...OK.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What spacious chambers. Hm... A bit musty, but I like it. I’ve decided. We’ll bed here for the night. I do wonder where Rennac disappeared to, though. I told him not to wander off, but...

speaker: Dozla
text: Hmph! Lady L’Arachel, this could be trouble.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What is it, Dozla?

speaker: Dozla
text: Look there! Through that break in the fog... Looks like we’ve got some nasty creatures running ’bout this place.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: ...I can’t see a thing. But this can be nothing but good fortune shining down on us again. Losing our way in the mountains and running into these abominations? There can be no doubt: we were brought here to destroy these foul things! Come, Dozla! We fight!

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! My heart cries out for battle!

speaker: Eirika
text: You... L’Arachel!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Hello! So it’s true! Blessings do come in threes!

speaker: Eirika
text: L’Arachel, this place is dangerous. You should find safe haven elsewhere.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, you needn’t worry about us. As you well know, my divine mission is to purge the land of these obscenities. I will show you the splendor that is L’Arachel in action! Bear witness!

speaker: Eirika
text: If you insist. At least let us join forces for the time being.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Dozla.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! What is it, Lady L’Arachel?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We’re going to join these good people and eradicate these unclean monstrosities.

speaker: Dozla
text: Sounds fun! What would you have me to do?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, just carry on in your normal manner: destroy, destroy, destroy. But do be sure to enjoy yourself.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! I am your obedient servant!

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, L’Arachel.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Please, speak nothing of it. It is heaven’s dictate that I come here to cleanse this charming place of monsters. What’s important is– Oh my! I just realized I have not yet had the honor of your name.

speaker: Eirika
text: Oh, you’re right. How strange... We’ve met so often now that I had assumed you already... Please forgive my lack of manners. My name is Eirika.

speaker: Seth
text: Milady...

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s all right, Seth. She’s clearly not our enemy.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Eirika... Aha! So you must be Princess Eirika of Renais! It is simply an honor to meet you. And how strange that we should meet again in this place. You must be lost as well. This continent is so confusing.

speaker: Eirika
text: Um, yes. Actually, we’re not lost at all. You see...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Is that so! Well, clearly, I must be allowed to accompany you.

speaker: Eirika
text: You want to travel with us? I appreciate your offer, but our journey is far too perilous. I do not wish to pull you into this madness.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: No, no, no. There can be no doubt that we were sent here to aid you. It is all part of the grand design. I, L’Arachel, shall play my role and fulfill my divine duties. This I swear!

speaker: Seth
text: Are you sure this is wise, Princess?

speaker: Eirika
text: Don’t worry, Seth.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: ...Well, that’s that, Dozla. You and I are now traveling with Eirika and her companions.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! I understand. For you, Lady L’Arachel, I would do absolutely anything! I would run to the ends of this world and dive into a sea of evil!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: How very like you, my dear, dedicated Dozla! So noble! Come! We’re off!

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha!

speaker: Ewan
text: Teeeaaaacher... Hellooooooo... That’s strange. He’s not here. Must be out wandering again.

speaker: Eirika
text: He’s out? That poses a problem. Do you know when he’ll return?

speaker: Ewan
text: Hmmm... I don’t know. He often goes out and looks for people in need.

speaker: Saleh
text: ...I believe I told you it would be best to stay away.

speaker: Saleh
text: I’ve been charged with a mission and must depart again soon.

speaker: Ewan
text: Ah! Teacher!

speaker: Eirika
text: Y-you... We’ve met before, haven’t we? You were looking for someone...

speaker: Saleh
text: ...Oh, yes. And now we meet again.

speaker: Ewan
text: These people say they want to go through Caer Pelyn. I could guide them myself, but I thought it might be better if you went, too. That’s why I brought them here. What do you say? Will you guide them?

speaker: Eirika
text: Would you, please?

speaker: Saleh
text: ...Very well. I’m heading there now. If you need to go to Caer Pelyn, you’re free to follow me.

speaker: Eirika
text: You don’t mind?

speaker: Saleh
text: We have little interest in the outside world, but we do not refuse travelers. I should warn you: the road is not easy, and you look very weary. You should rest a night before attempting the mountains.

speaker: Innes
text: We do need rest, it’s true. We are all exhausted from our encounter with those creatures. We must give our men time to heal, or they’ll be useless in an emergency.

speaker: Ewan
text: It’s settled then. I’ll go on ahead and let the elder know we’re coming. See? Even when there’s no fighting to be done, I’m still useful!

speaker: Eirika
text: No, wait! ...He’s gone. I wonder if he’ll be all right.

speaker: Innes
text: Idiotic boy. I understand his need to be helpful, but...

speaker: Saleh
text: Ewan knows this land well. You needn’t worry about him. We’ll depart at sunrise. I suggest you all get some rest.

speaker: Glen
text: Princess Eirika of Renais. Hold.

speaker: Eirika
text: Who? You.. You’re General Glen of Grado. We met once in the capital, didn’t we? You were very kind to me. However, if you’re here now, I have to assume this means...

speaker: Glen
text: Yes, it does. I wish our reunion could come under different circumstances. Eirika, I must tell you, I come here on the direct orders of the emperor. I’m to bring to justice the rebel army leader who’s been terrorizing Carcino. It’s you, Eirika. They say you’ve been murdering innocents.

speaker: Eirika
text: What? Wait! What do you mean? I...

speaker: Glen
text: ...If you have something to say, I would hear it. I know all too well that Grado has robbed you of your homeland, but even so... I do not believe revenge could drive a woman like you to such depths. And yet... here you are in Carcino with a small army under your command. And the emperor tells us that you massacred everyone in Port Kiris.

speaker: Eirika
text: That... That’s a lie! I could never...

speaker: Glen
text: Go on.

speaker: Innes
text: ...This is ridiculous. Believe what you want. Could one of the legendary Imperial Three honestly be as stupid as this?

speaker: Glen
text: ...What do you mean?

speaker: Innes
text: Carcino betrayed Frelia and set a pack of mercenary dogs to kill me. And you paint Eirika a rebel instigator? It’s an absurd farce. Your emperor commits horrors, and you believe Eirika is a criminal?

speaker: Glen
text: ...What are you saying?

speaker: Innes
text: You truly are blind, aren’t you? You’re one of the Imperial Three, and yet you can’t see your emperor’s plan?

speaker: Eirika
text: That’s enough, Innes. There’s no need to provoke him. General Glen, we’ve told you what we know to be true, what we’ve seen firsthand. We don’t want to fight you... But if you push us, we will drive you back to Grado with your tail between your legs.

speaker: Glen
text: ...I see. You...are more observant than you know. I am ignorant of the emperor’s designs. General Duessel and I both questioned the wisdom of this war. And if you really are innocent of the crimes attributed to you... Why would His Majesty lie to us? I must know the answer.

speaker: Eirika
text: So, you...believe us?

speaker: Glen
text: The Princess Eirika I met long ago was kind and merciful in spirit. You’ve faced relentless hardship, and yet that selfsame spirit remains true. ...Let’s put our fight aside for now. I will learn the truth. Then I will once again perform the duties of my office. If you have lied to me today, I will hound you to the very grave itself.

speaker: Eirika
text: Very well...

speaker: Valter
text: Glen. Where do you think you’re going?

speaker: Glen
text: Valter...

speaker: Valter
text: Tsk, tsk. What am I to make of this? Those little birds I saw flitting away into the mountains looked vaguely familiar. What do you suppose would happen if it were known you let Eirika escape?

speaker: Glen
text: Do as you will. I’m returning to the capital. I have questions for the emperor. Clear the path, Valter.

speaker: Valter
text: Hold on now. No reason to rush off, is there? After all, this is where you’re going to die. See?

speaker: Glen
text: ...What are you babbling about?

speaker: Valter
text: Heh heh... We were a grand trio–the Imperial Three: You, Duessel, and me. But my place among you was stolen, and I was exiled from Grado.

speaker: Glen
text: You slaughtered people who had no intention of fighting. The emperor’s punishment was just and warranted.

speaker: Valter
text: Heh heh...heh heh heh... After my fall from glory, only desire kept me alive. Desire for revenge. My hatred burned so fierce that I was only barely able to keep my sanity. That hatred keeps me warm still today. Oh, how it burns...

speaker: Valter
text: Hear me, Glen, wyvern general of the Imperial Three. I live for battle. I crave it. I have no need for peace. That is why you must die.

speaker: Glen
text: Cur! You’re mad!

speaker: Valter
text: A battle between generals... Sends the spirit soaring, eh? Come, Glen! Entertain me! Ha ha ha ha ha ha!

speaker: Glen
text: Urrgh...

speaker: Valter
text: Go. The small fish are yours.

speaker: Valter
text: Heh heh... This is merely the beginning. Endless battle, war without end... Heh heh... ha hahahahahaha!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Ephraim... It is time I must be going. I am still princess of Rausten, after all. There is much to which I must attend. Renais and Rausten are far apart, but that distance can be managed somehow. If you and I were to be betrothed, that is... I wonder if I appear too forward... No, how silly of me!

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ephraim... I must return to Darkling Woods. With my father gone, much responsibility falls on my shoulders. Yet I would ask... May I come and visit you from time to time?

speaker: Innes
text: We of Frelia will do what we can to aid in the restoration of Renais. If you have need of our assistance, you can come to me at any time. And another thing... It...wasn’t such a bad thing, fighting on the same side as you. That’s all. The day will come, though. One day, we will see who is the better.

speaker: Eirika
text: Where are you going, Brother? We’ve endured so much to get home, and now...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’m sorry, Eirika. I must journey to Grado. I just received word from Seth. In the south, within the empire, there has been an enormous landslide.

speaker: Eirika
text: A landslide?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes. Word is it was so great that whole cities were destroyed. They say the damage is so severe, the empire itself is in danger...

speaker: Eirika
text: That’s...

speaker: Ephraim
text: That’s why I must go to Grado. The people are saying this is Grado’s divine punishment... But these are the same citizens Lyon wanted nothing more than to protect. I cannot ignore their plight.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, of course not. I will ride with you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: No, you must remain in Renais. Our country is recovering, but we cannot rest easy. Someone must stay to protect the realm.

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim... I understand. I will take your place until you return. I will wait for you in Renais, Brother.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I can always depend on you, Eirika. Lyon... I will be king. The type of king we often spoke of... Strong and kind in measure: an ideal king. The people of Renais and Grado are under my protection, and I won’t fail them. Watch and see...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: It is time for me to be on my way, my friends. As the princess of Rausten, I still have many duties to perform. Oh, Princess Eirika... If it please you, I would be ever so delighted if you joined my tea club. I insist that you come. Oh, say you will, won’t you?

speaker: Joshua
text: I’ve much to do here in Jehanna. I’ll start with what can be done and keep going from there. First, I must talk to Mother. She should know that we’ve won, so that she can rest easily.

speaker: Innes
text: We of Frelia will do what we can to aid in the restoration of Renais. If you have need of our assistance, you have but to ask. I seldom trust people who act from purely altruistic motives... But I’ll grant you that friendships are a worthy exception to my distrust.

speaker: Eirika
text: We’ve finally made it home, haven’t we?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Aaah. You must be exhausted after the journey. Shall we rest, Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: That would be nice... But first we must seal this away... This stone banished the Demon King. With such power... Do you suppose we could bring back Father and Lyon... That everyone who died in this dreadful war could be–

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: I know, I know. Such things would be– I cannot wish for such things. No matter how it hurts, or rather because it hurts, we must learn to accept sorrow. We must take it into our hearts and tame our grief...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika... Tell me, Sister... If Lyon were here with us, what do you think he would want?

speaker: Eirika
text: What he would want?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes. You see, I think I know. It was the reason for his studies. It’s why he wanted to know about the Sacred Stones–or rather the Fire Emblem. Let’s take Lyon’s dreams and fulfill them in his stead. We can do that, can’t we? Without relying on any mystic power?

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re right, Brother, we can. Let us fulfill his dreams. As Lyon wanted, as we all want... So we may live in peace and joy.

speaker: Lyon
text: Oh, are you... I’m... My name is Lyon. Uh-huh. That’s me... The son of the emperor. You’re Prince Ephraim and Princess Eirika from Renais, aren’t you? I heard you were coming, and I’ve been waiting here all day. I’ve always wanted... I don’t have any friends my own age... So, Prince Ephraim... Princess Eirika... What do you say? From now on, let’s be friends...

speaker: Seth
text: Perhaps we should rest, milady. Master Saleh, is it much farther?

speaker: Saleh
text: We’re close. It’s only half a day ahead.

speaker: Seth
text: I would ask for a moment’s rest before continuing. We are all exhausted. We can go no farther today.

speaker: Eirika
text: No, Seth. I’ll be fine. We must not be delayed by my weakness.

speaker: Innes
text: Whew... Hah... I didn’t realize we’d be climbing so high.

speaker: Eirika
text: Whoops!

speaker: Saleh
text: ...As I warned you before we set out, the footing here can be treacherous.

speaker: Innes
text: Do you people truly live in this place? These barren crags seem unfit for human habitation...

speaker: Saleh
text: Material wealth brings strife. We’ve no need of these things. In this, we are of one mind with the Great Dragon.

speaker: Eirika
text: The Great Dragon?

speaker: Seth
text: Ah! Princess Eirika, watch out!

speaker: Eirika
text: More monsters... Master Saleh, do these creatures normally inhabit this region?

speaker: Saleh
text: No... Those things come from Darkling Woods. It’s been a long time since they’ve wandered this far afield. It’s as the elder says... Evil omens take many shapes.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: It looks like those fiends have noticed us as well. We should move, Eirika.

speaker: Saleh
text: I’m concerned for Ewan as well. I’ll go with you. I hope he is safe.

speaker: Ewan
text: Hey! Wa-wait a moment. We can work this out... You, uh, aren’t interested in talking, are you? Aaaaaa...

speaker: Ewan
text: Where’d all those freaks come from? I’ve got to get back and warn everyone... But... I do wonder if Grandmother is all right.

speaker: Ewan
text: Oh, Sister!

speaker: Tethys
text: Ewan! Are you all right?

speaker: Ewan
text: Yeah. I tried to fight those monsters. And you know what? I killed four of ’em! With my magic! That’s pretty good, huh?

speaker: Tethys
text: What am I going to do with you? Anyway, it’s not safe here. Come with me, Ewan.

speaker: Ewan
text: ...... You-you don’t believe me... You watch and see. I’ll show you how far I’ve come!

speaker: Saleh
text: Ewan... You’re safe.

speaker: Ewan
text: Oh, Teacher! It’s you! You probably had to fight a ton of creatures to get here! You’re the best! I hope I can study with you forever.

speaker: Saleh
text: I’ve told you before... My mission is my life. If you wish to learn magic, you’d be better served by another.

speaker: Ewan
text: No way. I wanna be just like you. Why would I go study somewhere else? Wait... You’ve gotta go out on a mission again, don’t you! Take me with you! I’ve practiced a lot. I can already use all the magic you taught me!

speaker: Saleh
text: ...... Well, you seem quite adamant. All right. You may accompany me. I think being with me might be safer than remaining on your own.

speaker: Ewan
text: Yahoo!

speaker: Ewan
text: Ah, hello!

speaker: Eirika
text: Ewan! How wonderful. So you’re safe, are you?

speaker: Ewan
text: Yep. I took care of a whole mess of those things. More of ‘em might show up at any time, so I’ll just follow you to the village. That’s all right, isn’t it?

speaker: Eirika
text: I guess so... It’s probably safer than leaving you here by yourself. Let’s stick together, Ewan.

speaker: Ewan
text: Wahoo!

speaker: Ewan
text: You were one of the people with my teacher, weren’t you? You think I can fight at your side? I can use the magic my teacher taught me. Well, what do you say?

speaker: Woman
text: I can’t believe monsters have appeared here in the realm of the Great Dragon. What is this world coming to? This staff you help to protect you against the beasts. Please travel safely.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Saleh? Is that you, Saleh? Tell me, is the Great Dragon well?

speaker: Saleh
text: I’m sorry, Elder. I searched to the west, but I found nothing.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Is that so... Hm? Who’s that with you?

speaker: Innes
text: I am Innes, prince of Frelia. The circumstances of our journey have led us here. We would like to pass through.

speaker: Eirika
text: Please.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Hmmm... We of Caer Pelyn have turned away from the world outside. The Great Dragon alone holds all our honor and esteem. In this place, princes and pauper are equals. Do you have a problem with that?

speaker: Innes
text: ...No. I understand.

speaker: Grandmother
