text: Hm... Well then, be welcomed as guests in our homes. I see some of you are injured. You should use this rock moss. We have little beyond what we need, but we will prepare food and bedding. You can rest as long as you like.

speaker: Innes
text: We’ve no wish to trouble you. We’d just as soon pass straight through.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Don’t let your pride drive you to foolishness. That girl there looks like she’s ready to collapse at any moment. She’s ill from the height of the mountain. Saleh, prepare some tea for the lass.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, Elder...

speaker: Grandmother
text: Call me Grandmother, child. That is what the villages call me.

speaker: Eirika
text: Uh... Grandmother, may I ask you a question? This Great Dragon...

speaker: Grandmother
text: Ah, the inquisitiveness of youth. Come, lass, listen to my words. The Great Dragon is...a blessing, one that watches over all mankind. Why, in days long past, when the Demon King appeared...

speaker: Eirika
text: Demon King? Are you speaking of the legend of the Sacred Stones? The hero Grado used the power of the five Sacred Stones to defeat and seal away–

speaker: Grandmother
text: No, no, that’s not right at all. Ah, how quickly did mankind forget its debt to the Great Dragon. To hear the story now, one would think humans alone brought about victory. That is a gross mistelling of the tale. Only through the Great Dragon’s strength could the Demon King be sealed away!

speaker: Eirika
text: The Great Dragon and the Demon King...

speaker: Grandmother
text: Mankind may have forgotten its debt, but the Great Dragon never forgets. It watches over the bones of the Demon King in Darkling Woods. It keeps the Demon King’s dark brood from swarming the world of men. The Great Dragon’s vigilance alone has kept us safe from their blind rage.

speaker: Eirika
text: Is that so? I’m... I’m sorry, I never knew...

speaker: Grandmother
text: Hmph. You don’t need to know everything, but you should remember that.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yet, Grandmother, we encountered those creatures on the way here. And they have begun to appear in the land we live in as well. What does this mean?

speaker: Grandmother
text: Ah... You have seen the effects of the omen that has appeared in the south. There is an energy there that has fouled the air and darkened the sky. The Great Dragon left Darkling Woods and went south to investigate. We of the village wished to protect the Great Dragon, so I sent my grandson, Saleh, as long as well. But they became embroiled in battle, and the Great Dragon disappeared. Since that time, there’s been no sign of the Great Dragon either here or abroad. We grew worried and directed Saleh to look for any trace of the Great Dragon. I am worried that the source of that foul energy may be responsible.

speaker: Eirika
text: A foul energy... From the south? Myrrh said something similar to this, too. Is the Great Dragon you speak of...one of the Manakete?

speaker: Grandmother
text: Manakete?!? How dare you speak so of the Great Dragon!

speaker: Eirika
text: I-I’m sorry.

speaker: Grandmother
text: But if you’ve seen the noble Myrrh, perhaps I can proceed more quickly. You see, our Great Dragon took the form of Mistress Myrrh in her travels. And you tell me that you have seen the Great Dragon yourself, lass?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. Myrrh was with my brother.

speaker: Grandmother
text: What?! Where is this brother of yours!?

speaker: Eirika
text: He leads a force of men against Grado. Myrrh rides beside him.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Saleh, this is urgent! You must leave for Grado at once and rescue the Great Dragon!

speaker: Saleh
text: Understood. I will...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, where are you off to? If you’re going to Grado, the swiftest route takes you through Jehanna. It would be to your advantage to join us in our journey for a time. It’s far safer then being on your own.

speaker: Saleh
text: You have a point... Mistress Eirika, protecting the Great Dragon is my duty. Please allow me to travel with you on the road ahead.

speaker: Innes
text: We are in your debt, Matron.

speaker: Grandmother
text: Not at all. All of our guidance comes from the Great Dragon. Saleh.

speaker: Saleh
text: Yes, I know. The road to Jehanna lies here.

speaker: Eirika
text: Grandmother, thank you so much for everything.

speaker: Grandmother
text: I know you’ll help the Great Dragon, but please look after Saleh as well. He’s not very personable, but he’s the only grandchild I have.

speaker: Ephraim
text: The Grado capital... It looks like it hasn't changed at all since the last time I was here. Eirika and I came here once long ago with our father. Duessel taught me the lance, and I studied history with Lyon. I never imagined I'd come back here armed for battle.

speaker: Lyon
text: ...And so the hero Grado and his companions used the five Sacred Stones to seal away the evil of the Demon King, and his wicked soul was locked within the Stone of Grado. The Stone of Grado came to be known as the Fire Emblem. To this day, it's kept safe and honored as a national treasure of the empire. ...I think that's about it. For more on Grado's life, read "Founding Emperor Grado." It's comprehensive.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...It's so thick. ...And the letters are so small.

speaker: Lyon
text: But you have to read it. You don't want Father McGregor to discipline you again.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...I'm no good with books. The problem is they don't move. I get bored silly. I understand so much better when you explain it to me, Lyon.

speaker: Lyon
text: Yes, but...it's kind of weird to be helping you all the time. It's just that I admire you, Ephraim. I want to be strong, like you--brave and handsome... I've got an idea. Why don't you teach me to wield a lance, Ephraim? I can't let my defeat to Eirika go unchallenged. I look foolish.

speaker: Ephraim
text: It's a deal. We practice tomorrow, though. If you want to beat Eirika, you have to take this seriously.

speaker: Lyon
text: Just go easy on me, all right?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ephraim... Aaaah!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Another tremor... They happen a lot, don't they? Are you all right, Myrrh?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Yes, I was startled. Ephraim, this place... Did it always shake like this?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yeah, Grado's been prone to earthquakes for a long time. Tiny tremors like that happen all the time. Don't worry.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Really? Um, Ephraim?

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it?

speaker: Myrrh
text: I can feel it--from inside the castle, I can feel the darkness. I feel a broad pool of darkness deep within its walls.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Perhaps it's coming from the throne room. That's where Emperor Vigarde, the man who started this, is. Let's go.

speaker: Lyon
text: Father...

speaker: Lyon
text: Father... Have we been foolish? When you died, I couldn't accept the loss... I... If only I'd been stronger... Urgh!

speaker: Soldier
text: Your Majesty! Enemy soldiers are headed this way! Oh, Prince--

speaker: Lyon?
text: ...Hi. What's wrong? Why such an unusual expression on your face? I'd rather you didn't look upon me as though I were some horrid beast.

speaker: Soldier
text: I...I beg your pardon...

speaker: Lyon?
text: Did you say we were under attack? I want all of you to strike the foe. Bring your weapons to bear on Ephraim. Is that acceptable, Father?

speaker: Vigarde
text: Do... Do as he says.

speaker: Soldier
text: Understood! Right away, Your Majesty!

speaker: Lyon
text: .......Command Grado, Emperor Vigarde... Destroy Ephraim...

speaker: Rennac
text: Ha ha! The spectacular capital of Grado. The richest city on the continent. With my expert eye, I judge this card to be an incomparable treasure. Once this is all done, I think I'll just scamper off on my own...

speaker: Ephraim
text: You there, hold.

speaker: Rennac
text: Huh? ...You’re a man. Sorry, pal, but I’m not interested in men.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What are you doing here in the castle? You seem to be weighed down a bit. Helping yourself to the treasure?

speaker: Rennac
text: Ha! I’ve no idea what you’re talking about. Now, wait a minute... You couldn’t be... Aren’t you Prince Ephraim?!?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Hm? I’m Ephraim, but...

speaker: Rennac
text: I-I thought so. You’re the one they call the Beast of Renais... I’ve heard tales of how you’ve looted and pillaged your way across the land...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What?

speaker: Rennac
text: H-Hold on! Calm down! You won’t get any treasure by killing me. If you want these goods, it’ll cost you. 10,000 gold.

speaker: Rennac
text: Yeah... Is that too high? Fine, then you get my sword as well. I’ll join your army. So that’s me and the treasure for only 9,980 gold! What do you say?

speaker: Ephraim
text: You know, I have no idea how I got pulled into this conversation. 9,980 gold, eh? I haven’t decided yet...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Here’s 9,980 gold. Is this sufficient?

speaker: Rennac
text: Huh? M-may I really take it?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Sorry? You set the price yourself, didn’t you? Now that I’ve hired you, I intend to get my money’s worth.

speaker: Rennac
text: You..aren’t going to stab me once I’ve taken your money, are you? Once the fighting’s all done, you won’t burn me at the stake or anything?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...What rumors are these people spreading about me?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Aha! So this is where you’ve wandered off to, Rennac!

speaker: Rennac
text: Princess L’Arachel? Uh-oh, um...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Come with me.

speaker: Rennac
text: Wait... Hold on now. Go with you where? Look, I’m sorry, but I’ve been hired by the Grado Empire, and... Hello! I’m talking to you!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Rennac, whatever is the matter? I promise to listen to your story later, but now, we must be going!

speaker: Rennac
text: No, I’m no servant, like that kook Dozla. I’m a mercenary. I escorted you to Renais like I was hired to do, didn’t I? You have no right to drag me across creation without any pay whatsoever!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Is this about wages? I believe you’ve received ample compensation.

speaker: Rennac
text: Ample?! Do you even know what that word means? You’re the princess of Rausten! I thought working for you would pay well! Yet your purse strings are knotted tight, and I’ve almost been killed so many–

speaker: L’Arachel
text: The joy that comes from doing good is not something that can be purchased. There. All better? Let’s go.

speaker: Rennac
text: NO! I said I don’t want to! Riding about with you is– ...And there she goes. Oh... By the Stones, why did I ever take that job in the first place?

speaker: L’Arachel (Off-Screen)
text: We must hurry, Rennac.

speaker: Rennac
text: Right, right. I’m coming...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Vigarde! Why did you invade Renais? Why did you kill my father?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Answer me, Vigarde! ...So you really have lost hold of your senses, haven't you?

speaker: Duessel
text: Your Majesty, am I finished?

speaker: Duessel
text: Your Majesty... It's too late, isn't it? ...Forgive me.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What? Is this... Vigarde's corpse--it... It disintegrated.

speaker: Seth
text: It must be some type of dark magic. Regardless, the capital has been captured. I'll lead a patrol through the castle. There may be enemy soldiers remaining.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I'll go with you. Lyon may be somewhere within the castle.

speaker: Lyon?
text: Hello, Ephraim. I've been waiting for you. Looks like you've beaten my father. I thought you might... You really are powerful, aren't you?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon! Is that you? Lyon, you must tell me! What has happened here in Grado?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Why are you in this place? Your father... Emperor Vigarde, why didn't you stop him? Don't tell me you're caught up in this madness, too! Answer me, Lyon! You always told me you wanted what your father wanted--peace!

speaker: Lyon?
text: I... I...I... Urgh! Let me tell you something, Ephraim. I've been waiting for this moment for a very, very long time.

speaker: Lyon?
text: I will make the world Grado's--No, MY plaything. I've been planning this my whole life. Why else would I befriend you and Eirika? I needed to learn where and how to attack and destroy Renais... Thanks to the two of you, I learned all I needed to know. While you feigned compassion for my weakness and scorned me in your hearts.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What?! Lyon... You're wrong. We never--

speaker: Lyon?
text: And then my chance arrived. I replaced my useless father, readied my tools, and set my plan in motion. I began my destroying Renais... And then I murdered your father.

speaker: Ephraim
text: You... You lie, Lyon! You could never--

speaker: Lyon?
text: Shall I tell you a story? Would you like to hear of your father's last moments? You'll laugh really. Your father's such a weakling, and yet he tried so hard...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon! No more insults to my father, or I may forget myself!

speaker: Lyon?
text: Oh, are you angry, Ephraim? But, not even you can stop me now. The Stones of Frelia and Renais are dust, and Jehanna's is soon to follow... ...Which leaves only two more... I will destroy them one at a time... I shall see my dream fulfilled...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What?!

speaker: Lyon?
text: Ephraim, you are in my way. Therefore... Ergh... ...How bothersome. I truly do wish to be your opponent, but I'm not yet at full strength. Let's meet again, shall we? Assuming you live, of course. I'll grant you the honor of dying at my hand. Like father, like son, eh?

speaker: Soldier
text: Reporting in, sir! We've found a cell in the back. There were captives...
Who is it?

speaker: Seth
text: Ah!

speaker: Knoll
text: Has my execution been moved up on the schedule? Wait. You're not a Grado soldier. Who are you?

speaker: Ephraim
text: I am Ephraim of Renais. And who are you?

speaker: Knoll
text: That's an odd question for an executioner. My name is Knoll. Until recently, I was one of Grado's top researchers in arcane matters.

speaker: Seth
text: So why is it you are locked up here?

speaker: Ephraim
text: You need not answer if you do not wish to. Tell me, what is Lyon attempting to do? I still have things I intend to ask him.

speaker: Knoll
text: You wish to speak to Prince Lyon? You really don't know anything, do you?

speaker: Ephraim
text: What do you mean? Is there something wrong with Lyon? What do you know?

speaker: Knoll
text: .......I'll tell you all I know, if you would like. However, I think you will not thank me once you hear it. It all began one year ago... That was when the emperor died. The emperor's health worsened, and then he...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Hold. What are you on about? One year ago? That's before Grado's invasion of Renais began. And I just saw the emperor. I killed him with my own hands.

speaker: Knoll
text: Allow me to continue in the order in which everything occurred. One year ago, the emperor died of the illness that had plagued him. Prince Lyon was devastated. He fell into an endless despair. He felt unworthy to take the throne, unable to rule without his father.

speaker: Knoll
text: He then began to look for a way to overturn his father's demise. He wanted to resurrect him--

speaker: Ephraim
text: Wait, resurrect him?

speaker: Knoll
text: Yes. As you know, the Stone of Grado is possessed of...unique powers. It was once used to seal away the Demon King, and it alone held the dark one's soul. It burned within with the Demon King's rage, and we called it the Fire Emblem. Prince Lyon and a team of mages skilled in ancient lore hoped to harness its energies. I remember the joy in Prince Lyon's eyes when he spoke of using it to save lives.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon...

speaker: Knoll
text: Prince Lyon told us he intended to use the Fire Emblem to restore the emperor. His death had been kept from the public, but rumors were beginning to fly. We knew we had to hurry, before the people learned the truth of the emperor's death. Prince Lyon dedicated himself to research, skipping meals, foregoing sleep... And then...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What happened?

speaker: Knoll
text: I wasn't there, so I did not witness it firsthand. By the time I arrived, the deed had already been done. The Fire Emblem had been shattered, split in two. One was a Sacred Stone, and the other...

speaker: Knoll
text: Prince Lyon! What's happened? Prince...

speaker: Lyon
text: Oh, hello, it's you... What was your name again? Ah, yes, Knoll. You're one of my researchers. I've glad tidings for you. My father is back.

speaker: Knoll
text: The emperor?

speaker: Lyon
text: Come, Father... Open your eyes.

speaker: Knoll
text: Your... Your Majesty! This is incredible! Prince Lyon, what miracle is this? It cannot be! What--? What is that stone?

speaker: Lyon
text: This? This is the Dark Stone. It bears even more power than any Sacred Stone. I extracted and condensed all of the magic bound within the Fire Emblem. The Dark Stone's power is what gave my father back the spark of life.

speaker: Knoll
text: The Dark Stone...?

speaker: Lyon
text: Now that the Dark Stone is mine, I have no need for this empty husk.

speaker: Knoll
text: P-Prince Lyon! The Sacred Stone... What have you done?

speaker: Lyon
text: They are all in the way. The Sacred Stones, I mean. Four more remain, and they must all be destroyed. The only stone we need now is this Dark Stone of mine.

speaker: Knoll
text: After that... His Majesty ordered the invasion of Renais, as Prince Lyon asked him to. Father McGregor grew concerned with Prince Lyon's health. He tried several times to dissuade him from his path. Prince Lyon executed him personally. I, too, was branded a traitor and arrested. My execution was scheduled for tomorrow.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon... Where is he now?

speaker: Knoll
text: Would that I knew. Prince Lyon frightens me now. He is...transformed...

speaker: Ephraim
text: He's... Lyon is my friend.

speaker: Knoll
text: This way, Prince Ephraim. I believe it's here...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it? What is this place?

speaker: Knoll
text: This is the former resting place of the Stone of Grado, the Fire Emblem. We've kept the Sacred Twins of Grado here as well. If we're still lucky, they may still be here.

speaker: Ephraim
text: The Sacred Twins... Those are the ancient weapons once wielded by the founders of our nations. Let's see if I remember my studies... Emperor Grado's were the magic tome Gleipnir and Garm, the black axe.

speaker: Knoll
text: That is correct. You know your history well.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yeah, it's something I learned long ago from Lyon.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Well, let's see if they're still here, shall we?

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim. Here...I've found the Sacred Twin relics.

speaker: Ephraim
text: And here they are... Yet I don't understand. The Sacred Stone was destroyed, but these were left untouched? Why?

speaker: Knoll
text: I know not... Perhaps... No, never mind. It's an idle thought. Prince Ephraim, please take these relics with you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Is that all right?

speaker: Knoll
text: Yes. I want you to have them. And maybe... Maybe someone else wanted you to have them as well.

speaker: Frelian
text: Prince Ephraim!

speaker: Ephraim
text: You've come at a good time, soldier. I want you to take a message to Frelia. Actually...

speaker: Frelian
text: We've received dire news from Jehanna! It's about Princess Eirika and Prince Innes... They're under attack by Grado forces led by Tiger Eye and Moonstone.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika...

speaker: Seth
text: Caellach Tiger Eye and Valter Moonstone... They're supposed to be the most powerful of Grado's imperial generals. For them to have abandoned the capital and lead the battle into Jehanna...

speaker: Frelian
text: The Knights of Rausten have ridden to the eastern front to aid Frelia, but I fear for their survival.

speaker: Ephraim
text: We march for Jehanna immediately! We will rescue Eirika.

speaker: Frelian
text: B-but even if we leave now, we will not make it in time...

speaker: Ephraim
text: We will make it. Rest easy on that. Eirika is my sister. That one will never lay down her blade. And I am Eirika's brother. There is no way I'll let my sister die!

speaker: Orson
text: This way, Princess Eirika. Prince Ephraim is being kept in a cell back here.

speaker: Eirika
text: Very well, let’s go.

speaker: Seth
text: ...Sir Orson. How long ago were you taken prisoner?

speaker: Orson
text: Some two weeks past. Prince Ephraim and I were forced to surrender. We’ve been held captive here in this dungeon since that black day.

speaker: Seth
text: Did you gain any news from your captors during that time?

speaker: Orson
text: Unfortunately, no. Not a word... Our daily meal was brought to us by servants from the neighboring village. They were instructed not to speak to us, and we heard nothing of the war. Tell me, Seth. How fares Renais?

speaker: Seth
text: ...Renais has fallen. King Fado... The king is dead.

speaker: Orson
text: Dead... My King... My apologies, Princess Eirika. I have served you poorly....

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re not to blame, Sir Orson. We must look to the future, not find fault in the past. The Grado army pursues me in hopes of acquiring my bracelet. My brother wears this bracelet’s twin, and he is in danger, too.

speaker: Orson
text: Bracelet? Ah, I remember... Prince Ephraim still wears the bracelet. And Grado is after them? If that’s the case, Princess... Perhaps you should entrust the bracelets to someone else.

speaker: Eirika
text: Perhaps, but...

speaker: Orson
text: Give them to me or Seth. Let someone you trust guard them. If the empire desires you bracelet, you are in danger as long as you hold it. For your own safety, Your Highness, please. What say you? We must not allow the Sacred Stone of Renais to be taken.

speaker: Eirika
text: Everything you say is true and sensible, yet...

speaker: Seth
text: ... Sir Orson. I am sorry for this, but please give me your weapons.

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth?

speaker: Orson
text: What are you talking about, Seth? Can’t you see I’m unarmed? Do you think they allow prisoners weapons? What kind of injury have you taken that you suggest such foolishness?

speaker: Seth
text: If I am mistaken, then I will give you all due apologies. However, there are questions I have that I cannot answer. Too many questions. Why did no enemy reinforcements come from the castle during our battle outside? Why would you escape your cell and yet leave Prince Ephraim in chains? How do you know of the tie between the bracelets and the Sacred Stone?

speaker: Orson
text: Seth, there is some misunderstanding here. I...

speaker: Seth
text: And why... Why do you conceal a blade within your doublet?

speaker: Eirika
text: ...What?

speaker: Orson
text: ...Very well. You haven’t changed a bit, Seth. If only Eirika had been alone. You, however, simply will not be deceived.

speaker: Eirika
text: Orson! What is the–

speaker: Seth
text: Orson. Why did you betray Renais?

speaker: Orson
text: My fondest with will be granted... To spend the rest of my days in the embrace of my loving wife once more...

speaker: Eirika
text: What are you saying?

speaker: Tirado
text: That’s enough. You’ve done well, Orson. I’ll take over now. You may return to your beloved wife.

speaker: Seth
text: Who are you?

speaker: Tirado
text: We’ve never met. I am Tirado. Loyal and talented aide to Valter, general of the Grado army.

speaker: Seth
text: You’re that monster’s–

speaker: Tirado
text: And you are General Seth of Renais, yes? I thought to catch a little bird in my net, and it seems instead I’ve snared a hawk.

speaker: Eirika
text: Where is my brother?!

speaker: Tirado
text: Ah, yes. Your brother. He’s not here. The coward fled Lord Valter’s pursuit... Somehow, he escaped the castle. And escaping under these conditions... Tch! Such stubbornness is quite annoying. It was my cunning that led us to turn this unfortunate blunder to our advantage. I spread the rumors myself. I led the villagers to believe he was our prisoner. What better trap with which to catch his sweet, devoted sister?

speaker: Eirika
text: My brother escaped?

speaker: Tirado
text: Yes, but your no-doubt emotional reunion will have to wait until the afterlife. Let’s end this, shall we? First, to destroy the bridge and cut off your only avenue of escape... All soldiers to arms! Kill the princess! Take her bracelet!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, we have to get away from this place!

speaker: Eirika
text: But how? The bridge is gone!

speaker: Seth
text: Blast!

speaker: Eirika
text: Oh, Brother... I’m so sorry... I...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika!

speaker: Kyle
text: Prince Ephraim, I hear sounds from the east corridor. Sounds like fighting.

speaker: Forde
text: Do you think it could be General Seth and Princess Eirika?

speaker: Ephraim
text: We have two goals here, men: save Eirika and vanquish the enemy. Kyle. Forde. Are you ready?

speaker: Kyle
text: Yes, Your Highness.

speaker: Forde
text: As always.

speaker: Kyle
text: Lord Ephraim, we should join forces with Princess Eirika first. We should be able to reach them by way of the eastern corridor.

speaker: Forde
text: Come now, Kyle. That seems like a lot of trouble when we could just crush Grado between us.

speaker: Kyle
text: A lot of trouble? Forde, you’re as insolent as you are careless! If anything were to happen to Princess Eirika, we Knights of Renais would...

speaker: Forde
text: Fine, fine. I see where you stand. Calm down, before you boil over. Prince Ephraim will decide. How shall we proceed, Your Highness?

speaker: Kyle
text: We await your command, Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Both of you, follow me!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika, are you well?

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother!? Is it really– You’re alive! You’re alive!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Well, of course I am. After we escaped Renvall, I thought I’d strike a blow against the emperor himself. When I heard that you’d been waylaid by the enemy, however, I turned back to find you. Looks like my timing was impeccable.

speaker: Eirika
text: I’m so sorry. The irony is that I was trying to rescue you. All I did was interfere with your plans...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What are you talking about? You came to help me, didn’t you? Your efforts alone are enough to inspire me. Come on, Eirika! The enemy awaits.

speaker: Eirika
text: All right!

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: General Seth! You’re safe!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika is safe as well. I’m afraid I have much news to relate to you. That will have to wait, though. For now, we must cut our way out of here.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes. Let’s conclude our business here before we talk of other matters. Come on!

speaker: Seth
text: Yes, sire!

speaker: Franz
text: Brother!

speaker: Forde
text: Ha! Franz! How’ve you been?

speaker: Franz
text: I should ask you! We’d heard you were captured by Grado’s men. I was worried.

speaker: Forde
text: Worried? I ride with Prince Ephraim, little brother. Death will have a tough time catching anyone who rides with our prince! But it’s not like we’ve avoided trouble altogether, that’s for sure. Hm? Say, have you grown taller on me?

speaker: Franz
text: I have. I’ve also finished my training. I’m now a sworn Knight of Renais. You just watch–I’m going to be on par with General Seth one day!

speaker: Forde
text: You want to be like the general, eh? ...What about me?

speaker: Franz
text: Oh I... I still want to be like you, too, Brother!

speaker: Kyle
text: General Seth!

speaker: Seth
text: Well met, Kyle. I never thought for a moment that you could be bested easily.

speaker: Kyle
text: No, sir! And I never doubted that I would see you again.

speaker: Seth
text: Kyle. About Orson...

speaker: Kyle
text: We heard it all. Unbelievable, isn’t it? But facts are facts.

speaker: Seth
text: Yes. If Orson can turn his back on Renais... We remaining knights will have to work all the harder to prove ourselves! Let’s go, Kyle.

speaker: Kyle
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Tirado
text: Hmm... My men were unable to finish the job, were they? It falls on me to show you my own special brand of power.

speaker: Tirado
text: Very...impressive... However... I expect you’ll wish you’d died here on my steel. Lord Valter is...not nearly as merciful as I...

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I worried you, didn’t I, Eirika? And you as well, General?

speaker: Seth
text: Not at all. We’re happy you’re safe. But tell me, Prince, do you know of Orson’s treachery against you and all of Renais?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes, though I learned of it all too late, after we’d been trapped at Renvall. I still find it difficult to believe that after all his years of service to Renais... I am morally responsible for his plight.

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim...

speaker: Myrrh
text: ...Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it, Myrrh?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Something’s coming... It’s drawing near. Dark...big...and great in number.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I understand. It looks like we should get out of here.

speaker: Eirika
text: Um, Brother? This girl... Her hair is indigo... Where did...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Ah, that’s a long story. For now, we must move. Suffice to say Emperor Vigarde has enlisted some... otherworldly powers. We must warn everyone of the danger.

speaker: Cormag
text: My brother is...dead? That can’t be! That’s impossible!

speaker: Valter
text: There’s no mistake. Look for yourself. I’ve brought his corpse with me. That’s him right over there, isn’t it?

speaker: Cormag
text: No... Brother...

speaker: Valter
text: Not a pretty sight, eh? You’ll be hard pressed to ready that for a proper burial. But listen, Cormag. There’s no reason for you to grieve. After all, who is better than you to replace your brother in His Majesty’s service? Picture it: General Cormag, the new and improved Sunstone, eh?

speaker: Cormag
text: Who did this... Who is responsible? Who!?

speaker: Valter
text: Glen’s last orders were to find and subdue Eirika. ‘Tis a pity I was delayed. I arrived to witness the final blow myself. I watched Eirika run her blade right through his chest and then flee.

speaker: Cormag
text: Eirika?! Where is she now?

speaker: Valter
text: Hm? What would you do if I told you? Without orders from His Majesty...

speaker: Cormag
text: ANSWER ME!

speaker: Valter
text: ...In the eastern mountains of Carcino. The forests are thick in that region. It won’t be easy finding her, but...

speaker: Valter
text: Gone already? I’ve sent a gift your way, Eirika, but I trust you can handle it. You’re my girl after all. I need you to be strong for me... Heh heh... ha ha ha ha ha!

speaker: Messenger
text: Messenger! Messenger! I bring word from Frelia!

speaker: Innes
text: Go on. What news do you bring?

speaker: Messenger
text: Prince Innes! You’re alive and well! When the reinforcements rode into Carcino, you were nowhere to be seen... We thought perhaps the enemy forces had reached you and... It’s good to see you well, milord.

speaker: Innes
text: I’m sorry to have troubled you. But remember, the duty I bear is a harsh master. It will not let me die easily.

speaker: Messenger
text: Of course. Prince Innes...

speaker: Innes
text: Yes, what word do you bring of Frelia? Speak!

speaker: Messenger
text: Yes, Your Highness! Frelia has invaded Carcino and engaged the traitor Pablo’s mercenary army. With aid from the elder Klimt, we are crushing the foe where we find them. Pablo’s faction is retreating ever southward, toward Jehanna...

speaker: Innes
text: Towards Jehanna? They must be planning to join with the Grado forces there.

speaker: Eirika
text: Pardon me, but I must know... Do you have word of my brother?

speaker: Messenger
text: Yes. Prince Ephraim has forced them surrender of Grado’s fortress at Rigwald. He is now marching onward toward the imperial capital.

speaker: Eirika
text: Toward the capital...

speaker: Innes
text: That fool... Emperor Vigarde himself and his imperial guard are in the capital. It’s too strong a force... Even for Ephraim.

speaker: Eirika
text: No... I believe in my brother. I know he fights still. The bracelet tells me so.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Ah, Eirika. Is it time to go already?

speaker: Eirika
text: L’Arachel. We’re going to break through the Grado lines and join the army of Jehanna. You should keep to the rear where it’s safe...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: No, I will stay with you. Confronting evil boldly is the sworn duty of any ally of justice. And it may be that Grado’s goal is the Stone of Jehanna... I cannot stand by and let it be destroyed.

speaker: Eirika
text: L’Arachel? Where did you come by such information?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Hm? That...uh, well...the...wind whispered to me in the night.

speaker: Eirika
text: The wind? Whispered to you?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Yes, that’s right. ...And according to that gentle breeze, there are knights riding this way from Rausten even as we speak. If we can but hold out until they arrive, the battle will surely be ours. Come, Eirika. Let us be on our way.

speaker: Eirika
text: W-wait a moment. L’Arachel? Who are you?

speaker: Caellach
text: They should be arriving anytime now. Are you ready, Aias?

speaker: Aias
text: Mm. Everything’s in place. This Princess Eirika supposedly defeated General Glen. I wonder... If it’s true, then she’s a foe to be reckoned with, and no doubt. Still, there’s no reason to worry. I can best her. I know it.

speaker: Caellach
text: You’ll take her, I’ve no fear. We fought as mercenaries together, and I know what you’re capable of. I could search the continent over and not find a man to match your skills.

speaker: Aias
text: I’m honored to hear you say that. But I’ve no interest in the titles and trapping of Grado’s Imperial Army.

speaker: Caellach
text: Don’t say that. You’re glad you came with me, right? You know we were both sick to death of living like desert rats. I’m going to be king one day. This war is just the beginning.

speaker: Aias
text: Ah... It starts again.

speaker: Caellach
text: Word has it that the Knights of Rausten are riding from the north. They’re mine. I can trust this mess to your capable hands, can’t I, Aias?

speaker: Aias
text: You remember what they called me when we were mercenaries, don’t you? I was never once wounded on the field of battle. Not once... My skill is not garnish and loud like yours, but I’ve never known defeat.

speaker: Caellach
text: Yes, that is true. I’m depending on you, Aias.

speaker: Aias
text: ..... All units prepare for battle.

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika. The enemy is arrayed before us. We’ve word that Pablo’s mercenary army is closing in from the rear. You must be cautious.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: All we have to do is hold them off until the Knights of Rausten arrive. If we can do that, victory is as good as ours. Let’s get started, shall we, Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: Indeed!

speaker: Aias
text: It’s not over yet. Victory still hands in the balance. They key is defeated the enemy commander, but...

speaker: Aias
text: Very...impressive. You’ve pierced the battle formations I’d perfected... No one’s ever done that. Renais’s tactician has earned my highest regard.

speaker: Soldier
text: Rausten Knights?! No... All troops! Retreat at once!

speaker: Cormag
text: You’re Eirika, aren’t you?

speaker: Eirika
text: And you’re...

speaker: Cormag
text: You don’t know me, but you know my brother well enough. I’m Cormag. I’m the brother of Glen, general of the Grado army, whom you killed?

speaker: Eirika
text: What?

speaker: Cormag
text: This is no longer war, and this is not a battlefield. This is a duel, and I fight to avenge my brother. He died in combat, and I’ll not foul his name by murdering you unarmed. But I will have vengeance.

speaker: Eirika
text: Hold! What is the meaning of this? Glen... Are you telling me General Glen is dead?

speaker: Cormag
text: Do not play me for a fool! You will not... Your lies do nothing but stain your honor. Nothing more.

speaker: Eirika
text: You’ve got it wrong! You’re making a mistake. Your brother and I never fought. He lowered his lance and left the battlefield to confront your emperor.

speaker: Cormag
text: ...My brother? You lie! Where is your proof?

speaker: Eirika
text: I’ve no proof. But... Here are the words he spoke to me. He told me he believed I possessed a gentle heart when we met before. He said I had not lost that quality...

speaker: Cormag
text: ..... I see... Those are indeed my brother’s words. But then who? Who benefits from– ...Ah! ...Valter!

speaker: Eirika
text: What is it?

speaker: Cormag
text: ...Princess Eirika of Renais. I would be your ally.

speaker: Eirika
text: What?

speaker: Cormag
text: I don’t care why you’re fighting. I’ve no interest in your goals. I want nothing but revenge, and I will have it. If I can kill Valter with these two hands, what care I if Grado brands me a traitor?

speaker: Soldier
text: Elder Pablo, there’s fighting ahead.

speaker: Pablo
text: Grr...I’ve misread the situation. I can’t believe I’ve been forced out of Carcino. It’s those accursed Frelia Knights riding down on us from the north. If things don’t change quickly, I’ll be forced to appeal to Grado for aid. We must prove ourselves worthy allies of Grado. We must have them in out debt! First, I’ll use my magic to bury those enemies in the distance.

speaker: Pablo
text: Grrr... I’ve got more money then you’ve ever seen. What say you? Join me, and take a seat of power at my side.

speaker: Pablo
text: Argh... It can’t be...I... You can’t have my gold... It’s all...mine...

speaker: Aias
text: Rausten knights?! That means Caellach’s– Curses... All troops! Retreat at once!

speaker: Soldier
text: Forward the lances! Show them the might of Rausten!

speaker: Eirika
text: The Knights of Rausten! Just as L’Arachel said... Reinforcements have arrived in Jehanna!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What I’d like to know is what took them so long! However, it seems that all has worked out in the end.

speaker: Soldier
text: Princess! Knights of Rausten, 2nd battalion, reporting for duty!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Well done. You may lift your eyes.

speaker: Eirika
text: Princess? L’Arachel, you’re a–

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What? Oh, you mean... Don’t be silly. This is nothing. Please don’t concern yourself.

speaker: Dozla
text: I do believe, milady, that your disguise has been penetrated.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh... I suppose there’s naught to be done about it now. Very well, Eirika. You’ve found me out! The beauteous wanderer who’s been your boon companion is none other then... the jewel of the theocracy of Rausten, Princess L’Arachel herself! I was acting under divine order to strike down evil in this land.

speaker: Eirika
text: ..... Is that so? But why did you...

speaker: Soldier
text: The truth is... The princess was enflamed by the words of the court troubadour, Saaga... She forced us to allow her to journey forth anonymously on a quest for justice.

speaker: Eirika
text: I-I see...

speaker: Soldier
text: Princess. This is from King Mansel.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What’s this? War funds? Oh, what a grand uncle. He’s just so thoughtful. Princess Eirika of Renais. Rausten will not yield to Grado. Together, let us defeat the empire in the name of righteousness!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika. Princes Innes. I’ve received word from the front. The palace of Jehanna was attacked by Grado forces and has surrendered.

speaker: Innes
text: What? How did that...

speaker: Eirika
text: And the queen? Is she safe?

speaker: Seth
text: That remains unknown.

speaker: Innes
text: She may yet live. We must hurry.

speaker: Seth
text: The palace has already been occupied by imperial troops. The Grado army is being led by Lyon, the imperial prince.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon?!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What it is, Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s nothing... ...Lyon...

speaker: Caellach
text: Hey, Aias.

speaker: Aias
text: Caellach...

speaker: Caellach
text: That was something awful. I never expected to see you get beaten so roundly.

speaker: Aias
text: Yes. It was a complete failure. The Rausten knights arrived far more quickly then I’d anticipated. But it doesn’t matter, does it? Whether I won or lost? You were planning on abandoning me from the start, weren’t you?

speaker: Caellach
text: ...Yeah, sorry. I’m not going to let things end for me here. I want to rise... To climb higher and higher. I will not be chained to my past. I will not be chained to you. I truly apologize, but you die here. Good-bye, my friend.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Home at last. My dear, sweet palace. Uncle, I’ve returned.

speaker: Mansel
text: Oh, L’Arachel! It’s good to see you safe!

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Of course I’m safe, Uncle. Evil can never defeat the forces of righteousness!

speaker: Mansel
text: Ha! You’re exactly right, my dear! Now tell me, who are our guests?

speaker: Eirika
text: Pontifex Mansel of Rausten, allow me to introduce myself. I am Eirika, Princess of Renais. I come to you today as an emissary of Frelia.

speaker: Ephraim
text: And I am Ephraim, Prince of Renais. I come with Eirika to warn you of the danger our world faces.

speaker: Eirika
text: It began when...

speaker: Mansel
text: ...Hmm, I see. That is a tough tale to swallow all at once... However, I have heard of the fell creatures in Darkling Woods. L’Arachel. You will need the Stone of Rausten if we have any hope of victory.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: That is so, Uncle. I would like permission to open the temple seal.

speaker: Mansel
text: Hmm... There's no need to rush yourself so, L'Arachel. You’re home again, in this blessed haven. You should rest.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: How can I relax until I know that our Sacred Stone is safe? At the least, I’d like to ensure that the temple seal is intact. Oh...

speaker: Mansel
text: Is something amiss?

speaker: L'Arachel
text: I think we’ll take a night to rest after all. Everyone is so exhausted. My dear friend Eirika especially has had a very trying time of late.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: Ah...

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Don’t look so sad. It wreaks such havoc on your beauty.

speaker: Eirika
text: L'Arachel. I... What should I do? Lyon was one of my dearest friends... I feel so helpless. There’s nothing I can do to help him...

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Your friend is gone, Eirika. All that remains is the Demon King, masquerading as Lyon. For the good of all humanity, he must be defeated. Ah... If only it truly were that easy, though.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Eirika... I never knew Prince Lyon. I cannot pretend to understand the sadness you must feel. However, I do know this... If the Lyon you hold so dear were here with you today... What do you think he would want you to do?

speaker: L'Arachel
text: There’s no need to rush, Eirika. Take your time and think it through. You need to find your own answer. Now then, it’s about time we found ourselves something to eat. It’s hard to be optimistic on an empty stomach.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, I’ll be right there. Thank you, L'Arachel.

speaker: Tana
text: Come on, Ephraim, cheer up.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What are you talking about, Tana? There's nothing wrong with me. I'm always like this.

speaker: Tana
text: That's not true. I've never seen you look so sad as you do right now. If you're depressed, I'm sure my brother would worry... And I...well, I...

speaker: Ephraim
text: ......Tana. You're the princess of Frelia. Perhaps it's unwise of you to be so friendly to Eirika and me. After all, alliances aside, our two countries' needs may differ. Who knows what the future holds? Those ties could snap in an instant...

speaker: Tana
text: No! Don't say that!

speaker: Ephraim
text: And why not?

speaker: Tana
text: You and Eirika are both my friends. We come from different countries, it's true, but...but... No matter what happens, the friendship I feel for you will never change!

speaker: Ephraim
text: ......I'm sorry, Tana. I wasn't thinking straight. Please don't cry.

speaker: Tana
text: Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: You're right, though. No matter what happens, the bond between us will never disappear. And it's because Lyon is my friend that I have to put an end to this. Thank you, Tana.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: That long face doesn't suit you at all. Has something happened?

speaker: Ephraim
text: L'Arachel... No, this is how I always am.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Lying to the daughter of a holy man is a grave sin, don't you know? If you would like to talk, I would like to listen...

speaker: Ephraim
text: ......I'm sorry. I can't talk about it. I'm not even planning on telling Eirika what happened.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: You're so stubborn, aren't you? Do you plan on shouldering the entire burden yourself?

speaker: Ephraim
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: If that's all you're going to say, then there's naught I can do. Have you already decided on your course of action?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ......Mm-hm. I'm prepared.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: ...Then there's no need for me to say anything more, is there? You and I are so alike... You want nothing but to help others. You refuse to show weakness, and you want to accomplish everything yourself. However, you must know that there are times when you must share the burden.

speaker: Ephraim
text: That's true... And I feel better for having spoken with you. Thank you, L'Arachel.
Heh heh heh... Guard duty? At this time of night? Such a diligent soldier.

speaker: Soldier
text: Huh?! Who goes there?
Where are you looking? I’m over here.

speaker: Soldier
text: Wha...
No, no, here. I’m over here.
What’s wrong? I’m right here. Heh heh heh...

speaker: Soldier
text: Wha...wha...
Is the darkness too deep for you to penetrate? Can’t you see what the night is hiding?

speaker: Soldier
text: A-attack!

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Humans will never conquer darkness. The guardian of light, Rausten, will drown in a never-ending night. Come, my pretties. It’s time to go. The day of Rausten’s destruction has at long last arrived!

speaker: Soldier
text: Your Holiness! There’s been an attack! We think it’s Grado’s men, fleeing from Frelia’s forces. However, they’ve breached the palace defenses at multiple points.

speaker: Mansel
text: What?!

speaker: Soldier
text: The imperial guard is at a terrible disadvantage of numbers right now. It’s less a battle than a slaughter. I’m not sure they will be able to hold out until the Knights of Rausten arrive.

speaker: Mansel
text: How has this happened? Our sacred capital invaded? I must...

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Uncle, please, you must keep yourself safe. We can take care of this. Is everyone ready to go?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, please... Prince Ephraim and I will handle this.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Seth, it’s all right. Eirika can take care of herself. Isn’t that right, Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. I’m sorry if I troubled you. Let’s go. We have to protect Pontifex Mansel.

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, we’ll take care of this. Please…

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’m sorry. I’ve been useless and worse lately. I’m over it now. I’m ready to fight. Let’s go! Take out the enemy, and protect Pontifex Mansel!

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... The day is coming, and swiftly... The day of our triumph, our vengeance! Self-righteous fools of Rausten! Where are your miracles now?! March on! March, minions of the Demon King! Your time is upon you! Tonight, we claim not only Pontifex Mansel’s sad life, but also Rausten’s Sacred Stone! Heh heh heh... You cretin, Mansel... I will have my revenge. You should never have excommunicated me. The Demon King will be your new master!

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon... You were so selfless. Your generosity seemed to flow from a bottomless well. I’m so sorry, Lyon. I couldn’t save you. But I know what you would have wanted. I know it as I know my own name. So watch, Lyon. I will defeat the Demon King.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon is my friend. No matter what has happened, that one fact will not change. I know this. I will not falter in my resolve. Lyon, because I’m your friend, I will strike you down.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... One Sacred Stone remains. Once it is destroyed, darkness will consume the world. What will you do? Will you cower in fear? Heh heh heh...

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... No! No! It’s been so long. I got carried away. I’d best stop and withdraw for now. Follow me. Come to Darkling Woods… The Demon King awaits your pleasure...

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Behold. Victory is ours!

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, we did it somehow. I wonder if everyone else is OK.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Eirika? Did you find your answer?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. Thank you, L’Arachel. Your words guided me.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: My-my words? It was nothing... Come, we should find the Sacred Stone. If anything were to happen to it...

speaker: Eirika
text: L'Arachel? Your face is flushed. Is anything amiss?”

speaker: L'Arachel
text: N-no, it’s nothing. Nothing at all!”

speaker: Ephraim
text: That takes care of that.

speaker: Tana
text: Ephraim! I’d glad to see that your spirits are up.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Ah, Tana. And I have you to thank for it.

speaker: Tana
text: It was nothing. As long as you’re back to your old self, that is thanks enough.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: I’m holding it in my very hand! The Stone of Rausten! Its glorious radiance suits my complexion, wouldn’t you say?

speaker: Ephraim
text: This is it. The last one. The last remaining Sacred Stone.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: It is. And the time to defeat the Demon King draws near.

speaker: Eirika
text: We should be leaving. We have to act before those creatures gain more momentum.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Yes. We should make haste. The poison spreads. It is growing ever stronger.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Where?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Darkling Woods... Where the Demon King fell...

speaker: Mansel
text: L'Arachel, must you leave so soon? You’ve only just returned, and you have to leave?

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Uncle, defeating evil is the highest calling I can perform.

speaker: Mansel
text: Of course, my dear. It is a divine calling, but...

speaker: L'Arachel
text: You needn’t worry, Uncle. After all, I'm not on my own. I have my friends.

speaker: Mansel
text: I see. You’ve been blessed, L'Arachel. Blessed with many good friends.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: I am indeed, Uncle. And they, in turn, are blessed with me! Farewell, Uncle. I shall return. Once evil has been vanquished, we'll all return safe and sound.

speaker: Mansel
text: Hold on. Not so fast now.

speaker: Mansel
text: I have something I wish to present to Princess Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: To me, Your Holiness?

speaker: Mansel
text: Yes, Princess. I'd like you to accept this gift.

speaker: Eirika
text: What is it?

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Oh! Aren't those... Aren't those the Sacred Twins of Rausten?

speaker: Mansel
text: That's right, dear niece. These are the weapons of Saint Latona, most holy father of Rausten. Here, we have glorious Ivaldi, and its twin, the divine Staff of Latona. I will also spare some funding to feed and arm your forces. After all, there is much that you must do before you leave these halls.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: So they are the blessed Latona's most sacred relics... Is this allowed?

speaker: Mansel
text: I know the law, L'Arachel. The relics must never leave the temple, with the sole exception of the occasional ascension ceremony, but I think that, when the world needs saving, we can make the odd exception.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: That's my uncle!

speaker: Mansel
text: You will return them, of course... once you've finished your task. Princess Eirika, I would have your oath on this.

speaker: Eirika
text: Of course. You have my word. We shall return safely, and we shall restore your relics.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Darkling Woods is home to naught but demons now. Indeed, I hear tell that none who enter its borders ever leave again. We ought to stock up on supplies in town before we set out.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, we must be as prepared as possible before we set out. I don't want to take any reckless chances with our lives.

speaker: Soldier
text: Princess L'Arachel!

speaker: L'Arachel
text: My beloved countrymen! The combat was fierce, but you protected the palace honorably. The valorous Knights of Rausten shall live on in story and song!

speaker: Soldier
text: Thank you, my lady. As always, it is our honor to serve. Princess Eirika, before you leave, please take this sword. We pray for your swift and safe return!

speaker: Eirika
text: I appreciate your gift. I swear I will not allow your valor to be wasted!

speaker: L'Arachel
text: As long as the righteousness of justice fills our hearts, how can we lose? Men, I ask that you watch after my dear uncle.

speaker: Soldier
text: You have our word, my lady. In the twin names of justice and order!

speaker: Mansel
text: I have something else for Prince Ephraim as well.

speaker: Ephraim
text: For me?

speaker: Mansel
text: That's right, Prince. I'd like you to accept this gift.

speaker: Ephraim
text: But this is...

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Oh! Aren't those... Aren't those the Sacred Twins of Rausten?

speaker: Mansel
text: That's right, dear niece. These are the weapons of Saint Latona, most holy father of Rausten. Here, we have glorious Ivaldi, and its twin, the divine Staff of Latona. I will also spare some funding to feed and arm your forces. After all, there is much that you must do before you leave these halls.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: So they are the blessed Latona's most sacred relics... Is this allowed?

speaker: Mansel
text: I know the law, L'Arachel. The relics must never leave the temple, with the sole exception of the occasional ascension ceremony, but I think that, when the world needs saving, we can make the odd exception.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: That's my uncle!

speaker: Mansel
text: You will return them, of course... once you've finished your task. Prince Ephraim, I would have your oath on this.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Of course.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Darkling Woods is home to naught but demons now. Indeed, I hear tell that none who enter its borders ever leave again. We ought to stock up on supplies in town before we set out.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes, I think stocking up would be in our best interest. I intended to see that we all return unharmed.

speaker: Soldier
text: Princess L'Arachel!

speaker: L'Arachel
text: My beloved countrymen! The combat was fierce, but you protected the palace honorably. The valorous Knights of Rausten shall live on in story and song!

speaker: Soldier
text: Thank you, my lady. As always, it is our honor to serve. Prince Ephraim, before you go, please take this sword. We pray for your swift and safe return!

speaker: Ephraim
text: As I pray for your safety, too. I won't let your valorous deeds be wasted this day!

speaker: L'Arachel
text: As long as the righteousness of justice fills our hearts, how can we lose? Men, I ask that you watch after my dear uncle.

speaker: Soldier
text: You have our word, my lady. In the twin names of justice and order!

speaker: Riev
text: So, tell me... You have ascertained Eirika’s whereabouts, have you not?

speaker: Novala
text: I have. I sent some of our men to follow the princess as she fled Serafew. They tell me Eirika and her friends will be coming this way shortly. Our ambush is ready and waiting. There’s no way they can escape. Like rats in a sack, as they say. Heh heh heh...

speaker: Riev
text: Very good... Won’t that wretched Valter be delighted. Now about this Princess Eirika... I hear she’s quite a handful. They say her paladin withstood Valter’s lance... Tell me, Novala, are you certain you can handle this assignment?

speaker: Novala
text: Don’t worry. Everything is under control. I’ve brought along a certain something from Renais. It will negate whatever futile resistance they offer. Ha ha ha...

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Pray it goes as you say. Very well. Do what you must. I must return to the capital.

speaker: Novala
text: Will you not stay and see how Eirika looks in captivity?

speaker: Riev
text: Unlike two other layabouts I know, I do not have such time to waste. I have much to do for out master. A mountain of tasks awaits me. My time is far too precious to waste on the likes of that royal whelp. Trifles such at these are best left in the hands of servants...such as you.

speaker: Novala
text: Y-yes, of course... Then...travel well.

speaker: Novala
text: Hmph... Freakish old man. You should have watched. You might have learned something. I will capture the princess, and I will replace you at our master’s side. You will stew in regret, and I will enjoy every moment.

speaker: Novala
text: Ha ha ha... Princess Eirika of Renais! Accept your fate. You have nowhere to flee!

speaker: Eirika
text: What?! Who are you? And where...where did you come from?

speaker: Novala
text: You’re as beautiful as I’d heard... And you’re even wearing your bracelet. I suppose we should begin there. Would you surrender your lovely little trinket?

speaker: Seth
text: Ah!

speaker: Eirika
text: My bracelet... Why do you want it?

speaker: Novala
text: His Majesty desires it. That’s reason enough. Once I present it to him, he will make me a general, and I will be famous. Come, hand it over. Do it quickly, and I’ll leave you alive.

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, you will do no such thing.

speaker: Eirika
text: Of course not.

speaker: Novala
text: Obedience will save you pain. You came all this way to aid Prince Ephraim, have you not? A fool’s errand. Ephraim fell before the empire’s might. As we speak he wastes away in a cell in Renvall, meekly awaiting his execution.

speaker: Eirika
text: My brother?! You lie! A pitiful worm like you could never defeat my brother!

speaker: Novala
text: Bah. Protest all you like. It does not change the truth. Ephraim has lost, and it was Grado that defeated him!

speaker: Novala
text: You’re not going to acquiesce, are you? Very well. Bring me the child.

speaker: Girl
text: H-help me...

speaker: Eirika
text: Ah!

speaker: Novala
text: Look familiar? She’s a citizen of your precious Renais. Now give me the bracelet! Do it, or the child dies!

speaker: Eirika
text: No, please... You win. But I must have your word the child will suffer no harm.

speaker: Seth
text: Princess, wait. That bracelet–

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s not worth a child’s life. Forgive me, Seth.

speaker: Novala
text: Yes...there can be no mistaking it! Next, your weapons. Take them off and hand them over.

speaker: Seth
text: No. Surrendering our weapons would be tantamount to suicide. You demand too much of us.

speaker: Novala
text: I see years of peace and idleness have not dulled the wits of all Renais’s knights. Well then, my hostage has no more use to me, does she? Ah, such a waste. Wait a moment... I’ve just had a delicious idea. Have you heard of the giant spiders prowling about this region? They’d appreciate a nice, hot meal, wouldn’t you agree?

speaker: Eirika
text: You can’t–

speaker: Girl
text: Nooo!

speaker: Novala
text: Ha ha! This will be a delight to watch! These fools will curse the day they were born to Renais!

speaker: Eirika
text: Why...why would you... How can you do such a thing?

speaker: Novala
text: This is WAR! There are no rules here! In war, you can do anything! Anything! You curs of Renais have lost! Your idiotic ravings mean nothing...

speaker: Eirika
text: Enough. Hold your tongue.

speaker: Novala
text: Wha...what?!

speaker: Eirika
text: I... We, the people of Renais, have long honored our allegiance with the Grado Empire. And you invaded without warning. You ravaged our land. You killed my father... Even then, I told myself, I must not hate Grado or her people. If I gave in to my hate, the bond between our lands would be lost forever. I refused to hate. Instead, I lived for the day our nations would know peace again. But... If this is Grado’s true face... If you could extinguish Renais without pity, without remorse... If this is the case, then there is no room in my heart for forgiveness.

speaker: Novala
text: Impudent girl! Do you expect your words to save your countrymen? They will not. Your beloved people will all die, as will you.

speaker: Novala
text: Ha ha ha! If you must curse someone, curse your dear princess.

speaker: Girl
text: Help, someone!

speaker: Novala
text: Cry! Scream! HAHAHAHAHA!

speaker: Girl
text: Are we gonna get eaten?

speaker: Mother
text: We’re going to be fine. Someone will rescue us.

speaker: Boy
text: I heard there are monstrous spiders living in the mountains to the east. They’re said to be poisonous, so I stocked up on antitoxins… This antitoxin’s strong stuff. No need to worry about poison with this around. Hey! Why don’t you go ahead and take one. Go on, you may need it. They might still eat you, but at least they won’t be able to poison you!

speaker: Girl
text: Eeek! S-s-spider... Nooooo! Go away! Please, somebody, help! HEEEEELLLLPPP!

speaker: Girl
text: N-noooooo!

speaker: Girl
text: Eeek! S-s-spider... Nooooo! Go away! Please, somebody, help! HEEEEELLLLPPP!

speaker: Novala
text: No! It can’t be... They’ve made it this far?! Grrr... Must I do everything myself!?

speaker: Novala
text: Aah... Is this...the end? No fame? No...glory–

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re safe now.

speaker: Girl
text: Wa... Waaaaaaa! I was so scared... So very, very scared.

speaker: Mother
text: Thank you. You saved us both. If you would like, please take this... And thank you again.

speaker: Seth
text: Your late father, King Fado... He ordered to keep me silent until the proper time arrived. However, with all that has happened, with Emperor Vigarde’s actions... I feel it imperative that I tell you everything, Princess Eirika. Are you ready to hear the secret of the bracelet you wear?

speaker: Eirika
text: I am...

speaker: Seth
text: As you know, Princess... Renais houses one of the legendary Sacred Stones.

speaker: Eirika
text: Of course. It’s in the temple. It’s supposed to be a ward against evil.

speaker: Seth
text: Yes, the true stone is. But the stone in the temple is nothing but a forgery. The real Sacred Stone of Renais lies beneath the royal castle. Guarding it is a powerful seal, an infinitely complex lock of sorts.

speaker: Eirika
text: What? Is this true?

speaker: Seth
text: Yes. King Fado confided in me himself. The Sacred Stoned banished evil long ago and possess power beyond our ken. The ancient kings of Renais felt it prudent to seal ours away. They feared its power could be misused. They thought to remove the temptation. The keys to break the seal were hidden, too... Forged into bracelets... ...The very ones that you and your brother, Prince Ephraim, wear.

speaker: Eirika
text: Our bracelets? How could Father keep this a secret from me for so long?

speaker: Seth
text: They must know nothing of the bracelets. Tell them only if some great peril strikes.?These were King Fado’s exact orders. Prince Ephraim knows nothing of the bracelets?secret, either. The king told me this out of fear that something might happen to him. So that, when the time came, the two of you would learn the truth.

speaker: Eirika
text: The bracelets have such meaning...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. And we are the only living souls who know the secret of the Stone of Renais. At least, that’s what I was given to believe. And yet...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yet the Grado army has made it clear that they want me only for my bracelet.

speaker: Seth
text: Yes, quite clear at that... I don’t know how, but Emperor Vigarde must have learned the secret somehow. And now, his troops pursue the bracelet, and we are no closer to knowing his motives.

speaker: Eirika
text: He would use the bracelets to unlock the Sacred Stone and destroy it in secret...

speaker: Seth
text: Perhaps.

speaker: Eirika
text: Which means that my brother... and his bracelet...

speaker: Seth
text: If he’s been captured, they may have the bracelet already, and he may be–

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim...

speaker: Seth
text: Princess, we must take Novala’s words to be true. We must hurry to Prince Ephraim. The enemy soldiers who fled the battle will have reported our location by now. If the prince is being held prisoner at Renvall... I fear they might execute him once they learn of our approach.

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re right. We’ve no time to waste. We must hurry to Renvall! Let’s go rescue my brother!

speaker: Lyon
text: ...The time grows near.

speaker: Morva
text: ...Hold.

speaker: Lyon
text: Huh?

speaker: Morva
text: What are you doing here, human? You should return to your own kind. This is no place for you to tread. This is darkness's domain... This is desecrated land.

speaker: Lyon
text: That's why I've come. I have the power of the Demon King. I will save us all.

speaker: Morva
text: You... Evil grips your heart... No--you've given your heart to evil.

speaker: Morva
text: What a tragedy... Human flesh cannot contain the demon. It cannot control him. You think yourself safe, but already, your control slips. I see the madness eating at you. I see the beginning of the end.

speaker: Lyon
text: You're wrong. This... Ah...urg... I do this of my own will... I will save Grado's people.

speaker: Lyon
text: I had a vision. I saw my life traveling two roads. Down one, the Demon King conquers both my body and soul. Down the other, I master the Demon King, and with that power...urg... With that power, I avert disaster. I gave the people a better future... I resist the Demon King's attempts to wrest away my will... I saw this, and I made my decision. I walk the second road.

speaker: Morva
text: You fool... The Demon King has blinded you to his true wish. How can you not see it? He's had you since the moment you first held the Dark Stone. He has been hiding within you, luring you deeper into the shadows of his heart. He commands you and remakes you to suit his dark design.

speaker: Lyon
text: ...You're wrong...

speaker: Morva
text: You think yourself unchanged? You think yourself the master? I see only more evidence that the Demon King commands you now. Can you not sense--

speaker: Lyon
text: It's not true! I... I will save everyone.

speaker: Morva
text: Think back! Remember! Are you truly the man you used to be? Would you justify war and murder to bring about peace and justice? Remember who you were, and tell me if you are still yourself!

speaker: Lyon
text: .......All of this matters not. I know the Demon King has claimed me. It is not important... Not if I can save the world. My own soul is irrelevant.

speaker: Morva
text: ...It is as I feared. You will not give up this madness. I am Morva, the dragonkin who guards the entrance to these woods. I do not have the ability to save you. All I can do is destroy the demon that coils around your heart. To prevent the further damnation of your soul... I can only grant you eternal sleep.

speaker: Lyon
text: I cannot sleep. I have not yet--There is no taboo I will not break, no sacrifice I will not make... I...

speaker: Morva
text: ...You are beyond reason. Therefore I, too, must do what I was born to do. As it was in that ancient battle... You will die here, Demon King.

speaker: Ephraim
text: This awful darkness...

speaker: Eirika
text: I know... I can feel it too.

speaker: Seth
text: This is Darkling Woods... It was here the heroes met the Demon King and with the Sacred Stones defeated him. I've heard the lingering energies of that battle are the source of the monsters. But I never imagined it would be as bad as this...

speaker: Myrrh
text: It's worse than before... It's grown so much stronger. Simply standing here is a struggle... But we don't need to worry. My father is here. He'll take care of everything.

speaker: Eirika
text: Your father?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Over there. On the other wise of that swamp is the Black Temple of the Demon King. My father stands guard near it. This is where my father and I have lived for as long as I can remember.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I see. So this forest is like a home to you.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Uh-huh... My foster father leads the dragon tribe. In the last great war...both of my true parents were killed. Morva took me in and raised me as though I were his own child.

speaker: Ephraim
text: So that's how you came to live here...

speaker: Myrrh
text: My father holds back the monsters that are born in Darkling Woods. He's so strong, and so very gentle. One day, I hope to be like him... .......Oh!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh, what is it?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, Prince Ephraim, we're under attack. A horde of those foul beasts is headed straight for us.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh, are you well? If you're ill, we should get you to--

speaker: Myrrh
text: No, no... It's nothing. I'll fight with you. I'll fight, and we'll drive back the dark children.

speaker: Lyon
text: Ha ha ha ha... Riev... I'm leaving this to you.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... As you wish. Please proceed with the rites of resurrection, sire.

speaker: Lyon
text: Mm... hah hah... A moment more, and my rebirth will be unstoppable--irreversible. None remain who can stop me now.

speaker: Morva
text: So, you've returned, have you?

speaker: Lyon
text: Hm?

speaker: Morva
text: You can clothe yourself in human flesh, but you cannot hide your foul mien. Eight hundred years wasn't long enough, Demon King.

speaker: Lyon
text: One of the dragonkin, hm? Ah, I've seen your face before, lizard. Yes, during that accursed battle so long ago. When those wretched men bound me in their fetters. They fought with an ally from the dragonkin at their side... I believe his name was Morva.

speaker: Morva
text: The protection of the blessed stones is lost. The dark is rising. Malevolence given will and form now walks these lands unopposed. Ancient king of shadows... they appear to be waiting for you.

speaker: Lyon
text: Very perceptive. And now I am here. I must tell them their wait is over. I must tell them I have been reborn. Begone, dragon. I am changed. I can no longer be stopped by the likes of you.

speaker: Morva
text: I live and breathe to protect mankind. I cannot abandon them to you. Now, as it once did so long ago, these woods will witness your defeat.

speaker: Lyon
text: So, your dragon blood still runs so hot that you would dare to stop me? Dragons. That reminds me... Not long back, I fought a rabble of men who traveled with a dragon child. Tell me, Morva, was that your daughter?

speaker: Morva
text: ...Myrrh left this place long ago to test the limits of your influence. Could she have...?

speaker: Lyon
text: Could she have what? Pray, continue.

speaker: Morva
text: You will answer me. Your reply will determine...

speaker: Lyon
text: Ha ha ha ha ha... Such information has no use to you now. You have dared to challenge me. You have no time for joy or sorrow. No, best to focus now on this, the moment of your death. I would hate for you to miss it.

speaker: Ephraim
text: This awful darkness...

speaker: Eirika
text: I know... I can feel it too.

speaker: Seth
text: This is Darkling Woods... It was here the heroes met the Demon King and with the Sacred Stones defeated him. I've heard the lingering energies of that battle are the source of the monsters. But I never imagined it would be as bad as this...

speaker: Myrrh
text: It's worse than before... It's grown so much stronger. Simply standing here is a struggle... But we don't need to worry. My father is here. He'll take care of everything.

speaker: Eirika
text: Your father?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Over there. On the other wise of that swamp is the Black Temple of the Demon King. My father stands guard near it. This is where my father and I have lived for as long as I can remember.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I see. So this forest is like a home to you.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Uh-huh... I get to see Father again. I'm so happy. My foster father leads the dragon tribe. In the last great war... both of my true parents were killed. Morva took me in and raised me as though I were his own child.

speaker: Eirika
text: So that's how you came to live here...

speaker: Myrrh
text: My father holds back the monsters that are born in Darkling Woods. He's so strong, and so very gentle. One day, I hope to be like him... .......Oh!

speaker: Eirika
text: Myrrh, what's wrong?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, Prince Ephraim, we're under attack. A horde of those foul beasts is headed straight for us.

speaker: Eirika
text: Myrrh, are you well? If you're ill, we should get you to--

speaker: Myrrh
text: No, no... It's nothing. I'll fight with you. I'll fight, and we'll drive back the dark children.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Soon... soon... It happens soon! The Demon King will be restored to all his former glory! And I, his faithful servant, will bask in his radiant power... Then, oh, then I will have my revenge on those who scorned me! The Demon King has created for me a fine weapon--a draco zombie! This fierce beast and I will guard the Black Temple's entrance. As long as we watch, no one will interrupt his rituals. We will drown all who dare approach in this virulent mud! Heh heh heh... Heh heh heh heh heh!

speaker: Riev
text: Grr... Your eyes annoy me... Why do you not despair? Why do you not surrender?

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Even if you defeat me, you're too late to stop it. The one true demon... will rise...

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh. The young lady of Rausten... The more cruel and gruesome your death, the more that cur Mansel would weep, am I right? And that would make me so very, very happy.

speaker: L'Arachel
text: Do you think your words will frighten me? I am the princess L'Arachel! Slaying demons is my forte! You who have sold your soul to the soulless... I grant you release from your wretched existence.

speaker: Myrrh
text: ...Urrgh... I'm... sorry...

speaker: Ephraim
text: So this is the Black Temple... The Demon King is here.

speaker: Eirika
text: We have to stop him before he can begin the ritual. Let's waste no time, Brother.

speaker: Myrrh
text: ...... I'm sorry... Father...

speaker: Eirika
text: Myrrh... What is it?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Um... I... I just met with my father. I had not seen or spoken with him for quite a while.

speaker: Eirika
text: You saw your father? Then we must speak with him--

speaker: Myrrh
text: No... He told me he couldn't see you. He said it wasn't a good idea for him to meet so many people. As the tribal chieftain, he feels he should maintain his distance.

speaker: Eirika
text: Is that so... That's too bad.

speaker: Myrrh
text: But he offered me words of encouragement and praised my efforts thus far. He told me in his kindly voice to come home to him safely. I will do my best to honor his faith in me.

speaker: Eirika
text: He sounds like a good father.

speaker: Myrrh
text: He is... Mistress Eirika... I'll do all I can. For my father--and for all of you as well. I will help you, and we will defeat the Demon King.

speaker: Eirika
text: Are you sure you want to go with us, Myrrh? You had so wanted to be with your father...

speaker: Myrrh
text: Yes... I'm sure. Once we are finished dealing with this evil, I will have time then. Let's hurry, Mistress Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: Myrrh... I understand. Let's get moving. The faster we can end this nightmare, the better.

speaker: Myrrh
text: From this building... a repulsive energy oozes. The Demon King... He's here.

speaker: Lyon
text: Urr... rrraa...

speaker: Fomortiis
text: Lyon... It's almost time. Your beloved Eirika is on her way.

speaker: Lyon
text: Eirika... Don't... come. It's... already...

speaker: Fomortiis
text: Ha ha... Lyon, prince of frailty. To believe that a weak man like you thought to oppose me... You're an arrogant little insect, nothing more. And now, you're dead... I will devour you, and you will be lost forever.

speaker: Lyon
text: Urr... ugh... Uh! Grrraaaaa!!

speaker: Fomortiis
text: Ha ha. Does it hurt? Are you suffering? Oh, but it does not end for you yet. Oh, no. I've left you this one shard of awareness for a reason. I want you to watch yourself as you crush Eirika. You should thank me! Ha ha... hah hah hah!

speaker: Lyon
text: Ei... Eirika...

speaker: Myrrh
text: ...... I’m sorry... Forgive me...Father...

speaker: Ephraim (Off-Screen)
text: Myrrh! Where are you?!

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ah...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Here you are. Myrrh, we were worried... Myrrh? Are you...crying?

speaker: Myrrh
text: N-no... It’s nothing. The poison in these woods is thick. It burns my eyes.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What a minute... That dragon... Could he have been–

speaker: Myrrh
text: O-of course not... There’s nothing wrong. After everything you all have suffered, this is– I can’t... This is nothing...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh...

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’m so sorry. You kept silent this whole time so as not to trouble us.

speaker: Myrrh
text: ... E-everything’s fine, Ephraim... I’m fine. See? I’m ready to...to...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh. Let yourself cry. These are dark times. There’s no reason to hide your sorrow.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Ephraim... I, I... ...Aaah... Sniff... Father... Father...

speaker: Lyon
text: ...Father! Hold on, please! Father!

speaker: Vigarde
text: Lyon... This is... the end for me. From now on... you...

speaker: Lyon
text: Don’t say that, Father.

speaker: Vigarde
text: You must concern yourself... with Grado... The people... our people must be saved... Lyon... tell me again. What will happen to Grado?

speaker: Lyon
text: I have seen it many times now, as have the court mages. It’s the same every time, Father. It’s always the same. Sometime in the coming years, the southern continent will collapse. Countless people will die instantly. Those who don’t will likely starve.

speaker: Lyon
text: None but the mages and I know of the vision, as you ordered. But... if we don’t do something, all of those people will die. Please tell me, Father. What should I do? What...

speaker: Vigarde
text: Lyon... When I die... You will be emperor... The emperor... must protect his country. There is nothing more... that I can do. It’s you... You must protect our people.

speaker: Lyon
text: B-but, Father... I don’t have the power... Ah! R-Renais... If I ask Eirika and Ephraim for help, I’m sure they would–

speaker: Vigarde
text: You would ask Renais to rescue us from... a natural disaster? They would not help us... Grado’s borders would overflow with starving refugees by the thousands. Renais would close her borders to us. It’s only natural... Renais has a duty to protect herself.

speaker: Lyon
text: No, that would never–

speaker: Vigarde
text: Lyon... You are the one... who must... save our people. You must take my place... The citizens of Grado... are counting on...you...

speaker: Lyon
text: Father?! No...wait! I cannot do anything without you, Father!

speaker: Lyon
text: Fa...Father...

speaker: Knoll
text: His Highness...

speaker: Lyon
text: I am...weak. Because I am weak... people will die. I... (The scene change quickly, Lyon and Knoll in the Sacred Stone’s realm)
