speaker: Knoll
text: Prince Lyon...

speaker: Lyon
text: Knoll... I... Open the seal on the Sacred Stone of Grado.

speaker: Knoll
text: The Sacred Stone? But that’s...

speaker: Lyon
text: You’ve seen the scrolls. You know there is a way to stop the coming disaster. If those scrolls are correct, the rites they describe can save all of Grado. But it will require a staggering amount of dark energy–and a sacrifice as well. The human body cannot contain the powers these rites demand... And yet... Of the five Sacred Stones, Grado’s alone possesses a greater power... It is the very prison housing the soul of the ancient Demon King. If we could harness its power, well... If we can do that, we can avert disaster and save countless lives.

speaker: Knoll
text: But you forget...

speaker: Lyon
text: I forget nothing! I know I am too weak. Because of me, all of Grado will be destroyed. I need... I need the Sacred Stone. I must become stronger. I will become stronger.

speaker: Lyon
text: Everything is in readiness. The Stones have been destroyed. The Demon King’s power swells. The Black Temple possesses all the demonic power I will need. The rites can begin. All that remains is for me to sacrifice my life... The disaster will be averted. My people will be saved...

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, we've docked in Taizel. There's no sign of enemy troops at this time.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Understood. Let's move quickly and prepare to go ashore. We've a straight road to the capital from here, but we'll be fighting for every step.

speaker: Seth
text: Yes, and the fighting will only grow fiercer as we near the capital. If I may, my lord, I'd like to make a suggestion.

speaker: Saleh
text: This is the town, isn't it, Ewan?

speaker: Ewan
text: Yep. Thanks a lot, Teacher. This is where Marisa is supposed to be. I have to tell her what's going on, or she'll end up working for free.

speaker: Saleh
text: What happened? I heard there was some mistake, but...

speaker: Ewan
text: Yeah, the mercenary guild got Marisa mixed up with someone else. I don't know where she was supposed to go, but they sent her here instead. I figured I'd better let her know about the mix-up, right? So what are you going to do now?

speaker: Saleh
text: I'm heading back to the village. I've looked near and far, but I haven't been able to locate the Lord Dragon. I must report my findings.

speaker: Ewan
text: Oh, I see...

speaker: Saleh
text: I'll be going now. Remember what I told you, Ewan...

speaker: Ewan
text: I know, I know. Don't be reckless with magic.

speaker: Ewan
text: Well, I'd better get going and find Marisa. That looks like a good place to start asking around.
Ephraim... From the east...

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...That won't do, Seth. I cannot approve of sending reservists to the front lines.

speaker: Seth
text: But...the Grado army outnumbers our own by a tremendous amount. We have talented soldiers, but that counts for nothing against those numbers. Currently, we have some ready reservists in the rear, protecting our supply convoy. What good is defending our convoy if it comes at the cost of losing the front? We must abandon our rear guard and strengthen the van, or we've already lost.

speaker: Ephraim
text: This is enemy territory. We cannot surrender the convoy!

speaker: Seth
text: But, Prince Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Seth, I know you only want to improve the odds of our success. And I know you only make these suggestions in part to protect me from harm. However, I have no intention of changing my mind in this. I--...Myrrh?

speaker: Myrrh
text: Oh, pardon...me... I-I... It's nothing.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh...

speaker: Soldier
text: Prince Ephraim! It's a trap! The city's crawling with Grado men! We're under attack!

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: All troops prepare to fight! To arms!

speaker: Caellach
text: Soldiers of Grado! You call yourselves warriors? You’re pathetic! Fort Rigwald? You lost it! Your General Duessel? A traitor! Where is the honor of the Grado Imperial Army? It wallows in filth and mud. Is this the ending you envisioned? Is this how you would be remembered? Will you let the bards sing of how you fell to the renegade Ephraim? I think not! Now get up and fight! Kill them all! And bring me Ephraim’s head!

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Caellach. Interesting. What are you doing here? You were ordered to loose your dogs of war on Jehanna, were you not?

speaker: Caellach
text: Keep silent, you decrepit fool. I told you, Jehanna’s under control. My plan is in full effect. All we need do now is wait. You see, Jehanna is an overripe fruit. It’s being devoured by worms from within. We can pluck it anytime we wish.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Oh, how your plans seem to have gone awry. Even now, Eirika makes her way toward Jehanna. Your perfect fruit has turned to rot while you did nothing. It’s time. You will return to the capital with me.

speaker: Caellach
text: What?! Are you truly serious, you old goat? Glen... No, it’s that black-hearted Valter... What’s he playing at now?

speaker: Riev
text: There’s no call for that sort of talk. That one has his uses after all. You can leave the defeat of Ephraim to your subordinates. Oh yes, and you can use the troops I brought with me as well. It will, no doubt, be an interesting battle. Heh heh heh... Let’s go now, Caellach. You wouldn’t want to hurt a certain someone’s feelings, would you?

speaker: Caellach
text: Bah. What else can I do?

speaker: Ephraim
text: More of those fiends? What’s going on? Their movements… It’s… It’s as though those creatures are cooperating with Grado’s army…

speaker: Man
text: Ah... I wonder if that dancer will ever come this way again. I don’t know why, but her dances really pepped me up. Even after a hard day’s work, I felt as fresh as if I’d just woken up! It sure would be nice if she would dance for me again someday.

speaker: Ewan
text: Er, hello. My name’s Ewan. I’m training to be a sage. I need to find a woman by the name of Marisa. I don’t know where she’s done. If you’ll help me find her, I’ll gladly travel with you. I’m a useful guy to know. In a pinch, I can use the magic I’ve learned so far. So what do you say? Do we have a deal?

speaker: Ewan
text: There you are, Marisa.

speaker: Marisa
text: Ewan? What are you doing here?

speaker: Ewan
text: Marisa, the mercenary guild sent you here, didn’t they? They assigned you to fight under Commander Gerik, right?

speaker: Marisa
text: That’s right. But the chief’s not here.

speaker: Ewan
text: I know. It was all a mistake. Your commander’s over there, working on another job. He wants you to join him.

speaker: Marisa
text: Really? He said that?

speaker: Ewan
text: Yep.

speaker: Marisa
text: I’m on my way.

speaker: Ewan
text: Hey, wait! Wait! Take me with you! This group’s headed east, too. Let’s stick with them for now.

speaker: Marisa
text: Very well.

speaker: Seth
text: The enemy troops have been defeated. We're taking care of the wounded now.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Understood. We'll rest in this city until we're prepared to advance. Replenish supplies and rest the troops. Remind every soldier that anyone who breaks the city's laws will be severely punished. Anything else?

speaker: Seth
text: We should prepare defenses along the east in case of assault. The capital's not far, and fresh troops could be here at any time.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Good point. All right, set up three rotating watches. Then--

speaker: Myrrh
text: ...Pardon me, Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh's gone? Are you sure?

speaker: Seth
text: Yes, she's been missing since this morning. There are no signs of a struggle. I feel she left of her own accord.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Where did she go? Didn't anyone see her?

speaker: Seth
text: One of the guards reports having seen a young lady heading east. He said she seemed unsteady on her feet. It may have been her.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Prepare to move out. We head east.

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I'm not just acting on emotion, Seth. The capital lies to the east as well.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Seth, you will obey your commander and sovereign, do you hear me? Listen, I know what you said is true. I am king in all but title now. I know I must place my duty as commander above my life as a man. And once I am crowned, I most certainly will do exactly that. However, I am not ready to divorce myself from my compassion just yet. I will find the balance somehow, the means to save my country and her people. That is the king I wish to become, and so that is the man I must be. I need your help in this, Seth.

speaker: Seth
text: ...I understand, Prince Ephraim. If that is your decision, then I will do my best to assist you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I'm counting on it. Please be safe, Myrrh.

speaker: Soldier
text: Princess Tana! Grado’s forces are approaching!

speaker: Tana
text: What? So soon? Ah, we’ve had no time!

speaker: Soldier
text: Milady, we lack the arms to defend this place. You must return to Castle Frelia.

speaker: Tana
text: I can’t! Not yet. We haven’t found Eirika and her companions yet. Eirika is my friend, and she needs my help. I won’t abandon her. Oh, I know! Go and ask Father– I mean King Hayden for more troops.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, Your Highness!

speaker: Tana
text: Eirika, please be safe.

speaker: Soldier
text: Commander Breguet, the enemy appears to be fortifying its position in the castle.

speaker: Breguet
text: Hmph. They’re tenacious, but they have no hope of stopping our advance.

speaker: Soldier
text: What are your orders, sir?

speaker: Breguet
text: Ha! Orders? You just stand here and watch. I’ll crush them myself!

speaker: Soldier
text: As you command, sir.

speaker: Breguet
text: Ha! That’s what happens when you face my lance!

speaker: Tana
text: St-stop right there! Call off your forces and turn back, or you’ll have me to deal with!

speaker: Breguet
text: Is that so? And who might you be?

speaker: Tana
text: Who–? I am Tana, Princess of Frelia. I will not permit you to abuse my country any longer.

speaker: Breguet
text: Frelia’s royal brat, huh? How convenient...

speaker: Tana
text: Leave this castle immediately. If you harm me, my father and brother will chase you to the earth’s end.

speaker: Breguet
text: Yes, I’ve heard of how King Hayden dotes on his precious little daughter. Let’s see how true that is. You’ll make us a fine hostage, my dear. Seize the girl and lock her up!

speaker: Soldier
text: Right away, sir!

speaker: Tana
text: No! Let me go!

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth, look...

speaker: Seth
text: I see it. It seems like Grado’s army has already reached Frelia. Princess, this place is perilous. We should bypass Mulan altogether and head straight to the castle.

speaker: Eirika
text: But we can’t just ignore this... You were there when Renais was invaded... You saw what I saw. You saw how the people suffered at the hands of Grado’s soldiers. Homes were destroyed, possessions stolen, women kidnapped... Anyone who resisted was executed without question, without hesitation.

speaker: Eirika
text: Please, Seth. I can’t allow that to happen here. I don’t want to see any more people harmed by Grado’s atrocities.

speaker: Seth
text: All right, Princess. I understand. Perhaps we can retake Mulan. But, Princess, you must act with caution. Your people need you, too.

speaker: Eirika
text: Of course, Seth. Come on! Let’s go!

speaker: Breguet
text: Hm? Is that the princess of Renais? Ha ha! It really is my lucky day! Fame and fortune ride to meet me! Move on, you slugs! Bring that girl to me!

speaker: Franz
text: Sir Gilliam, is that Mulan? Have we reached Frelia’s border already?

speaker: Gilliam
text: Aye, we have. Her Highness Princess Tana should be inside the castle.

speaker: Franz
text: But look — the countryside is crawling with Grado soldiers! Where’s the castle guard! Has Mulan fallen? Are we too late?

speaker: Gilliam
text: Too tough to say from here. Princess Tana’s in no danger if they want her as a bargaining tool. We men of the Eastern Watch will see her to safety.

speaker: Franz
text: Yes...Yes, of course. We mustn’t give up. We must move. We must retake the castle. Then, we ride forth to Princess Eirika’s aid.

speaker: Gilliam
text: I’ve stronger armor then you do. I’ll take the lead. Watch my back.

speaker: Franz
text: Princess Eirika, it is good to see you’re well.

speaker: Eirika
text: Franz, you made it through unscathed...

speaker: Franz
text: Y-yes, Your Highness! I met up with Sir Gilliam of Frelia and explained the situation in Renais. He told me that Princess Tana was in danger as well, here at Mulan. We rode as swiftly as we could.

speaker: Eirika
text: Tana is here? Franz, we must hurry!

speaker: Franz
text: Understood!

speaker: Seth
text: Is that you, Franz? I’m relieved to see you’re still in one piece!

speaker: Franz
text: Y-yes... and you as well, General. As long as you lead us, sir, the Knights of Renais cannot lose!

speaker: Seth
text: Franz, you and I must work together to protect Princess Eirika. I want you to ride with us.

speaker: Franz
text: Sir! With honor, sir!

speaker: Man
text: The rumors are true, aren’t they? The Grado army’s taken over the castle. It looks like they’ve seized the castle gate, too. Smart work–the gate provides defense and heals wounds to boot. They must be fierce warriors to have taken the gate. Watch yourself.

speaker: Man
text: That knight encamped at the castle was wearing the finest armor I’ve seen. It looked like it could turn aside almost any blade you swing at it. I know my armor, though. I wager a good rapier or armorslayer could get through it.

speaker: Breguet
text: Bah, what a worthless lot of curs I’ve been assigned!

speaker: Breguet
text: This...this can’t be... I...

speaker: Soldier
text: I’ve found them! Stragglers from Renais! Don’t let them get away!

speaker: Gilliam
text: Princess Tana.

speaker: Tana
text: Sir Gilliam... I’m sorry, I never meant to cause you such trouble.

speaker: Gilliam
text: It was no trouble. I live to serve, Princess.

speaker: Eirika
text: Tana!

speaker: Tana
text: ...Eirika?!? Is that really you?

speaker: Eirika
text: Tana, what are you doing, so far form Castle Frelia?

speaker: Tana
text: I heard that Renais had fallen, and I was so worried... But I’m glad to see that you’re safe... Wait! Where is Ephraim? Is he well?

speaker: Eirika
text: I wish I knew.

speaker: Tana
text: You haven’t heard from him? Oh, I hope he’s not been harmed... Come, we must go to Castle Frelia. My lord father may know something.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, Tana.

speaker: Hayden
text: Oh, Tana... I’m grateful to see that you’re safe and home again! You’ve no idea how I worried when I heard you were under attack at Border Mulan. You are not to leave again without my permission. Do you understand?

speaker: Tana
text: Don’t be mad, Father. Look, I come bearing good news. Eirika! Come out now!

speaker: Eirika
text: King Hayden, I am please to see you again, even in these sad times.

speaker: Hayden
text: Ah, Eirika! It does my heart good to see you safe.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you. I was able to escape the castle before Renais fell. But I’m not sure if my father...

speaker: Hayden
text: Yes. I... have received word of your father.

speaker: Eirika
text: Your Highness? Please tell me. If my father well?

speaker: Hayden
text: ...My friend King Fado...did not survive the fall of Renais Castle.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...No, it cannot be...

speaker: Hayden
text: Rest assured, Grado will be punished for its cowardly act. This is Frelia’s promise. Eirika, please stay here and rest. I cannot imagine how exhausted you must be.

speaker: Seth
text: King Hayden. You know of Prince Ephraim’s disappearance, do you not?

speaker: Hayden
text: Yes, we hear the prince and his men hound Grado at every turn. It’s said that he’s led his forces into the empire itself. Reports suggest he’s crossed the border and now fights in Renvall.

speaker: Eirika
text: My brother... He fights on? Even now?

speaker: Hayden
text: Yes. My pegasus knights bought this information at a great price. Even though Renais has fallen, he charges into the enemy’s heart. He is truly Fado’s son... What a valiant youth. I wish I knew whether he remains unharmed, but I do not.

speaker: Eirika
text: King Hayden, I thank you for your offer, but I cannot stay. I intend to ride to my brother’s side with reinforcements.

speaker: Hayden
text: I cannot allow it. I know how you feel, but this plan is suicide. I would be betraying Fado’s memory if I allowed any harm to befall you. Stay here. Rest and mourn. Leave this war to the warriors.

speaker: Eirika
text: I know you mean well, Your Majesty. However, I have lost my father, and my twin brother is in peril. My brother, he is a part of me... I cannot rest here in peace while he risks his life.

speaker: Hayden
text: No. Renais has no more army. Grado’s forces decimated it. I wish Frelia could provide you with support, with soldiers, but... My son, Innes, is on his way to meet the empire’s forces. We cannot spare a single brigade. Your own retinue of knights cannot possibly face Grado alone. Are you so determined to go?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. ...With apologies.

speaker: Hayden
text: ...As resolute as your father, eh? What am I to do in the face of such foolhardy determination? Vanessa.

speaker: Vanessa
text: Here, Your Highness!

speaker: Hayden
text: Moulder.

speaker: Moulder
text: You called, my king?

speaker: Hayden
text: Gilliam.

speaker: Gilliam
text: Yes, sire?

speaker: Hayden
text: You are to accompany Princess Eirika of Renais into Grado territory. I expect each of you to provide aid and support for her brother.

speaker: Gilliam
text: Hmm. Quite a grave responsibility you’ve given us.

speaker: Vanessa
text: No matter the obstacles, we will perform our duty.

speaker: Gilliam
text: Our lives are yours.

speaker: Hayden
text: These are some of my most trusted and stalwart vassals. They will, no doubt, prove themselves quite valuable on your journey. Remember, you are venturing behind enemy lines. You will need supplies. I will have a supply convoy readied to carry your weapons and provisions. It will remain at your side, no matter how far afield you venture.

speaker: Eirika
text: King Hayden, I... Thank you.

speaker: Hayden
text: No, save your thanks for your return... with your brother, Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, Your highness!

speaker: Tana
text: Eirika, you don’t really intend to go through with this, do you? I can’t guess how you must feel, but its’ just too dangerous. What would happen if you were captured by Grado’s men?

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you for your concern, Tana. But I have no choice. Don’t you see, Tana? I have to go.

speaker: Tana
text: Eirika... Oh, why is this happening? What’s gone wrong with the world?

speaker: Eirika
text: Tana...

speaker: Tana
text: Why would Grado invade? Emperor Vigarde is a man of peace. His people adore him. And you and Ephraim are friends with Prince Lyon, are you not? What could be behind this madness? Why is this happening...

speaker: Eirika
text: I have no answers for you, Tana. I don’t want to believe it, but the reality is that we are at war. If I do nothing, I may lose my brother as well as my father. This is why I have to fight. It’s the only answer I have.

speaker: Seth
text: The local villagers tell me that Bazba’s Bandits keep their lair nearby. A few of them saw a lad matching the description of our bracelet thief. It seems a fair guess that the youth is one of these bandits.

speaker: Eirika
text: Bandits...Here in Renais, our homeland. I had no idea... Burning out villages...Stealing from out people with no fear of reprisal?

speaker: Seth
text: It wasn’t always like this. The knights used to protect the citizenry... However, with Renais in ruins and her army tattered, law and order are hard to find. It doesn’t look like the Grado army is interested in maintaining order here. If nothing changes, Renais will continue this sad plunge into savagery.

speaker: Neimi
text: Uh...Hello?

speaker: Neimi
text: Pardon me for asking... but are you all some sort of...mercenary troop?

speaker: Eirika
text: Why do you ask?

speaker: Neimi
text: P-p-please, you have to help Colm. You have to! I told him it was too dangerous, but he wouldn’t listen to me!

speaker: Eirika
text: Please, you must calm yourself. Start at the beginning, and speak slowly.

speaker: Neimi
text: All right...Sniff. I’m Neimi. I’m from... I used to be from a village named Lark... Except the village is gone.

speaker: Eirika
text: Gone? What do you mean?

speaker: Neimi
text: Bazba’s Bandits burned it down. Only Colm and I escaped. The other villagers... The bandits attacked them and...

speaker: Seth
text: Neimi, what are you doing here?

speaker: Neimi
text: Bazba’s Bandits... They have a hideout here in these mountains. That’s where Colm... Um, Colm’s my...uh...We’ve known each other since we were kids. He went to steal back something the bandits took from me...

speaker: Eirika
text: He went alone? That’s a very dangerous thing...

speaker: Neimi
text: Yes, I know. Th-that’s what I told him, but he wouldn’t listen to me. If I lose Colm, too, I don’t know... I...I’ll... sniff...

speaker: Eirika
text: Wait, please don’t cry. Don’t worry. We’ll find your friend and see that he’s not harmed.

speaker: Neimi
text: Really? Really and truly? Oh, thank you! Thank you!!! I... I don’t have much money, but.. I’ll do anything to help.

speaker: Seth
text: Your Highness? What will it be?

speaker: Eirika
text: If the thief we’re after has gone to the bandits?lair as well... Well, it seems as though we share a common cause with Neimi. She is a citizen of Renais, after all. And isn’t it our duty to defend our countrymen? I’m only sad that we weren’t here to protect her friends and neighbors... So, yes, I feel we must help her.

speaker: Seth
text: Very well. Neimi, I trust you can lead the way?

speaker: Neimi
text: Er, yes... It’s this way.

speaker: Neimi
text: Um... Is there anything I can do to help? I feel so... When I was little I used to go hunting with my grandfather. What I mean is I can– I’m not bad with a bow.

speaker: Seth
text: Really?

speaker: Neimi
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Seth
text: I see. You should remain behind and protect Princess Eirika.

speaker: Bazba
text: Hm. Not sure who’s out there, but it looks like we’ve got guests. Let’s give ’em a warm welcome, lads. You see a stranger, stick an axe in him!

speaker: Colm
text: And here we go! Ha! And not a soul saw me. These bandits are easy picking. I guess I might as well start with these chests here.

speaker: Neimi
text: C-Colm...

speaker: Colm
text: Neimi?! What are you doing here? I told you to wait for me, didn’t I?

speaker: Neimi
text: I couldn’t... It’s too dangerous. C’mon, let’s go home.

speaker: Colm
text: We don’t have a home! Don’t you get it? Look, just leave everything to me. I can take care of it in a flash, but I don’t need a clumsy oaf like you tagging along.

speaker: Neimi
text: But...but...

speaker: Colm
text: Oh, this is ridiculous. We’ll talk later. Don’t leave my side, Neimi.

speaker: Neimi
text: I–All right.

speaker: Bazba
text: I’m the head of this bandit pack, the mighty Bazba! Hope you’ve enjoyed your life, ‘cuz it’s about to end!

speaker: Bazba
text: I’m the...mighty...Bazba... This...ain’t–

speaker: Neimi
text: C-Colm...

speaker: Colm
text: What now? I told you not to worry. I could’ve robbed these bandits blind on my own, thank you very much.

speaker: Neimi
text: I was... worried...

speaker: Colm
text: H-Hold on! I’m sorry! C’mon! Don’t start bawling!

speaker: Neimi
text: Aaah...sniff... No more...dangerous stuff... by yourself...

speaker: Colm
text: Fine, fine. I promise. But you have to stop crying all the time. All right?

speaker: Neimi
text: Uh-huh...

speaker: Colm
text: Oh, yeah. Take a look at this.

speaker: Neimi
text: Hm?

speaker: Colm
text: I got your mirror back. Remember how you cried when we left Lark? You thought you’d lost this. I knew it was your mother’s, and I knew those thugs had taken it. So I went and got it back! See what happens when you give me a job? Guaranteed results!

speaker: Neimi
text: Colm... Aa...Waaah... Colm...

speaker: Colm
text: Hey Wh-why are you crying this time? C’mon! Stop! Knock it off! Please, Neimi...

speaker: Seth
text: ...This is quite touching, but... I think you’d best return Princess Eirika’s bracelet to her now.

speaker: Colm
text: Wh-what are you talking about? Are you trying to say that I–

speaker: Colm
text: Whoa! Whoa there! Hold it! It’s right here! Take it!

speaker: Seth
text: ...... Tell me, boy, is this the path you’ve chosen for your life? If this girl matters to you, you must quit this dark road.

speaker: Colm
text: Uh, yeah...Right.

speaker: Seth
text: We’re leaving. Do not expect to be rescued again. Farewell.

speaker: Colm
text: ...Hey, wait! Let us go with you. You can’t just leave us here.

speaker: Seth
text: Pardon?

speaker: Colm
text: Neimi and I... We’ve got no home to return to. No matter where we go, there’s just gonna be more fighting. You’re mercenaries, right? Well, then take us with you. I’m a handy guy to have around. I know I can help you out.

speaker: Seth
text: I would prefer not, but I’ll agree with Eirika’s decision. Our duty is a grave one however. We’ve no time to waste shepherding you.

speaker: Colm
text: That’s fine with us You just wait– I promise you won’t regret your decision.

speaker: Seth
text: I retrieved your bracelet from the bandit’s stronghold. Here you are, Princess.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, Seth. You know...Father gave me this bracelet when I was a child. It has only one match in the world, and my brother wears it.

speaker: Seth
text: Lady Eirika, you must take care never to lose that bracelet. It is the proof that King Fado entrusted the future of Renais to you, his children.

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth...What is it you’re not telling me?

speaker: Seth
text: ...I apologize, Your Highness. When the times comes, I will tell you what I know. Until then, I...

speaker: Eirika
text: I see. If you tell me it must wait, then it can wait. I trust you.

speaker: Seth
text: Then we should get moving again. We’re safe from bandits for now, but I can’t guarantee for how long.

speaker: Eirika
text: This... This is just the beginning, isn’t it? If we hope to free out homeland, it will take battle after battle...

speaker: Seth
text: I’m afraid so, Your Highness. The day you and Prince Ephraim win back the freedom and honor of Renais will come. But I fear it lies at the end of a long and treacherous road.

speaker: Eirika
text: I know. I must fight for that day. In the names of all those I could not save, I’ll lead us home. Let’s go. My brother awaits!

speaker: Selena
text: General Duessel.

speaker: Duessel
text: Selena. Have you been back long? Tell me, how fares the campaign in Renais?

speaker: Selena
text: Signs of chaos abound. Brigands ride without fear, and the peasant’s cries fill the air.

speaker: Duessel
text: Hmm... If Grado’s troops do not enforce public order, the situation will only worsen. And still, His Majesty has given us no orders. Perhaps, just this once, I should take the lead...

speaker: Glen
text: What could His Majesty be thinking? Breaking our long-held alliance with Renais–invading without warning... He’s never been this way before. He abhors violence.

speaker: Glen
text: And have you noticed the recent promotions? Who are they are going to? Certainly not to the soldiers who have Grado’s best interests at heart. I feel this invasion is the prelude to a much larger war. I feel as though His Majesty is no longer the man we knew him to be.

speaker: Selena
text: Glen, it doesn’t matter what any of us might think of our orders. We are his servants, and we will not question His Majesty’s intentions.

speaker: Glen
text: I know that, Selena. And yet...

speaker: Duessel
text: That’s enough. Both of you. His Majesty summons us. Let’s hope we can learn a little during our audience.

speaker: Vigarde
text: ...I appreciate your work in fulfilling your previous orders. You are the hammers that drive the nails of the empire’s will... You will continue to operate ...without hesitation... wherever I send you.

speaker: Duessel
text: By your command.

speaker: Selena
text: In Your Majesty’s name.

speaker: Glen
text: Yes, sire...

speaker: Vigarde
text: ...However, I know this... You, my Imperial Three, lack the strength to conquer the remaining nations alone. In the invasion of Renais, certain soldiers performed beyond expectation. I have chosen them to join you as new generals in the empire’s service. ...Come.

speaker: Vigarde
text: ...The performance of these men surpassed even your own. With the addition of these three... The empire will have six generals strong enough to conquer this land. Do you understand?

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... I am Riev, given the name Blood Beryl by His Majesty. I know I am a newcomer, but I pray for your favor.

speaker: Duessel
text: ...Understood.

speaker: Caellach
text: I’m Caellach. I was a mercenary, fighting in the desert. Seems I’m to be called Tiger Eye... You’re a fine lookin’ lass, aren’t you? Yeah, I’m gonna love working with you.

speaker: Valter
text: So we meet again. You know me as General Valter, but you will call me the Moonstone. I’ll save you worthless dogs from your own incompetence. You’ll thank me later.

speaker: Glen
text: Valter... You scum!

speaker: Duessel
text: Peace, Glen.

speaker: Vigarde
text: Selena. Caellach. You will bring me Frelia.

speaker: Selena
text: Yes, sire.

speaker: Caellach
text: Sure. Good as done.

speaker: Vigarde
text: Riev. Duessel. You are charged with the defense of the empire. ...I will speak to you individually with more details later.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... Understood, Your Majesty.

speaker: Duessel
text: By your command, sire.

speaker: Valter
text: And me?

speaker: Vigarde
text: Valter, Glen... I have other duties for you...

speaker: Glen
text: Yes, Your Majesty?

speaker: Vigarde
text: Renais has fallen, but Princess Eirika still eludes us... Her brother, Prince Ephraim, leads a resistance within our borders. Bring the siblings to me.

speaker: Valter
text: Ha ha.. Of course.

speaker: Lyon
text: ...I yield. The point is yours, Eirika. You’re swift, aren’t you? Compared to you, I’m– I’ve been bested at fencing by a woman. Pitiful crown prince, am I not?

speaker: Eirika
text: That’s not true...

speaker: Lyon
text: Oh, no, Eirika. It is. The people need a strong ruler. They don’t want a weakling like me. They want the strength you and Ephraim share. My body is frail. I prefer to spend my time locked away in the castle, reading... I think my father would be better served if someone else took my place. I’m sure all of our retainers feel the same...

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re wrong, Lyon. An emperor without compassion will never hold the people’s love. And one day, your compassion will surely save us all. I believe that.

speaker: Lyon
text: Eirika... Thank you. Yes. I...I will do my best. Even though I lack your strength, there must be some good I can do.

speaker: Eirika
text: There is.

speaker: Lyon
text: By the way, Eirika... If it please you, would you accept this?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika? Is there something wrong?

speaker: Eirika
text: N-no. It’s nothing.

speaker: Seth
text: Jehanna Hall has been completely occupied by Grado soldiers. I’m sorry to report that Queen Ismaire is already...

speaker: Innes
text: And the one giving orders to the troops in the palace is Crown Prince Lyon?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What is there to give us pause? Should we not storm the palace and retake it by strength of arms?

speaker: Innes
text: Frelia’s spy network reports that Prince Lyon is an initiate of dark magic. If this is true, even approaching him will be a serious challenge. I’d heard the prince dislikes violence. However, it could all have been a ruse.

speaker: Innes
text: Still, if we don’t retake the palace, we’ve no hope of defeating Grado. We must rescue the queen, no matter the cost...

speaker: Eirika
text: I understand. Let’s go!

speaker: Carlyle
text: Queen Ismaire... Please do not resist. I have no desire to see you harmed.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Carlyle... Why have you betrayed us? After all these years of loyal service as Jehanna’s most decorated commander... Without you, I could not have ruled these long years since my husband’s passing. It was through your unwavering support alone that I still sit upon the throne. You are the cornerstone of Jehanna. You have held my trust more than any man. So tell me why. Why have you betrayed us? Why have you betrayed me?

speaker: Carlyle
text: Your Highness–No... My queen... Ismaire... It is your own fault. You are too lovely, my queen.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Carlyle...

speaker: Carlyle
text: The first time I met you, twenty years ago now... I saw you in the garden of this very palace... and I was bewitched. Your pale beauty far surpassed that of any flower. I was in the grips of an unforgivable desire. You were the wife of my king, to whom I’d sworn life and loyalty. I told myself a grand lie that day. I told myself I could be happy simply serving you as your most loyal knight.

speaker: Carlyle
text: After years of duty, years of service, years of...of silence... I became aware once more of the feelings I’d buried deep within myself. How could I leave this world without expressing my true desires? Could anything be more desolate? More devoid of meaning? That is when I made my decision. I would follow my heart and claim your hand as my own.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Carlyle... You forget yourself. You ruin our country and kill our countrymen. Did you think I would be pleased? Did you think I would love you for this?

speaker: Carlyle
text: I need no country. I care nothing for my countrymen. I can see nothing but you. If you would only be mine...

speaker: Ismaire
text: Carlyle...

speaker: Soldier
text: To arms, mercenaries. We’re under attack! You there! Ready your weapons!

speaker: Rennac
text: What?!? No, no, no. That was never part of the deal. The only fight I’m here for is with the locks of the treasure chamber.

speaker: Soldier
text: Hah... Don’t get so excited. I doubt you mercenaries will see any action at all once we soldiers’ve finished.

speaker: Rennac
text: Yeah, great. You go do that. Whew... With all these soldiers around, I shouldn’t have to lift a finger. I’ll just sit here and wait for them to win they day. Then, I collect my pay! No more being ordered around by that selfish princess and her moronic bodyguard. This is the life. Lady Luck loves me. But something doesn’t feel right...

speaker: Caellach
text: Hey, Carlyle! Impressive work you’ve done here. My compliments.

speaker: Carlyle
text: ...I gave you everything I promised. I opened the hall to your forces.

speaker: Caellach
text: Yes. The palace is mine. My palace... Oh, how I do like the sound of that.

speaker: Carlyle
text: Do whatever you want with the royal treasury. The only treasure I wish to leave here with is the queen of my heart.

speaker: Caellach
text: Oh, yeah, about your queen?.. There’s been a change of plans.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Ah!

speaker: Caellach
text: Don’t move, Carlyle. You twitch, and the queen dies.

speaker: Carlyle
text: Blackheart! What is the meaning of this?

speaker: Caellach
text: Calm down. You’ll get her back as soon as I’m done with her. Jehanna’s Sacred Stone is around here somewhere. I’ve got to find it and destroy it. I need this woman to guide me to its hiding place.

speaker: Carlyle
text: Do not lay a hand on my queen!

speaker: Carlyle
text: Don’t get so incensed. I’m not going to harm her. I’m not like that freak Valter. I’m kind to women. But if you make a wrong move, you’ll lose your prize. Understood?

speaker: Carlyle
text: Yes...

speaker: Caellach
text: There are some annoying pests outside who think to win back the hall. I want you to take care of them. Lose, and the queen will never be yours.

speaker: Carlyle
text: ...... If my queen comes to any harm in your care...

speaker: Caellach
text: Yes, of course. I know all about the might of your sword arm. As long as the Sacred Stone is destroyed, you’ll get all you ask for.

speaker: Caellach
text: Greetings, Prince. Let’s get going.

speaker: Lyon
text: Caellach... You will put an end to this. Destroying the Sacred Stones is... Ugh...ack...

speaker: Caellach
text: What’s this? Are you still ill? You know, you’re not very princely. C’mon. Follow me.

speaker: Lyon
text: Caellach...

speaker: Rennac
text: Hey, that’s a comely lass. Think I’ll have a few words... Wait. Er, haven’t I met you before?

speaker: Eirika
text: You... You were traveling with L’Arachel before, weren’t you?

speaker: Rennac
text: Oh, yeah... Renais... I’ve got to get–

speaker: Eirika
text: L’Arachel is traveling with us. Should I let her know you’re here?

speaker: Rennac
text: Uh, no! Wait a moment! You... You don’t have to bother her. Actually I wanted to ask you something. How would you like to hire me? The name’s Rennac. I’m a world-class thief, and proud of it. A man of many talents. Lockpicks are for amateurs. I can pick chests and doors with my bare hands. And I’m better with a blade than most swordsmen.

speaker: Eirika
text: Uh...

speaker: Rennac
text: I’m a useful fellow to have around. And cheap, too! Only 9,980 gold! Well, what do you think?

speaker: Eirika
text: Fine. I’ll pay the 9,980 gold.

speaker: Rennac
text: Very good! You know a bargain when you see one, don’t you? Not at all like a certain pious princess I know.

speaker: Eirika
text: Were you speaking of L’Arachel?

speaker: Rennac
text: Uh, no... Idle chitchat about that lass is bound to land me in hot water. Right, then! You’re my new boss. Point out any doors or chests, and get out of my way!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Aha! So this is where you’ve wandered off to, Rennac!

speaker: Rennac
text: Princess L’Arachel? Uh-oh, um...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Come with me.

speaker: Rennac
text: Wait... hold on now. Go with you where? Look, sorry, but I’ve been hired by the Grado Empire, and... Hello! I’m talking to you!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Rennac, whatever is the matter? I promise to listen to your story later, but now, we must be going!

speaker: Rennac
text: No, I’m no servant, like that kook Dozla. I’m a mercenary. I escorted you to Renais like I was hired to do, didn’t I? You have no right to drag me across creation without any pay whatsoever!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Is this about wages? I believe you’ve received ample compensation.

speaker: Rennac
text: Ample?! Do you even know what that word means? You’ve the princess of Rausten! I thought working for you would pay well. Yet your purse strings are knotted tight, and I’ve almost been killed so many–

speaker: L’Arachel
text: The joy that comes from doing good is not something that can be purchased. There. All better? Let’s go.

speaker: Rennac
text: NO! I said I don’t want to! Riding with you is– ...And there she goes. Oh...By the Stones, why did I ever take that job in the first place?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We must hurry, Rennac.

speaker: Rennac
text: Right, right. I’m coming...

speaker: Carlyle
text: I...I just wanted the two of us...

speaker: Carlyle
text: Queen Ismaire. I’m–

speaker: Caellach
text: This is as good a place as any. All right, Your Majesty. Hand over the Sacred Stone.

speaker: Ismaire
text: ...I know nothing of the Sacred Stone’s keeping place.

speaker: Caellach
text: Don’t waste me time. My partner here sees everything. When the rebellion began, you went straight to the palace altar. You had hoped to prevent us from smashing the Sacred Stone. But you have the Stone of Jehanna with you right now, don’t you?

speaker: Caellach
text: Hand it over. Cooperate, and I’ll let you live.

speaker: Ismaire
text: ...I cannot.

speaker: Caellach
text: Oh, give it up, will you? I’ve no time for games. If you resist, I’ll just kill you and take it anyway.

speaker: Lyon
text: H-hold! You mustn’t harm her, Caellach...

speaker: Caellach
text: Shut up, Prince. My orders come from higher than you. You’ve not going to start disobeying his word, are you?

speaker: Caellach
text: Last chance. Give me your Sacred Stone.

speaker: Ismaire
text: ...I cannot.

speaker: Caellach
text: Ha ha! A queen to the end. I like you. You’ve got guts. Good-bye.

speaker: Lyon
text: Ah!

speaker: Caellach
text: And here’s the Sacred Stone. That makes two for me. I’m on a roll now.

speaker: Caellach
text: And another Sacred Stone has been destroyed. Grado, Frelia, and now Jehanna... Only two stones remain.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Uuh...ahh...

speaker: Lyon
text: Ah... What should I do? C-Caellach... You must help her.

speaker: Caellach
text: Leave her. Let her last breath be a harsh and ragged rasp. She’s not long for this world. Why, if you really wanted to help her, you’d deliver the final blow yourself!

speaker: Lyon
text: N-no. I couldn’t.

speaker: Caellach
text: ...What a joke. I have a little work to wrap up in the hall before we leave. You should hit the road pretty soon, too, Prince.

speaker: Eirika
text: I wonder where Queen Ismaire is.

speaker: Innes
text: I heard she was in the throne room, but there’s no sight of her. And there’s no Sacred Stone, either.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We must search quickly.

speaker: Lyon
text: Ah...

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon!

speaker: Lyon
text: Eirika...

speaker: Eirika
text: Wait, Lyon! Don’t run away! My brother and I have been so worried about you... We know more then anyone the gentleness of your spirit. Your father is deranged, isn’t he? That’s why Grado invaded Renais, right? Tell me, Lyon... Please... Tell me what has happened.

speaker: Lyon
text: I’m sorry, Eirika. I’ve wanted to see you and Ephraim for so long now... I wanted to see you so that I could apologize. The invasion of Renais... I couldn’t stop it. I’m sorry, but I still cannot talk to you. Not yet...

speaker: Eirika
text: You... You have a reason, don’t you?

speaker: Lyon
text: Mm... I can’t talk about it now, but... I promise I will tell you everything someday.

speaker: Eirika
text: I see... I believe you, Lyon. I must tell you, I’m a little relieved. I was afraid you’d changed as much as your poor father has. I’m so glad.

speaker: Lyon
text: Me, too, Eirika... No, you have changed. You’re even more beautiful than you were before.

speaker: Eirika
text: L-Lyon...

speaker: Lyon
text: I’m sorry, I have to go. But please remember this. This war started because I was too weak to stop it, but... I’ll always be your friend.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Eirika, what are you doing? It seems Queen Ismaire has been found. This way!

speaker: Eirika
text: Y-yes. Coming!

speaker: Innes
text: Queen Ismaire... Is she...

speaker: Seth
text: We’re too late. Her injuries are... She will not last much longer.

speaker: Ismaire
text: ...Jo...Joshua... ...Joshua...

speaker: Eirika
text: Queen Ismaire!

speaker: Ismaire
text: Oh, Joshua... Where is...that boy...

speaker: Eirika
text: Queen Ismaire...

speaker: Ismaire
text: Please forgive me, Joshua... I was a foolish mother... I was so intent on being queen that I spared no time to be your mother. But I loved you nonetheless... Please understand...

speaker: Joshua
text: ..... I know, Mother.

speaker: Eirika
text: Joshua...

speaker: Ismaire
text: Joshua... It really is you... Joshua...my son...

speaker: Joshua
text: I’m sorry, Mother. I should never have left you. I’ve no excuse... I wanted to see the world as a man, not as a prince. I wanted to be worthy. I planned on returning to your side afterward... I was so foolish. If I’d been here, I could have–

speaker: Ismaire
text: No, it’s fine. You’re here now... Listen to me, Joshua. The Stone of Jehanna has... been destroyed. The one who tempted Carlyle is responsible...

speaker: Joshua
text: What? Who was it?

speaker: Ismaire
text: ...Carried a dark stone... It is...the origin of all this... It should not exist... Joshua...you must... Our country...our people...

speaker: Joshua
text: I understand, Mother.

speaker: Ismaire
text: Thank you...Joshua... I have something... Something I must give you...

speaker: Joshua
text: This is...

speaker: Ismaire
text: It’s one of the Sacred Twin relics, unique to House Jehanna... He who would rule our land must possess it... I’ve watched over it since your father passed away. I kept it safe and waited for this day to come...

speaker: Joshua
text: Mother... I have it now. I understand its meaning...

speaker: Ismaire
text: Joshua... My...dear, sweet child...

speaker: Joshua
text: Mother...

speaker: Joshua
text: It’s been more than ten years. I’d grown tied of the formality of palace life, so I...just left. I wrote a farewell and left the palace, taking nothing with me. I felt I could never understand the people while I stayed sequestered in a castle. I abandoned my identity and roamed the continent, working where I could. I wanted only to be worthy of becoming king. I knew one day I would return. Gods, I was so foolish! I was such a child, I see it now. Was I simply rebelling against my mother? Punishing her for tending to her duties?

speaker: Joshua
text: I was a fool, yes, but I learned much over these ten years. I have learned about the hearts of our people, how they need to be governed. I have learned how our country needs to change and to grow. I have learned much, but I’ve lost much more. Mother...

speaker: Eirika
text: Prince Joshua...

speaker: Joshua
text: I made a promise. I want to continue what she began. I will help defeat Grado. I will defend Jehanna and her allies. ...I know it doesn’t sound like me, but...

speaker: Innes
text: On behalf of Frelia, I came to Jehanna with a letter to the throne. I give it to you. Prince Joshua of Jehanna... Let us fight together.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Renais, Frelia, Rausten, and Jehanna. Four nations...united!

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, I suppose that’s true. And my brother is with us as well. And if it were possible... Lyon... I wish you could be here with us, too.

speaker: Soldier
text: Fire! Fires have broken out all through the hall!

speaker: Joshua
text: What?

speaker: Soldier
text: The curtains were soaked in oil, with torches set about the hall. It’s a trap! Someone did this during all the fighting. You must flee! Quickly, before the flames engulf us all!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika. We must evacuate...

speaker: Eirika
text: I know. Joshua, we must go. Now.

speaker: Joshua
text: No... Mother... Forgive me...

speaker: Eirika
text: Is everyone well? Did anyone get left behind?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We all made it. It’s so smoky that it’s hard to tell, but we’re here. What a cowardly act, setting fire to the palace hall. But we’ve escaped without injury. The enemy’s trap has failed.

speaker: Innes
text: ...No, it hasn’t. Assemble the troops now. The enemy is coming.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: What did you say?

speaker: Innes
text: This is the reason for the fire. To drive us from the palace. They’ll be attacking soon. No other plan makes sense.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: How is it that you know that?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika. I’ve just received word that Grado reinforcements are headed this way. There are two armies, led by Generals Valter and Caellach.

speaker: Eirika
text: No!

speaker: Innes
text: Two armies... They’re willing to send so many here and leave the capital defenseless?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Why does everyone seem so distraught? It matters not who stands in our path. We shall smite them all with the power of righteousness!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika... It’s going to be very difficult for us to continue. One of Grado’s generals alone is more than a match for us. Compound that with the exhaustion of our troops, and I’m not sure we can–

speaker: Innes
text: Bah... With Jehanna Hall in flames, we’ve no place to hole up and dig in for a siege. We have to retreat. We have to win ourselves time for form a plan. Grado sent two generals... What could be happening in their capital? And what of Ephraim? Is he still alive?

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Brother...

speaker: Tirado
text: What a pleasant surprise. It’s Master Valter.

speaker: Valter
text: What’s the situation, Tirado? You have captured Ephraim, haven’t you?

speaker: Tirado
text: No. Prince Ephraim still fights in the lands north of Renvall.

speaker: Valter
text: And why is that? What has happened to all those mercenaries you hired?

speaker: Tirado
text: They’ve proven to be less then adequate. Ephraim’s clever. His band strikes quickly and then vanishes into the woods. We more than double his numbers, and yet he uses the terrain wisely to fight us. He has no army–just a small force of knights loyal to Renais. Prince Ephraim’s reputation as a superb strategist would seem to be well earned.

speaker: Valter
text: Hmm... How interesting. The lad’s beginning to whet my appetite. Tirado...Bring him to me as quickly as you can, will you?

speaker: Tirado
text: As you command. Just grant me an army, and I’ll bring him down swiftly.

speaker: Valter
text: What sort of plan do you have?

speaker: Tirado
text: Master, I am your loyal adjutant, and you are my general. For you, my lord, I have many plans ready and waiting.

speaker: Valter
text: Really? Well then, let me hear them.

speaker: Tirado
text: Very well. First, you and I will leave this fort and head north. Then, we will find Prince Ephraim in his leafy playpen.

speaker: Valter
text: But he’s not easily found, is he?

speaker: Tirado
text: Do not worry. At Prince Ephraim’s side is... a friend, shall we say. When the time is right, our friend will move on our behalf...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Forde, how are we on supplies and equipment?

speaker: Forde
text: It’s not looking good. Our weapons are in bad shape, and we’re running low on food. We can probably restock at a nearby village, but–

speaker: Ephraim
text: No, that’s not an option. We’re in enemy territory. I will not involve innocents if I can avoid it.

speaker: Forde
text: Yeah, I knew you’d say that. I mean, it’s because of stuff like that that we’ve stuck with you so far. But eventually, we do need to face reality. What are we going to do?

speaker: Kyle
text: Word of mouth has it that the invasion of Renais has progressed quite far. I’ve heard that the capital has fallen.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Hm...So soon... Still, my father is in the capital, and he won’t surrender easily. Forde, Kyle. Our mission here is to harry the troops, to distract their eye. Hopefully, we’ll be able to give my father and Eirika time to escape. Kyle, have you heard anything from Orson? I sent him ahead to scout.

speaker: Kyle
text: No word yet, and it’s about time he returned...

speaker: Orson
text: Reporting in, Prince Ephraim. I can confirm Grado presence at several points around our camp. Also, a large battalion of soldiers has been dispatched from Renvall. We shouldn’t tarry here any longer than necessary...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I see.

speaker: Forde
text: Seems as though we’ve certainly caught Grado’s eye this time. Should we retreat back to the capital, Prince Ephraim?

speaker: Ephraim
text: No. We press onward. We’re going to capture Renvall.

speaker: Forde
text: Wh-what?!?

speaker: Ephraim
text: So this is Renvall, is it? All right, let’s go.

speaker: Forde
text: Um...Are you...sure you’re quite sane, Prince Ephraim? We’ve an entire army after us, and you want to charge their stronghold?

speaker: Kyle
text: Forde! Watch your tongue! This is our prince you’re addressing!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Kyle, please, it’s all right. We’ve heard nothing from home, So what harm could a little reckless besieging cause?

speaker: Kyle
text: Prince Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Don’t worry. I haven’t lost all sense of self-preservation. Renvall holds an important place in Grado’s national defense. If we can get the upper hand and take control of it, then Grado will waste many valuable soldiers trying to take it back I hope our attack proves useful to my father and Eirika.

speaker: Forde
text: I understand what you’re saying, but... can we do it with our current strength?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Every soldier in this area is trying to find us. The enemy has us vastly outnumbered. Attacking the castle is a ridiculous idea. If the enemy thinks the same... then we may have our opening.

speaker: Forde
text: You have a point. I’m sure Renvall won’t expect us to attack with these numbers. Either way, we can’t run forever. And we’re running out of supplies. What’ve we got to lose? Shall we get ready to go?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes. If we don’t move quickly, we may never get another chance. Trust me. I don’t pick fights I cannot win.

speaker: Kyle
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Zonta
text: An attack? By Ephraim’s troops? To arms! Prince Ephraim’s circled around and brought the fight to us! If we capture the prince here, we can line our pockets with gold! Do you understand? We’ll be rich!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Orson.

speaker: Orson
text: Yes...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Your wounds still haven’t healed from that last battle, have they? Don’t push yourself. If we’re defeated, you must return to Frelia. Understood?

speaker: Orson
text: Understood...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Let’s go! Kyle! Forde!

speaker: Zonta
text: Do you truly think you can take us with those numbers? Imbecile! You’ll learn the error of your ways.

speaker: Zonta
text: L-lord Tirado...It can’t be... Were we...merely pawns?

speaker: Kyle
text: We’ve secured the entire castle. You were brilliant, Prince Ephraim! What a plan! What a battle!

speaker: Ephraim
text: I estimate at least half of the enemy troops are in the field. We took the castle, but we don’t have the manpower to hold it in a siege. There’s no point in lingering here. Let’s continue on to Grado Keep.

speaker: Forde
text: Prince Ephraim, things have taken a turn for the worse. I took a look around the castle perimeter... We’re surrounded.

speaker: Kyle
text: What?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Grado’s sent reinforcements? So quickly...?

speaker: Kyle
text: What should we do?

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...... We must escape!

speaker: Valter
text: So, you’ve captured Renvall, have you? And with such a small force! Impressive! You’ve earned your reputation. I must say, I quite admire your work. I take it you’re the leader of this pack–the misguided Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I am.

speaker: Valter
text: I’m General Valter, the Moonstone of Grado’s Imperial Army. Catching up to you has caused me no small amount of trouble. We’ve reduced your wretched home of Renais to ruin, and yet... you and your little band of bravos continue to be a thorn in our side. But that all ends here.

speaker: Ephraim
text: We’ll see...You claim you’ve taken the capital of Renais... Tell me, how did you know I would attack Renvall?

speaker: Valter
text: Ha ha... Patience. You’ll have your answer soon enough. Now, be good lads, and drop your weapons, will you?

speaker: Kyle
text: Prince Ephraim, let us attack!

speaker: Valter
text: Listen to me, Ephraim. You’re a smart man. You know it’s futile to fight me. You cannot win. You cannot escape. Accept the reality of your situation, and surrender to me.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Surrender?

speaker: Valter
text: Heh heh heh... That’s right. If you do, I’ll let you live. I hold your life in the palm of my hand. Do not test my good humor. Now, come over here, bend your knee, and beg for your life. Show me how Renais dogs grovel.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I think not.

speaker: Valter
text: What?

speaker: Ephraim
text: You said your name was Valter, didn’t you? Well, I’m sorry, Valter, but I don’t have time to waste playing games with you. So, we’re going to knock you louts about a bit and then make our way out of here.

speaker: Valter
text: Fool... Have you gone mad? Do you truly believe you can fight your way past my wyvern knights?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Watch and see. I don’t pick fights I can’t win. Kyle, Forde. Are you ready?

speaker: Kyle
text: My life has been yours since the moment I took my chivalric vows.

speaker: Forde
text: It’s moments like these that keep me by your side, my prince.

speaker: Valter
text: What idiotic wretches you are... Prepare yourselves to be destroyed utterly!

speaker: Ephraim
text: We break to the east. GO!

speaker: Soldier
text: Your Majesty, I bear bad news. The castle gate has been breached. Emperor Vigarde's forces are within the castle walls.

speaker: Fado
text: I understand.

speaker: Soldier
text: The garrison has fallen. We've lost contact with Prince Ephraim and can expect no aid from his men. Your Majesty, what are we to do?

speaker: Fado
text: ...What else can we do? Order your men to lay down their arms.

speaker: Eirika
text: Father...

speaker: Fado
text: Eirika. Are you wearing the bracelet I gave you?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, I have it right here.

speaker: Fado
text: Good. Seth.

speaker: Seth
text: Yes, Your Majesty?

speaker: Fado
text: Take Eirika and head for Frelia. King Hayden is an honorable man. I trust he will keep you safe.

speaker: Seth
text: Understood. And what of Your Majesty?

speaker: Fado
text: Me? I shall remain here. We have long held Grado among our dearest allies, yet now, they attack? I must know why. Am I somehow responsible for this? Have I erred in my leadership? Renais is mine to guide... How could I have failed her so?

speaker: Eirika
text: Father, you can't stay! You mustn't! If you remain behind, then so shall I!

speaker: Fado
text: Go now, Seth! Ride! Take her to safety!

speaker: Eirika
text: Father!

speaker: Seth
text: Forgive me, Your Highness.

speaker: Fado
text: Ephraim, Eirika... You must survive.

speaker: Franz
text: General Seth!

speaker: Seth
text: Franz, ride ahead and bring word of our coming to Frelia. A single rider has better odds of passing unseen by Grado's men. Convey to the throne all that has happened here and petition for reinforcements.

speaker: Franz
text: U-understood!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika, we must— Quickly! Behind me!

speaker: Valter
text: You there, with the girl. Tell me, would that be the wayward princess of Renais? Well, this must be my lucky day. You're a dead man. The wench goes with me.

speaker: Seth
text: Never!

speaker: Valter
text: I am Valter, the Moonstone, Grado's finest general! And you're just a corpse who does not know he is dead.

speaker: Seth
text: Ahhh... No!

speaker: Valter
text: Such terrible wounds, and still he holds to his duty? How entertaining. Fly away, little man. Fly away. Try to outrun death. More time to savor the hunt... and the kill.

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika! This way! I can see no more of Grado's men. If we've made it this far, we've surely earned a moment's rest. Please forgive my grabbing you so...brusquely earlier.

speaker: Eirika
text: Don't be foolish, Seth. If it weren't for you, I would never have made it out of the castle. You are the reason I'm still alive. You have my gratitude. And whoever that man was, he was clearly after me... It's my fault that you received such a grave wound. Allow me to treat it, I--

speaker: Seth
text: Your Highness, I can't allow an injury like this to be an obstacle. We have more important matters to attend to. We must press on to Frelia. We must fulfill His Majesty's wishes.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...I wonder how my father fares alone in the castle. Do you think he's safe? And what of my brother on the Grado front? We've heard nothing from him for days.

speaker: Seth
text: King Fado and Prince Ephraim are both valiant and brave men. I doubt even the might of the Grado Empire can hold them in check. More important to me, Your Highness, is that you look to your own safety. How sad the two of them would be if something were to happen to you. We must reach Frelia to ensure the day of your happy reunion.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, of course. You're right. Until I'm reunited with my father and brother, I must not despair. Come, Seth. Let us go.

speaker: Seth
text: Once we cross that bridge, we will be in Frelia, near Border Mulan. Let us proceed, Princess Eirika.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Your training begins with movement. Place the square cursor on Eirika and press the A Button.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Press the A Button to select Eirika.

speaker: Tutorial
text: You can move anywhere within the blue area. Move the cursor to the flashing space beside Seth and press the A Button.

speaker: Tutorial
text: You’ll now move next to Seth. Go ahead and press the A Button.

speaker: Seth
text: Your highness, I won’t lie to you. This will not be an easy ride. Please, take this rapier. If something should happen to me, you must continue to Frelia, alone if need be.

speaker: Tutorial
text: You’ve received a rapier from Seth. All weapons have a durability rating. The rapier’s durability is 40. Once the rapier has been used 40 times, it will break. Pay close attention to how many uses your weapons have remaining.

speaker: O’Neill
text: You there! Renais Dogs! Where do you think you’re going?

speaker: Seth
text: Grado’s men.. Stand back, Princess Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s all right, Seth. My brother has taught me something of swordplay. I will stand with you.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Red units are enemy units. After all of Eirika’s party has moved, the enemy units will move. Each side takes turns moving and then fighting until the battle ends.

speaker: Seth
text: Princess Eirika!

speaker: Eirika
text: I’m fine. His axe was slow, and I was quick. Now it’s my turn!

speaker: Tutorial
text: On this map you need to defeat O’Neill, the enemy leader, to win. The objective is displayed at the corner of the screen. Your objective changes from map to map, which may change your approach. Check your objective before deciding your strategy. Now, attack the enemy!

speaker: Tutorial
text: The cursor is now on Eirika. Press the A Button.

speaker: Tutorial
text: It’s time to attack the enemy. Place the cursor on Eirika and press the A Button.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Select Attack and press the A Button.

speaker: Tutorial
text: This is the combat information window. You can see the combatant’s HP and the amount of damage you will inflict. Eirika should do 7 points, and the enemy should do 9. You see the x2 next to Mt, right? This indicates that you will attack twice. Eirika is faster than her opponent, so she can strike twice in one turn. So, with 2 attacks of 7 points each, Eirika will do 14 points of damage. Now press the A Button to attack the enemy.

speaker: Seth
text: I’ll hold the rest of them here. Please, Princess–to Frelia!

speaker: Seth
text: All that's left is their leader...

speaker: O'Neill
text: What was that? Do you think you can take me, wretched lordling? Come! It's time you high-and-mighty knights learned to respect a true warrior!

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth! His wounds must be worse than he let on...

speaker: O'Neill
text: Time to die!

speaker: Eirika
text: Stop! Face me, if you have the steel!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Place the cursor on Eirika and press the A Button.

speaker: Tutorial
text: The cursor is now on Eirika. Press the A Button.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Move next to the enemy and press the A Button.

speaker: Tutorial
text: The combat information window is open again. Do you see Hit displayed below HP and Mt? Hit is the likelihood that you will land your blow. Eirika’s Hit is 94, so she has a 94 percent chance of hitting the enemy. Crit, short for Critical, also appears in this window. This is the chance an attack will be a lethal strike. Eirika’s Crit is 14, so she has a 14 percent chance of landing a killing blow. Critical attacks do 3 times the damage of a normal attack. Press the A Button to attack the enemy leader.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Eirika gained over 100 experience points and has leveled up. Gaining levels increases unit abilities and makes them stronger.

speaker: O'Neill
text: You will be the first to die!

speaker: O'Neill
text: What? How?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess, are you injured?

speaker: Eirika
text: What? Oh, no... I'm fine, Seth.

speaker: Seth
text: But you look so pale...

speaker: Eirika
text: I'm fine... Fine. ...This is war, isn't it? It's not at all like the games I used to play with my brother or Lyon. I never thought—I didn't know it would be this...savage. Are words useless? Is strength all that matters? It's so sad... Why would the Grado Empire do this? To what end would they start a war?

speaker: Seth
text: Princess...

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Don't worry, Seth. I won't give in to sorrow. Let's get moving. I'm not broken, and I won't stop until I see Renais restored. I won't stop until I'm reunited with my father and brother.

speaker: Vigarde
text: Frelia’s Sacred Stone has been destroyed. And yet you cannot locate the Stone of Renais. Glen. Valter. Find the children of Renais. Find them and take from them the bracelets that they wear. Glen, take Eirika. Valter, take Ephraim. Find them. Conquer them.

speaker: Glen
text: Yes, Your Majesty...

speaker: Valter
text: Ha ha... Eirika, eh? She’s a ripe little peach. And her brother, Ephraim... He’s better prey than I’d imagined. I can feel my blood rushing at the thought. This might be fun after all.

speaker: Vigarde
text: Caellach. Riev. Shatter the remaining Sacred Stones. Caellach, take Jehanna. Riev, take Rausten. Go. Crush the Sacred Stones they house.

speaker: Riev
text: Heh heh heh... As you will. I’ll begin making arrangements for Rausten’s downfall immediately...

speaker: Caellach
text: Bah! Why am I stuck with Jehanna? Accursed ill luck. I became a mercenary to escape that wretched place, and now I must go back?

speaker: Vigarde
text: Duessel. Go to Frelia. Take the Frelian army and punish Ephraim.

speaker: Vigarde
text: Selena. Remain in the capital. Soon, I will have new orders for you.

speaker: Selena
text: Yes, sire.

speaker: Tana
text: Eirika! Wait!

speaker: Eirika
text: Tana? What are you doing? You were supposed to remain in the palace. You left so abruptly, without any warning or farewell. You and Ephraim have only just arrived, and already you leave on another quest? Well, I’m your friend, Eirika, and I won’t let you go into danger without me.

speaker: Eirika
text: Does King Hayden know of this?

speaker: Tana
text: No. He’d just say I forbid you to go on this foolish errand,? like always. But I’m so worried about you.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, Tana. I appreciate your concern, but King Hayden would–

speaker: Tana
text: You and Ephraim, my father and my brother... You’re all fighting together, fighting for a noble cause. I cannot be left out. I will not be left out. Please, Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Oh... All right. I never could refuse you anything. Come on. Let’s go, Tana.

speaker: Tana
text: Thank you, Eirika!

speaker: Seth
text: Your Highness, we’ve reached Port Kiris. If we can find passage across the North Sea, we will reach Rausten in 10 days.

speaker: Eirika
text: It smells of the tides... This is a busy place, isn’t it?

speaker: Seth
text: It’s a trade center. Peoples of all nations pass through here. Do not become so enthralled with the sights and sounds that you forget your mission.

speaker: Eirika
text: I won’t. I’m a mercenary by the name of Erina. I’m traveling to Rausten to receive a commission.

speaker: Seth
text: Let us look for a ship then, Erina. The docks are this way.

speaker: Eirika
text: Hm?

speaker: Seth
text: Is something amiss?

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth, that woman over there? Is that...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, these dainty sugar pastries! They’re delightfully scrumptious! Flavorful without being overwhelming, refined without being banal...

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! Right you are, Lady L’Arachel!

speaker: Eirika
text: You look familiar...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh! Aren’t you–

speaker: Eirika
text: We’ve met before, haven’t we? You arrived with your companions when we encountered those creatures... Your name is L’Arachel, is it not?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: A wonder and pleasure that we should meet again so soon! It is providence!

speaker: Rennac
text: Bad luck is the only thing the divine has ever provided you!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, and if you have not yet tried one, these pastries are also divine. Would you care for one?

speaker: Eirika
text: Uh, thank you... No, wait... That’s not why– We’re actually on our way to the Theocracy of Rausten. We’re rather in a rush and need to find passage on a ship...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, dear. I’m afraid you’ll find none to assist you. No ships are leaving port.

speaker: Eirika
text: Pardon?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: You see, I find myself heading home once more to my beloved Rausten as well! And actually, I’m quite well known with the powers-that-be here in Port Kiris. So I ordered them to ready the finest passenger vessel for me. But both merchants and passenger ships alike are too frightened to set sail. It seems a giant ghost ship has been sinking every ship it finds... Would that I could confront it, I could stop its foul villainy in a moment. Alas. It’s such a shame.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, yes... Uh... That is troublesome. Still, I must get to Rausten somehow.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: You needn’t worry too much. After all, if the sea is closed to you, simply follow the overland route!

speaker: Eirika
text: The overland route? I’ve heard that’s a terribly roundabout path to travel.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Oh, it is, but don’t you see? The hardships of the road, they are truly blessings! They will toughen you and strengthen your resolve when you need to face great evil. For example, I have been tasked with a great trial in order to better me. I understand my path, O unknowable forces of providence! I, your faithful servant L’Arachel, shall overcome! With faith and divine strength!

speaker: Rennac
text: Now, listen, L’Arachel! You might be thrilled about going the long way, but–

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Come now, we’re leaving. Dozla? Rennac? Don’t fall behind!

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! Wait for us, Lady L’Arachel! Come on, Rennac! We run ’til we drop! The first one to collapse from exhaustion is the winner!

speaker: Rennac
text: Help... Why is this happening to me?

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Uh, Seth? Isn’t Rausten in the other direction? Aren’t they heading toward Frelia?

speaker: Seth
text: ...It’s nothing you need concern yourself with, milady. Our only concern now is to decide our next course of action. An overland journey would be very long. However, it seems that may be our only choice at the moment...

speaker: Eirika
text: I agree. Whatever shall we do...

speaker: Binks
text: ...You’re Eirika, the princess of Renais, ain’t ya?

speaker: Eirika
text: What?

speaker: Seth
text: Dastard! Away with you!

speaker: Binks
text: No need to get personal! You know, there’s a pretty price on your pretty head. Sorry, but I need that gold.

speaker: Man
text: Wh-what do you want? Gimme a break... Leave us out of this stupid war of yours! We don’t want anything to do with it! Or... are you just another victim, like the rest of us here? Well, regardless... Here. Take this, and go do something about all this fighting, will you?

speaker: Rennac
text: My, oh my... It’s about time they left. I’m finally done getting ordered about without getting paid. Huh? Oh, don’t mind me. Just talking to myself. Here, I want you to hold on to this for me. Don’t tell anyone. Oh, and don’t say a word about seeing me to Lady L’Arachel, all right? Deal?

speaker: Soldier
text: Attention! Carcino’s mercenaries will arrest the princess of Renais shortly. Our duty here is nearly ended, and I expect no further hostilities. If you must fight, however, remember that the whole empire fights with you!

speaker: Amelia
text: Um, Commander? What should I do?

speaker: Soldier
text: Who are you?

speaker: Amelia
text: Sir! I’m Amelia of Silva, sir! I’m new. I was only assigned to your command today. I wanted to fight for the empire!

speaker: Soldier
text: I don’t need your life story, fool! Recruits are in front! Grab a lance and move!

speaker: Amelia
text: Sir, yes sir! This lance... Stab the enemy. I’m not afraid... I’m a citizen of Grado. It’s my duty to fight. And I’ll fight my best!

speaker: Franz
text: Oh, who are you?

speaker: Amelia
text: What? What?

speaker: Franz
text: Are you one of the locals? This is a dangerous spot. You should hide. Here, come with me.

speaker: Amelia
text: But... But I’m...

speaker: Franz
text: I’m Franz, a Knight of Renais. What’s your name? What are you doing here?

speaker: Amelia
text: I-I’m Amelia. I’m... Actually, I’m a Grado soldier. I’m supposed to be fighting you.

speaker: Franz
text: Really? So, uh, you’re my enemy?

speaker: Amelia
text: ...I guess... Are you... Are you going to make me your prisoner?!

speaker: Franz
text: No! No, I wouldn’t do that. But...this is a problem.

speaker: Amelia
text: What should we do?

speaker: Franz
text: First of all, you must listen to me and do as I say. We’ll talk to Princess Eirika later.

speaker: Amelia
text: What? NO! My commander told me Eirika’s a cruel and merciless fiend who–

speaker: Franz
text: Oh, that’s utter nonsense. I’ve never heard the princess utter an unkind word to anyone. I understand why you’re frightened. You think we’re the enemy. But if you’d only trust me... Will you come with me?

speaker: Amelia
text: Mm... Well, all right. I’ll trust you, Franz.

speaker: Eirika
text: Who are you?

speaker: Amelia
text: What? What?

speaker: Eirika
text: Are you from around here? You should find someplace to hide. These men are after me. It’s not safe.

speaker: Amelia
text: But... But I’m...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes?

speaker: Amelia
text: I’m a Grado soldier. I’m here to stop the princess of Renais...

speaker: Eirika
text: Huh? You’re with Grado?

speaker: Amelia
text: And you’re Princess Eirika? But the commander said Eirika’s a cruel and merciless fiend...

speaker: Eirika
text: What? No, I’m... ...I don’t know what Grado’s officers have been telling you, but... Our two countries are at war, so I suppose they can say what they want.

speaker: Amelia
text: ...Mistress Eirika... I, uh, I surrender. I won’t fight you.

speaker: Eirika
text: Huh?

speaker: Amelia
text: I became a soldier because I admired General Duessel’s sense of honor. But the generals have been very opposed to this war from the beginning... And now I see you, and you look so sad about all of this. I don’t know what’s right anymore. I’m just a soldier, but I want to decide for myself. I want to understand the truth myself, to see it with my own eyes.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...I see. So...does this mean you’re coming with us? I suppose I should ask your name then.

speaker: Amelia
text: Amelia. Amelia of Silva.

speaker: Binks
text: Blast! This ain’t right! These guys are too tough... 5,000 gold ain’t nearly enough for this!

speaker: Binks
text: Th-that stinkin’ Pablo... He...lied to me...

speaker: Seth
text: Your Highness, are you well?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, I believe so... Who are these men? They don’t appear to be Grado Imperial troops.

speaker: Seth
text: Judging by their crude swordplay, I’d say they’re mercenaries. We can expect more of them in the area, too, I think. Wait here.

speaker: Mercenary
text: W-wait! I give up! I don’t want to fight anymore! We were just doing a job.

speaker: Seth
text: Who hired you?

speaker: Mercenary
text: I may be nothing but a hired blade, but I have my honor. I won’t say a word.

speaker: Seth
text: I admire your professionalism. I guess we have no use for you.

speaker: Mercenary
text: No, wait! I’ll talk! Carcino! It was Pablo of the Carcino Council of Elders!

speaker: Seth
text: Councilman Pablo?

speaker: Eirika
text: That doesn’t make sense! Carcino and Frelia are allies. Why would they target me?

speaker: Mercenary
text: I don’t know... Could be they’ve decided Grado’s going to win. They want to be on the winning side. Some of the others opposed Pablo, but I heard he had ’em all silenced but quick. That’s all I know, I swear it.

speaker: Seth
text: I believe you. Go.

speaker: Seth
text: We were careless. We should have seen this coming. Carcino’s a young and ambitious nation ruled by power-hungry merchants. And Grado grows more powerful with every passing day. So it’s no surprise Carcino’s merchant lords would throw in with Grado now.

speaker: Eirika
text: Wait! Prince Innes... Prince Innes was to pass through Carcino on his way to Jehanna... If Carcino has betrayed us, then he ran headlong into enemy territory...

speaker: Messenger
text: Princess Eirika! I bring dire tidings!

speaker: Eirika
text: I know you... You were a messenger riding with Prince Innes.

speaker: Messenger
text: Yes, and I have news of him. Prince Innes is in danger! Carcino’s merchant army struck and cut through half our men. The prince is trapped in a siege. He has no means of escape, and–

speaker: Eirika
text: No more! I understand. Return to Frelia and deliver your message!

speaker: Messenger
text: What of Prince Innes?

speaker: Eirika
text: Leave him to us. The prince’s troubles should burden you no more. We will see him to safety.

speaker: Rennac
text: ...Hey, you. Have Lady L’Arachel and her man, Sir Stubble-chin, gone yet?

speaker: Eirika
text: Aren’t you– Yes, they no longer appear to be in the city.

speaker: Rennac
text: Whew... I’m finally free! No more getting bossed around by that witless ninny! Thanks. I owe you one. Take this. Now that I’m free again. I think I’m just gonna wander about for a while.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...What a strange relationship they have.

speaker: Seth
text: Lady Eirika, I think we ought to be leaving soon.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. We must hurry to Prince Innes’s side!

speaker: Messenger
text: Please wait, Prince Ephraim. I have a message from Frelia. There’s been an uprising in Carcino. Pablo is leading a force of renegade Grado supporters in rebellion.

speaker: Ephraim
text: In Carcino... Any word of Eirika? Is my sister safe?”

speaker: Messenger
text: The last word we received had Princess Eirika heading to assist Prince Innes. We’ve not heard from her since.”

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...Blast. I sent Eirika to Rausten thinking it would be the safest mission. If I could, I’d pull out of here now and go look for her but...”

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...I know, I know. I mustn’t let my emotions dictate my actions. If Carcino has allied itself with Grado, then defeating Grado is out best bet. We proceed as planned. Tell them that.

speaker: Seth
text: Understood.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Be careful, Eirika.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...What?! Was that an earthquake? I think it’s passed.

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim.”

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’m fine. There’s nothing to worry about. I was surprised, that’s all. You’re not shaken in the slightest, are you?

speaker: Seth
text: Actually, it surprised me as well. I’ve heard that tremors such as those were commonplace in Grado. Apparently, they are usually weak and cause little, if any, damage.

speaker: Ephraim
