text: Now that you mention it, I remember a while back, when I was first in Grado. Eirika and I were startled by a tremor just like that one. Lyon said he had grown used to them, and he just laughed.

speaker: Ephraim
text: We don’t have any time to tend to injuries just now. We must press forward. We must see to the capital.

speaker: Duessel
text: I do not understand... Why this course of action? What is the emperor thinking...

speaker: Selena
text: General Duessel.

speaker: Duessel
text: ...Is that you, Selena? Are you to be assisting me in this...duty?

speaker: Selena
text: Yes... Frelia’s army will be coming soon from the north. We’re just waiting for the order to engage them.

speaker: Duessel
text: Hm... Prince Ephraim leads the enemy forces, doesn’t he?

speaker: Selena
text: That is correct. Prince Ephraim of Renais.

speaker: Duessel
text: Bah...

speaker: Selena
text: Renais is our enemy. General, please give the order to attack.

speaker: Duessel
text: No. Order all units to hold. Do not initiate the attack. I want to speak with Ephraim first.

speaker: Selena
text: ...... So it’s true. You plan to betray the empire and ally yourself with the enemy.

speaker: Duessel
text: What?!

speaker: Selena
text: General Duessel, you stand accused of treason of the highest order. Lay down your weapons, and follow my commands. If you fail to do so, if you resist in any way, I will execute you on the spot.

speaker: Duessel
text: This is nonsense! Who is behind this madness!

speaker: Selena
text: These are His Majesty’s orders. The emperor has anticipated your treachery. Prepare yourself.

speaker: Duessel
text: Impossible... His Majesty?

speaker: Selena
text: Cormag, you and I will bring that traitor down. Go around that fort to the southeast and drive into them from the sea.

speaker: Cormag
text: We’re fighting General Duessel? But he’s one of the cornerstones of the empire. How could– He’s been like a father to you and to my brother. Do you truly mean to kill him?

speaker: Selena
text: ...... If that is what my emperor commands, then yes. Without hesitation. Cormag, if you are a true knight of Grado, you will do the same.

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, the Imperial Grado army is before us.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I know, but something’s odd. They’re chasing someone down. Is that a deserter? Wait! That’s... Duessel?

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, your orders.

speaker: Ephraim
text: We rescue Duessel! Ride!!!

speaker: Valter
text: What’s this? They’ve only just begun? What a disappointment. I so wanted to witness the comedy of two generals hacking away at each other.

speaker: Selena
text: Valter... What do you want?

speaker: Valter
text: Ah, Selena. You’re to return to the capital immediately. Duessel is no longer your concern. His Majesty has declared you untrustworthy. I’ve been sent here to relieve you of command.

speaker: Selena
text: What?

speaker: Valter
text: You’ve proven yourself incapable of dealing with a single old man... I tell you, having to clean up your mess makes things difficult for me, Selena. Now then, Beran.

speaker: Beran
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Valter
text: I’m leaving. I can’t leave poor Eirika sad and lonely in Carcino. You’re in command here for the duration of this conflict.

speaker: Beran
text: I’ll take care of things.

speaker: Selena
text: What do you think you’re doing?! I am here at His Majesty’s bidding, and...

speaker: Valter
text: Did you not hear me? His Majesty’s bidding has CHANGED. You, Selena, are not to be trusted. These are His Majesty’s words. You share the same sentiments as Duessel. You could turn traitor, just as he has. You should feel honored. He could have ordered me to kill you where you stand.

speaker: Selena
text: Th-that’s absurd! His Majesty, he... He knows I am trustworthy.

speaker: Valter
text: Then return to the capital and sort it out. Go and ask your beloved master whether I speak the truth.

speaker: Valter
text: What are you going to do, Selena?

speaker: Selena
text: I will return to the capital. I know better than to trust your word. I will speak with the emperor myself.

speaker: Valter
text: Heh heh... Stupid woman. If Grado wins too easily, there’ll be no more bloodshed. We must do what we can to extend the fun... I believe it’s time for me to return to my darling Eirika. It wouldn’t do for Glen to arrive before me, would it? Take care of things here before I return to you. Understood?

speaker: Beran
text: Of course.

speaker: Cormag
text: Tell me, Brother, what should I do?

speaker: Girl
text: Do you know what I’m going to be when I get older? I’m going to be a splendid knight, just like General Selena. They call General Selena the Fluorspar, you know? She’s really beautiful and really, really strong.

speaker: Man
text: A strange man passed through here sometime back. He said something about looking for a girl with indigo hair... I asked if she was his girl, but he said she wasn’t. I hope he’s found her by now.

speaker: Old Man
text: This area of the ocean is often blanketed in a thick fog. I toiled under it myself for many hard years when I was still sailing. We always made sure we had torches and the like ready... Oh, yes... And there’s this. This torch staff shines just as bright as any normal torch. Of course, if nobody you know can use it, it’s just so much extra baggage. Will you take it? Oh, go ahead. I’m planning on resting my old bones here for good. My sailing days are done.

speaker: Marisa
text: ...No good.

speaker: Person Sent
text: What?

speaker: Person Sent
text: Huh?

speaker: Marisa
text: I found it. I can’t use it yet. Good-bye.

speaker: Person Sent
text: Uh...

speaker: Soldier
text: Commander Cormag!

speaker: Cormag
text: I know what I must do. I’m a sworn knight of Grado, and I have a duty to fulfill. Let’s start by putting an end to that Frelian army. Move out!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Duessel!

speaker: Duessel
text: Is that you, Prince Ephraim?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Why were those Grado men after you? What’s going on? Wait, we can talk later. Let’s get you to safety first. Come with us, Duessel.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Duessel!

speaker: Duessel
text: I am General Duessel, the Obsidian, of the Imperial Three… This name and my service to His Majesty have been my life’s blood. As of this moment it is all gone. I’ve no reason to continue…

speaker: Ephraim
text: Duessel… Enough of this rubbish! You are my mentor! I will not let you die!

speaker: Duessel
text: …Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I know about the emperor’s madness. How will your death serve Grado? Who will it help? What of your country? Its people? Its future!?

speaker: Ephraim
text: You will live, Duessel. As a traitor… In disgrace… I know that for a man such as you this is more agonizing than death. But you will live nonetheless. You will live for something more important.

speaker: Duessel
text: …… I understand. This old fool’s life is yours.

speaker: Tana
text: Wait. Please stop fighting. I’m sure we can reach an agreement if we just talk.

speaker: Cormag
text: You are...?

speaker: Tana
text: My name is Tana. You’re from Grado, aren’t you? Why are you fighting against General Duessel?

speaker: Cormag
text: That’s none of your–

speaker: Tana
text: Do you hate him?

speaker: Cormag
text: ...Do I hate him? This isn’t some petty schoolyard squabble, girl. I’m a soldier of the empire, and I have my orders. I’ve been sent to punish a traitor, and that’s what I aim to do.

speaker: Tana
text: Are you telling me that General Duessel’s a traitor? Don’t you know him? Do you think that’s really true?

speaker: Cormag
text: What I think isn’t at question. Faith does not dictate my actions. I have my orders.

speaker: Tana
text: Ephraim trusts your General Duessel. He’s given him the benefit of the doubt. Have you chosen not to believe the reasons for his actions?

speaker: Cormag
text: Get out of my way! I’ll waste no more time with this duel of words!

speaker: Tana
text: Wait! Please... Protect General Duessel. It would be tragic if he died before his motives became clear.

speaker: Cormag
text: ... Move, please. If you won’t get out of the way, I’ll have to move you by force.

speaker: Tana
text: Very well. If you must. But in exchange, I’m asking you to believe General Duessel.

speaker: Cormag
text: ...... ...You’re an odd bird. To think I’d lose a fight not to a man’s sword but to a woman’s words...

speaker: Tana
text: What?

speaker: Cormag
text: You will. I will protect General Duessel. But I plan on sorting this whole mess out with the general himself.

speaker: Tana
text: Do you mean that?

speaker: Cormag
text: I don’t know if this is the right thing to do or not. But I think this is what my brother would have done.

speaker: Duessel
text: Is that you, Cormag?

speaker: Cormag
text: Sir Duessel... You have abandoned your country and your lord. I must take your life.

speaker: Duessel
text: I know. I’m ready now. I have no duty anymore. But you, Cormag. You’re a soldier of the empire. Follow your orders and fulfill your mission. I’m ready.

speaker: Duessel
text: Cormag!

speaker: Cormag
text: To be honesty, I’m confused. Must you truly die? Is your crime really deserving of death? I know my brother could have settled this, but... I’ve come here to stop you, and yet I find that I cannot.

speaker: Cormag
text: You see, I couldn’t believe you would ever truly turn traitor. And now I stand here, looking at you, Duessel of the Imperial Three. And you do not have the eyes of a traitor.

speaker: Cormag
text: No. I cannot turn my lance on you, the empire’s faithful son. General Duessel... Until this matter is sorted, you travel under my protection.

speaker: Duessel
text: Cormag... Forgive me...

speaker: Beran
text: Prince Ephraim of Renais... The Obsidian Duessel... Two incredible trophies. Who could ask for more?

speaker: Beran
text: Grrr... They’re held on for too long. If this continues, General Valter will have me– ...Prepare a ship. We must flee. Quickly!

speaker: Soldier
text: B-but General Valter... He’ll be so angry...

speaker: Beran
text: We’re doomed either way. General Valter will never forgive our failure here... And if we stay, we’ll be devoured like those other fools... Our best bet is to give up and escape with our lives.

speaker: Soldier
text: Commander Beran! Wait!

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim. The remaining enemy troops have fled.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I see. And what of Duessel? Is he unharmed?

speaker: Seth
text: Yes. This way.

speaker: Duessel
text: Prince Ephraim... You’ve grown to be quite the impressive commander. I remember what a stubborn young lad you were when I taught you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Any skill I have, I owe to you, Duessel. I’m curious, why are you being pursued by your own troops?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Speak to me, Duessel. I want to put an end to this war. I’m sure you feel the same way.

speaker: Duessel
text: ...... ...As you know, the emperor was once a man of compassion. He loathed war, and he worked to build peace across all nations. Then...one day that all changed.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...... But why? Why did he change? What happened?

speaker: Duessel
text: I wish I knew. But if you’re looking for a likely cause, I have one. This all seems to have begun when Prince Lyon and the mages created a strange gemstone they referred to as the Dark Stone.

speaker: Ephraim
text: The Dark Stone?

speaker: Duessel
text: That’s what the clerics and the prince called it, at any rate Now, I’m just a soldier. I don’t know anything about these magic things. But they said the Dark Stone is more powerful even than the Sacred Stones.

speaker: Ephraim
text: And the Sacred Stones had the power to defeat the Demon King. If the Dark Stone is stronger than they are...

speaker: Myrrh
text: ...Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it, Myrrh?

speaker: Myrrh
text: The wave of evil I felt surging from the capital... It hungers... It consumes. It envelops and transforms. This power can tarnish the purest of souls with its corruption.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Are you saying this Dark Stone is responsible for the change in Vigarde? The timing fits, doesn’t it? The stone is created, and then– Duessel, where is the Dark Stone now?

speaker: Duessel
text: It’s in the capital, with Prince Lyon. He’s been carrying it with him ever since the day it was created.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Understood. Duessel, I’m going to the capital. I must talk to Lyon. Maybe we can restore the emperor together.

speaker: Duessel
text: ...I’m going with you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: But we’ll be fighting Grado’s army–your own men.

speaker: Duessel
text: I appreciate your concern, but I’ve already been branded a traitor. Prince Ephraim, if you mean to save my lord the emperor... If you hope to restore him to his former self... then I will pledge my loyalty to you until your cause is won.

speaker: Soldier
text: General Duessel!

speaker: Duessel
text: Men, I owe each of you an apology. You’ve served me well, and I have betrayed you.

speaker: Soldier
text: You speak nonsense, General! We are your men, no matter what happens! If you must leave Grado to fight with Frelia’s men, then our place is at your side. Your road is our road!

speaker: Duessel
text: My brave men... Sniff... Bah, I’m getting old. I’m a sentimental old fool.

speaker: Soldier
text: We ask to be allowed to join the Frelian army. Prince Ephraim has many soldiers. He doesn’t need us with him. Please, send us older soldiers off to fight with Frelia. And may the gods of war smile upon you, General Duessel.

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, we must now take to the seas. The Frelian army is readying a ship for us now. We have some time to rest until it’s ready to set sail.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Right. We’ll take a break, then. Tell the men. The road ahead is bound or be a rough one.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Well, hello there! Tell me, are you all waiting to board a ship?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Er, yes, we are...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: I recommend that you abandon your plans, my friends. The locals are too frightened to set sail upon these seas.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Is there a storm coming in?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: No, no storm–demons. Some sort of phantom ship commands these seas now.

speaker: Ephraim
text: A phantom ship?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Yes. But you needn’t worry for long, my friends. I plan on purging the seas of that pesky ghost ship.

speaker: Rennac
text: Oh, no... Here we go again.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! Well said, Princess L’Arachel!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: I, L’Arachel, am destined to become the protector of the seas! Fare thee well, strangers. Come, Dozla, we must find a ship.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! Sounds fun! Come on, Rennac!

speaker: Rennac
text: Honestly, L’Arachel, do you even think before you set these plans? Oh, please... Someone end my misery!

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...What was all that about?

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim, our ship has arrived. Let us prepare to board. ...Something troubling you?

speaker: Ephraim
text: No... It’s nothing. All right. Here we go!

speaker: Eirika
text: My brother is somewhere inside that castle...

speaker: Seth
text: Renvall is surrounded by lakes. The only entrance is the bridge to the main gate, and it’s well guarded. Castle Renvall is a natural stronghold, easy to defend and difficult to assault. We must plan our attack carefully.

speaker: Eirika
text: I agree...

speaker: Franz
text: Princess Eirika! Please allow me to fight beside you. My elder brother, Forde, is in there with Prince Ephraim, Sir Kyle, Sir Orson... Let me help you set them free!

speaker: Gilliam
text: There is nothing to discuss. We will fight.

speaker: Moulder
text: The hour of your reunion is not far off now.

speaker: Vanessa
text: I am yours to command, Your Highness.

speaker: Ross
text: We’re with you all the way! Right, Dad?

speaker: Garcia
text: Don’t work yourself into a lather, Ross. In the heat of battle, a good warrior remains calm where lesser men do not.

speaker: Colm
text: You need anything stolen, I’m your man. ‘Course, my blade’s no joke either.

speaker: Neimi
text: I’m sure I can help you if you’ll let me... I’ll keep you safe.

speaker: Lute
text: You can’t possibly consider fighting without my genius at your side!

speaker: Artur
text: I have yet to repay you for helping me fight those abominations. Please, let me stand by your side a while longer.

speaker: Joshua
text: This has trouble written all over it. Bet you it’s all a trap... Ah, well... My luck’s gotta turn around sometime, right?

speaker: Natasha
text: May the sacred light surround us and protect us all.

speaker: Seth
text: Well, Princess, let us prepare for battle.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Brother, I’m on my way. Let’s go!

speaker: Murray
text: We’re under attack! Rouse yourselves! General Valter’s adjutant, Lord Tirado, has charged us with defending the castle! Show them the might of Murray’s Brigade! Don’t let anyone near the castle!

speaker: Young Man
text: Tirado’s the new master of Castle Renvall. He’s supposed to be an adjutant to General Valter of Grado. Who knows, though... Rumors say he’s been plotting behind Valter’s back. You should watch where you step.

speaker: Old Lady
text: Prince Ephraim? Well, gracious me... I haven’t heard anything about him. But now that you mention it, there was a big commotion a few days back. I guess the soldiers were chasing somebody, but... Well, I was so tired, I fell asleep and missed the whole thing.

speaker: Murray
text: Our ballistae have failed? How could this be? Grrr... I guess it’s up to me!

speaker: Murray
text: Lord Tirado...

speaker: Eirika
text: My brother is somewhere in this castle... Seth, we must go inside!

speaker: Seth
text: Hold, Lady Eirika. Look, in the shadows–a figure...

speaker: Eirika
text: Ah! An enemy soldier!

speaker: Eirika
text: Princess Eirika And... is that you, Seth?

speaker: Seth
text: Sir Orson... Why are you here? You should be with Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Eirika
text: Are you all right, Orson? If you’re here, my brother must be here as well, right?

speaker: Orson
text: Yes... Prince Ephraim and I were broth captured by Grado forces and held here as prisoners. I just managed to escape my cell... A chance to escape– It’s what I had prayed for...

speaker: Eirika
text: Orson... are you well? Your face is so pale. Grado’s men, don’t tell me they’ve–

speaker: Orson
text: No... it’s nothing. But Lord Ephraim... I cannot say whether he’s still unharmed.

speaker: Eirika
text: What!? Where is he? Where is my brother?

speaker: Orson
text: If he lives still, he will be in one of the deeper cells, where I was held. Head down this corridor to the dungeons. Quickly, before reinforcements arrive.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you...

speaker: Lyon
text: When tomorrow comes... you have to go home, don’t you...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes... Thank you for everything, Lyon. I’ll never forget the time I spent here.

speaker: Lyon
text: Do you think we’ll see each other again...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, of course. My brother and you and me. We are friends, after all. Aren’t we...

speaker: Lyon
text: Eirika... Yep, you’re right. I hope your study of the Sacred Stones is fruitful. I know you’ll use the wisdom you glean to make your people happy.

speaker: Lyon
text: Thank you, Eirika. You know, you’re the only reason I was able to save that girl. There were times when I wanted to give up, to admit failure. But you were always there. You were always encouraging me to succeed. That’s what kept me going. I just thought of you.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon...

speaker: Lyon
text: Eirika... I...I’ve always... I’m sorry... Forget what I was saying. I could never be like Ephraim...

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon, what do you–

speaker: Lyon
text: I guess this is it, Eirika. Hope to see you again someday. I’m going to focus on my work and do my best until that day. My research will progress, and my discoveries will benefit us all. One day, I will be a prince worthy of you, and I will see you again.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Don't make that face. We'll see each other again. All three of us--you, me, and Eirika.

speaker: Lyon
text: Yeah... I know. But when we get older, when we each take the reigns of our nations, we probably won't meet again... Not like this, I mean. Not as friends.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What's that got to do with anything? Kings are humans, too. Emperors need not be friendless, you know.

speaker: Lyon
text: I suppose you're right. You have a knack for cutting to the heart of things. But becoming a king or an emperor is not something you can take lightly. I really don't think we'll be the same people we are right now... What if Renais or Grado went to war? What if we were forced to fight?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Don't be ridiculous. That would never happen.

speaker: Lyon
text: If... If it did... We'd still be friends, wouldn't we?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Even if that happens, yes. We're friends forever. Nothing can change that. You'll see.

speaker: Lyon
text: Hm... All right, Ephraim. Then I will see you again.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon!

speaker: Lyon
text: ... Eirika...

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon... It is you, isn’t it, Lyon...!

speaker: Lyon
text: Yes... But I’m... I’m almost completely gone. Before I’m lost entirely, I want to apologize. I’m sorry, Eirika. This is all my fault. I was too weak...

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re not to blame, Lyon. It was the Demon King. He was controlling you...

speaker: Lyon
text: No, that’s not true, Eirika. When the Demon King reached into me from inside the Dark Stone...When he whispered he would see all my dreams and desires made true...I...I did not reject him. In the shadows of my heart, he saw jealousy...vanity...It was my weakness that put these emotions there, allowed them to thrive.

speaker: Eirika
text: Everyone has weaknesses, Lyon. You’re not the only one. I do. I’m sure my brother does...Don’t hate yourself for having these feelings, please.

speaker: Lyon
text: Thank you, Eirika. You were always...so kind. The Demon King will claim my flesh as a vessel for his resurrection. Before that can happen...I want you to kill me. I’m sorry, Eirika. I’m already-

speaker: Lyon
text: Oh, please...Are you done turning your failings into some sad epic of personal tragedy... It’s time we started then. I have a ritual to complete...and some nuisances to kill.

speaker: Eirika
text: Shut your mouth. I won’t allow you to desecrate Lyon’s body any further. You will not return to this world. I will stop you myself if I must.

speaker: Lyon
text: Ah, is that so... And do you honestly think yourself capable, wench... You once prayed for this fool’s salvation. Can you bring yourself to kill him...

speaker: Eirika
text: I can and I will. I made a promise to Lyon, and I intend to honor it.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon.

speaker: Lyon
text: You came after all, Ephraim. I’m glad.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon. Is this... Is this my fault? Am I responsible for how much you’ve changed? I haven’t seen you for two years now... Have you..hated me that entire time?

speaker: Lyon
text: No, Ephraim. I was never dishonest. I liked you both. I still do. But I was envious of you, too. That’s why I...desired this. You may not believe me when I tell you this, but... Even now, after all this, I still consider you a friend.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon... You know that I do, too. I spoke the truth to you... I truly thought that we would always be friends. That’s why I... I have to stop you.

speaker: Lyon
text: Of course. I know... You are Ephraim, after all. You could do no less, my friend. Well, come then, Ephraim. Try and stop me. I will defeat you, and then I will save the people of Grado. No one... No one will stand in my way.

speaker: Lyon
text: Come, and face your death! I’m waiting, you miserable fool. Your corpse will make a perfect offering in my resurrection.

speaker: Lyon
text: I am the Demon King… I know nothing of human frailty. I am supreme…

speaker: Lyon
text: Where… Where did I go wrong…

speaker: Lyon
text: I guess that proves it. You’re too strong, Ephraim... I’ve always... admired...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon!

speaker: Lyon
text: You know, Ephraim... I always wanted to be you. I wanted to be strong and handsome... With Eirika always at my side... That’s what I wanted to be. I had... I had nothing...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Don’t be ridiculous, Lyon. Who was it that taught me history? Who covered for me when I stumbled? Didn’t you see how I looked up to you? I admired your compassion, your wisdom, your thoughtfulness....

speaker: Lyon
text: Oh, yeah... That seems so long ago... I did keep you out of trouble, didn’t I? Thanks for remembering. See? You’re thoughtful, too...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Lyon... Wait! Don’t close your eyes! I’m going to save you! I’ll find a way! I...

speaker: Lyon
text: No, don’t... Thanks, anyway. It was all my fault... Don’t look so sad. C’mon, Ephraim, smile. Like you used to...

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...Lyon...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What?! This...

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother! Lyon’s body! It’s...

speaker: Demon King
text: ...The time has come... ...My resurrection is at hand...

speaker: Demon King
text: Heh heh...heh heh heh... Well done, Lyon. The sacrifice of your flesh and the sum of your efforts... They were all for naught. Grado’s disaster cannot be averted. My resurrection is at hand. All this time, you imagined yourself in possession of your own free will, but it was I who planted the seed from which your ambitions grew. My deceit made you my puppet, and oh, how you danced at the end of my strings. You could never have been saved. It’s a shame, isn’t it, Lyon? And now I... I am reborn.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Demon King! You are responsible for all the misery we’ve seen! Lyon... My friend... You’re the one...

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother... This power... It’s different.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I know. This power is greater than anything we’ve ever faced.... But none of that matters. I’ve learned so much... My lance is stronger than ever. That thing the deceived and murdered my friend... No matter what happens, I’m going to destroy it!

speaker: Ephraim
text: L’Arachel! It’s time to use it. Prepare the last Sacred Stone! We have to use its power on that beast, like in the legends!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: You must listen to me, Ephraim. The stories are true: the stone does hold the power to stop the Demon King. However, the source of its power is human will, the desire for peace within our hearts.

speaker: Ephraim
text: In our hearts...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Yes, that’s right. We need not pray for the Sacred Stone to aid us now. No, we need only focus ourselves and concentrate on a better future.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I understand. Everyone! Listen to me! This is the final battle. If we can defeat this thing, it’s over. We face the king of demons, the monster that once ruled all Magvel. He’s more powerful than any one of us here. But we have something that beast will never have. We have community, friendship, love... We have all the virtues of humanity. That is our weapon. That is our strength.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Be careful, Eirika!

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s all right. He’s Lyon. Lyon...

speaker: Lyon
text: Ei...Eirika...Is...that you...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, Lyon. It’s me.

speaker: Lyon
text: Eirika...You stopped me, didn’t you... I’m glad...

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon...Lyon...

speaker: Lyon
text: Listen...Eirika... I never had the courage to tell you, but...I’ve always loved you...

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What...! This...

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother! Lyon’s body! It’s...

speaker: Demon King
text: The time has come... My resurrection is at hand...

speaker: Demon King
text: Now, humans...Lament your fate. Weep for the dead. Despair for the living. Wail and tremble in grief. Grovel in awe and fear. I am returned.

speaker: Eirika
text: Is...is that...the... Demon King...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: Brother...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Don’t be afraid, Eirika. I’m here. Our friends are here. We have the Sacred Stone, and we have each other. We will not lose. We will defeat him.

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re right, Brother!

speaker: Eirika
text: L’Arachel! It’s time. We have to use the final Sacred Stone. We must use its power against the Demon King, as in the stories of old!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: You must listen to me, Eirika. The stories are true; the stone does hold the power to stop the Demon King. However, the source of its power is human will, the desire for peace within our hearts.

speaker: Eirika
text: In our hearts...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Yes, that’s right. We need not pray for the Sacred Stones to aid us now. No, we need only focus ourselves and concentrate on a better future.

speaker: Eirika
text: I understand, L’Arachel. Listen, everyone. I can never repay you for all you’ve done so far. Now, please, one last time...Lend me your strength. To defeat the Demon King! To restore peace to our lands! To take the peace we all dream of and make it real!

speaker: Eirika
text: Let’s finish this.

speaker: Seth
text: My only wish is to serve and protect the two of you...

speaker: Franz
text: There must be something that I can do!

speaker: Gilliam
text: We can’t let our guard down.

speaker: Vanessa
text: Please, let everyone come through this unscathed...

speaker: Moulder
text: Hm. I wonder if we can reenact the legend.

speaker: Ross
text: Watch with pride, Father! I’ll show you who’s the strongest!

speaker: Garcia
text: This may be my last battle. I’ll hold nothing back.

speaker: Neimi
text: I’m starting to wonder if I really should be here...

speaker: Colm
text: Fighting’s all well and good, but where’s all the treasure?

speaker: Artur
text: That’s the king of all demons... What a ferocious sight he is.

speaker: Lute
text: Oh, that’s the Demon King, isn’t it? Yes, I’ve read all about him.

speaker: Natasha
text: ...Prince Lyon.

speaker: Joshua
text: So, what’s Lady Luck have in store for me today?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Is everybody ready? We’re going to win.

speaker: Forde
text: We’ve got to do what we can, right?

speaker: Kyle
text: We’re with you all the way, Prince Ephraim!

speaker: Tana
text: There’s nothing to fear. I’ll protect everyone!

speaker: Amelia
text: Gotta d-do my best. Here goes!

speaker: Innes
text: Bah... I am in NO way inferior to this so-called Demon King.

speaker: Gerik
text: Never stop fighting. Never...

speaker: Tethys
text: Don’t tense up! You’ll fight better if you’re relaxed.

speaker: Marisa
text: My blade will cut deep.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: I, L’Arachel, strike in the name of righteousness, order, and Rausten!

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwah ha ha! Same goes for me!

speaker: Saleh
text: Hm... Can my magic prevail?

speaker: Ewan
text: I’ll show you all what my magic can do.

speaker: Cormag
text: Defeat the foe. Nothing else matters.

speaker: Rennac
text: Come on... You can’t be serious!

speaker: Duessel
text: We must be steel blades with which to pierce the enemy.

speaker: Knoll
text: That’s the heart of the darkness I’ve studied? It can’t be...

speaker: Myrrh
text: I’ll do what I can.

speaker: Syrene
text: I will show you honour and valour of the Frelian Pegasus Knights.

speaker: Demon King
text: Gaa...grrr... Abominable Sacred Stone... I will not suffer imprisonment again. How... You possess only one... Do not fool yourselves. You cannot fully imprison me... I will grind that wretched rock and your accursed bones to powder!

speaker: Eirika
text: There!

speaker: L’Arachel
text: We did it. The Demon King’s soul has been bound once more. But, Eirika, it’s not over yet. The Demon King’s soul rages against its prison. We must return it to its proper place–and quickly. But first, we must defeat the Demon King’s soulless body!

speaker: Eirika
text: That thing...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Uh-huh...The real battle’s just beginning. Our ancestors paid dearly for their victory. A mountain of corpses...It’s written the Demon King was surrounded by the dead before he finally fell.

speaker: Seth
text: We’re all prepared to do what must be done.

speaker: Eirika
text: I have no desire to make any more heartbreaking sacrifices. I promised we would all return safely, and return safely we shall!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Did we do it?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Yes, we did it. The Demon King’s soul has been bound once more. But, Ephraim, it’s not over yet. The Demon King’s soul rages against its prison. We must return it to its proper place–and quickly. But first, we must defeat the Demon King’s soulless body!

speaker: Ephraim
text: That thing?

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Uh-huh... The real battle’s just beginning. Our ancestors paid dearly for their victory. A mountain of corpses... It’s written the Demon King was surrounded by the dead before he finally fell.

speaker: Seth
text: We are all prepared to do what must be done.

speaker: Ephraim
text: No... I’ll do it. I have no intention of seeing anyone else die!

speaker: Eirika
text: That’s it. It’s over, isn’t it...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Yes. Evil has been imprisoned, locked away. The legends of old have been mirrored in our actions today.

speaker: Innes
text: No, we’ve done far more than the legends ever told. We’ve destroyed the Demon King’s body. He can never come back.

speaker: Eirika
text: That’s right. And we have you all to thank for it.

speaker: Ephraim
text: And another thing... In that ancient battle, it took the might of the five heroes to do what we did. We did not have their extraordinary power to draw upon.

speaker: Eirika
text: No, we didn’t. We conquered darkness and restored peace to the land, thanks to you. It was because you never gave in, you never stopped fighting. None of you, not once. Thank you...

speaker: Syrene
text: This means we’ve accomplished our mission! I must relay the good news to King Hayden at once.

speaker: Tana
text: Yes. I’m sure Father will be most pleased. Brother! This means peace will be restored, doesn’t it... Shall I fly back to Frelia and let him know...

speaker: Innes
text: There’s no need to rush. I’m sure he knows. After all, we were together, and that ensured our victory.

speaker: Syrene
text: Of course, Prince Innes...

speaker: Moulder
text: Hmmm... Looks like we’re on the outside looking in, eh... Even so, the fighting’s over. And that’s something to be happy about.

speaker: Gilliam
text: Exactly.

speaker: Gerik
text: Well that took some doing, but we finally finished the job.

speaker: Tethys
text: We certainly earned our pay... Please tell me we’re going to enjoy it.

speaker: Marisa
text: Let’s go home, Chief.

speaker: Gerik
text: Let’s see now... Shall we head back to Jehanna... I guess we could stop in at the guild and get our next contract, eh...

speaker: Tethys
text: But the queen’s gone... I wonder what Jehanna will do now.

speaker: Gerik
text: I’m sure it’ll all work out. After all’s said and done, it’s our home. C’mon. It’s time for Gerik’s band to ride.

speaker: Marisa
text: Let’s go.

speaker: Joshua
text: ...... ...Hm... Heads. Looks like I should be getting back as well. Homecoming time...

speaker: Natasha
text: It’s over, isn’t it... The demon that drove Grado to madness is dead and gone.

speaker: Amelia
text: I-I can’t believe that I was part of this whole thing...

speaker: Cormag
text: The war is over. But so much remains to be done. Our country lost this war. The road ahead will be long and hard.

speaker: Duessel
text: That’s true. And yet... It’s a road we must travel. That’s the burden survivors must shoulder.

speaker: Knoll
text: Yes. And we must fulfill the dreams of Emperor Vigarde and Prince Lyon.

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Dozla, Rennac. We’ve done it.

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwaa ha ha! And a job well done it was, Princess L’Arachel.

speaker: Rennac
text: Whew... It’s finally over. So it’s about time for me to...

speaker: L’Arachel
text: Hold it! I gave you no orders to leave! I am the princess of Rausten, lest you forget. I have many missions yet to fulfill. Come, Dozla, Rennac. It’s time to go!

speaker: Dozla
text: Gwaa ha ha! Wait up! Let’s move, Rennac!

speaker: Rennac
text: ...Sigh.

speaker: Myrrh
text: The darkness... It’s gone.

speaker: Saleh
text: Yes. That’s the end.

speaker: Myrrh
text: I guess so...

speaker: Saleh
text: Let’s return home, Lady Myrrh. Our friends and family will be worrying about us...

speaker: Ewan
text: What... Hey, Teacher! Where are you going... Wait up. I’m coming with you.

speaker: Garcia
text: You did well, Ross. You’re a true warrior, my pride and joy.

speaker: Ross
text: But you’re still the best, Father! That’s right! My father’s the best warrior in all Magvel!

speaker: Colm
text: Bah, I’m glad everyone’s so happy, but... They’d better not forget that they won only with our help. Right, Neimi...

speaker: Neimi
text: We all worked... together. Wasn’t that great...Colm... Sniff...

speaker: Colm
text: H-hey... Don’t start crying... Please...

speaker: Artur
text: O glorious light, were you witness to our victory... The foul demon has been purged from the earth.

speaker: Lute
text: The ancient Demon King was as powerful as the scrolls described. And yet, in the end, we were able to defeat him! After all, there’s no one better than us.

speaker: Seth
text: Your continued safety is all that matters to me, Princess Eirika.

speaker: Franz
text: General! Princess Eirika! We can finally return to Renais, can’t we...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, we can go home. All of us unharmed...

speaker: Forde
text: Ah, I’m exhausted. I’d like nothing more than to laze about a while... Alas, we’re not going to have that opportunity, are we, Prince Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: No. The reconstruction of Renais is going to keep us busy. Keep your strength up. I’m going to need you in the days ahead.

speaker: Kyle
text: We’ll be beside you through it all!

speaker: Eirika
text: All right, let’s go home. Let’s go back to the people who are waiting for us...

speaker: Ephraim
text: What is it, Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: I was thinking about Lyon. The last time we saw him was a year and a half ago...

speaker: Ephraim
text: You’re right. It was at Grado Keep. ...Has it really been only a year and a half?

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim! Lyon! Where are you two?

speaker: Lyon
text: We’re over here, Eirika. You’d better be quick. Ephraim says he’s tired of waiting.

speaker: Eirika
text: Oh, please, I’m sure you could wait a few moments longer...

speaker: Ephraim
text: You’re late. How does it take you so long to prepare for such a simple trip?

speaker: Lyon
text: Rest easy, Ephraim. There’s no need to be so curt with your own sister. After all, a king must learn how to treat women with honor and discretion. That’s what Father MacGregor says.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you, Lyon. You, unlike my dear brother, are a true gentleman. I was up far too late thinking about my prayer to the temple flame last night. And I’m afraid I... I overslept...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Your prayer? What are you babbling about?

speaker: Lyon
text: Come now, you know that the flame has been burning since the time of darkness ended. You must know the story that the flame will answer the prayers of any pilgrim!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Really? I didn’t know that.

speaker: Eirika
text: Oh, Ephraim... Father MacGregor is going to scold you for neglecting your studies so.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...Don’t even joke about that. So tell us, what have you decided to pray for, Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: I, uh... It’s a secret.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I should’ve known. You’re so boring.

speaker: Lyon
text: Well, how about you, Ephraim?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Me? Let’s see... I guess I’ll pray to become a stronger fighter.

speaker: Lyon
text: That’s just like you, Ephraim.

speaker: Eirika
text: Just like you indeed, Brother.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ... I can never tell if you’re complimenting me or mocking me.

speaker: Lyon
text: Praising you, of course! Right, Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: Hee hee... Yes, that’s right.

speaker: Ephraim
text: And you, Lyon? What will you pray for?

speaker: Lyon
text: What? Me? Hm... I suppose all I really want is for all our people to be happy.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...That’s very, uh... That’s very much like you.

speaker: Eirika
text: Very much so, Lyon.

speaker: Lyon
text: ...Now, I’m the one who cannot tell if he’s being praised or...

speaker: Ephraim
text: You’re being praised, as always, Lyon.

speaker: Eirika
text: Tell me, why the sudden decision to visit the temple? Did my brother do something again?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Now listen, you...

speaker: Lyon
text: Oh no. It’s not what Ephraim’s done. It’s what he hasn’t done. He’s learned nothing at all about the Sacred Stones and the temple flame, so...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Father MacGregor became angry. He said, One destined to become king and rule over a nation... must know the history of his kingdom and must respect the Sacred Stones.?Ever since I came to Grado, my life has been chastisement and castigation. Father MacGregor does not think me to be altogether too...kingly.

speaker: Lyon
text: And yet General Duessel has nothing but praise for you, Ephraim. He says you’ve brave and true, that you’ve the making of a great king.

speaker: Ephraim
text: A great king? I honestly have no idea what that means. Eirika should succeed the throne. I would be happy simply taking my lance and traveling the land as a mercenary.

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim, that is nothing but foolish, irresponsible romanticism! Do you realize how much your words would fill Father’s heart with grief?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Are we speaking of the same man? Our father will likely outlive us all. For now, I’m content just learning the lance from General Duessel. What about you, Lyon? Is there anything you want to do?

speaker: Lyon
text: Me? Well, I... I suppose I want to become like my father.

speaker: Eirika
text: You were born to be the Emperor of Grado, Lyon. It suits you.

speaker: Lyon
text: No, I don’t think so. I’m not– One thing I do know from watching my father is that being emperor is hard. Every day, he answers the complaints of the people, and he almost never sleeps... My father is always so very tired. I hope one day that... I hope that I can help him.

speaker: Eirika
text: Lyon... You are so honorable. You should learn from him, Brother.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...Again with your criticism! Tell me, Eirika. What say you to dressing like me and becoming king in my stead? You’re so skinny, I doubt anyone would notice you’re not really a man.

speaker: Lyon
text: Ha ha ha...

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim!

speaker: Eirika
text: What do you suppose Lyon is doing now? When Emperor Vigarde ordered the invasion... How do you think Lyon felt?

speaker: Ephraim
text: He’s always been so gentle, but he worships his father. He’d never question him. But the emperor... He’s clearly not behaving rationally. I just hope he’s not so far gone that he’d hurt his own flesh and blood.

speaker: Eirika
text: I just pray for the day when the three of us can be together once again.

speaker: Ephraim
text: It’ll come. I’ve no doubt...

speaker: Tana
text: Eirika! Ephraim! Welcome! The two of you returning together, it’s like a dream come true. You must know, I’ve prayed every day for your safe return.

speaker: Eirika
text: I’m so happy to see you, Tana.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’m sorry, Tana. I didn’t want for you to worry.

speaker: Tana
text: Oh, it doesn’t matter now... All that really matters is that we’ve been brought together again. My own brother will soon return from the field. It will be nice to sit down and discuss things again.

speaker: Soldier
text: Princess Tana! Prince Innes has returned from the front!

speaker: Tana
text: Welcome home, dear brother! I’m so happy to see you return safe and sound!

speaker: Innes
text: You didn’t expect less, did you? Do you think Grado’s slugs could touch me? With my bow, I’ll take down every Grado soldier form here to the emperor’s palace!

speaker: Ephraim
text: Well met, Innes.

speaker: Innes
text: ...Ephraim.

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s good to see you, Prince Innes.

speaker: Innes
text: ...They say Renais has fallen. I believe I warned you before. This happened because you provided Grado the opportunity to strike.

speaker: Tana
text: Brother! Mind your tongue! This is no occasion for such harsh words. Ephraim and Eirika have lost their father to this terrible war...

speaker: Innes
text: ...... I’m sorry to hear of your father’s death. Hear me, Ephraim. Our most important task is to defeat Grado and end this war.

speaker: Tana
text: Oh, Innes... I’m sorry, Eirika, Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: It’s all right. It’s comforting to see that, in all of this, at least he hasn’t changed. Innes has hated me for as long as I can remember.

speaker: Tana
text: My brother looks upon you as a rival, Ephraim. And as you know, he wants to be the best at everything. The best king, the best general, the best fighter, the best man... He won’t allow himself to be beaten at anything.

speaker: Innes
text: Tana, you talk too much.

speaker: Innes
text: ...My father would like both of you to sit with him in a war council. Will you come with me to take part in your official audience?

speaker: Ephraim
text: Yes, of course. There’s much that I have to tell him.

speaker: Eirika
text: It will be out honor to attend.

speaker: Innes
text: This way.

speaker: Hayden
text: It does my heart good to see you all here safely within our castle walls. ...Would that we had more time for pleasantries, but...let us hear your news.

speaker: Innes
text: Very well, I will begin. I’ve directed the body of Frelia’s army south to engage Grado directly. Our troops are proving themselves superior, and the battle progresses favorably.

speaker: Hayden
text: Hmm... But the riddle still needs answering. Why did Grado begin this war in the first place?

speaker: Eirika
text: Your Majesty, we may well have found something relating to that... We learned something on our travels, news that weighs heavily upon us.

speaker: Hayden
text: Ah, yes. Our messenger delivered your report to us a few days ago. Grado is trying to destroy the Sacred Stones... Is that it?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes.

speaker: Hayden
text: We’ve strengthened the tower’s defenses. Frelia’s stone is safe for the time being. But we remain confused in this. What does Grado hope to gain by destroying the Sacred Stones?

speaker: Eirika
text: We don’t know. The legends say the stones protect us all from the power of darkness.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...I can’t say if it relates, but I have a story about Grado. It’s...been troubling me, and I would like to share it with you all. Myrrh. Come here, please.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Yes?

speaker: Hayden
text: Who’s this girl?

speaker: Eirika
text: On her back... Wings? Ephraim, who is she?

speaker: Ephraim
text: This is Myrrh. I met here while fighting in Grado territory. Myrrh, would you please tell everyone here the story you told me?

speaker: Myrrh
text: ...... ...Please, Ephraim, you tell them.

speaker: Ephraim
text: She’s a bit shy.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Very well. Myrrh tells me that she belongs to an ancient race of dragon folk. They’re mentioned in a few legends. They’re called the tribe of Manakete.

speaker: Eirika
text: Manakete?

speaker: Hayden
text: Yes, their name appears several times in the tale of the Sacred Stones. It says they were neither human nor demon but a separate, aloof race.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Please, Myrrh.

speaker: Myrrh
text: ...... We live in the east...in Darkling Woods. One day...

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes?

speaker: Myrrh
text: We felt something. An ominous energy to the south.

speaker: Ephraim
text: From the direction of Grado. They felt a...force flowing out of the Grado Empire.

speaker: Myrrh
text: Saleh and I... We went to investigate this energy. But on our way down, we came across a battle and were drawn into the conflict.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Myrrh got lost and was wandering aimlessly in an isolated region near Grado’s border.

speaker: Myrrh
text: I met some wicked folk there. They deceived and enchained me. They stole my dragonstone. They were preparing me for transport. It was in that moment when Ephraim appeared and rescued me.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I stumbled across Myrrh by chance when Grado’s men had ambushed us. Everything she told me seemed beyond belief, and yet... And yet, when I saw her wings, what could I do but believe?

speaker: Myrrh
text: This dark wave of energy still flows from the southlands. Its current is strong and runs deep. It has awakened the evil ones. I want to stop it.

speaker: Hayden
text: Hmmm......

speaker: Soldier
text: Your Majesty! I bring word!

speaker: Hayden
text: What is so urgent you would interrupt a private council?

speaker: Soldier
text: The tower holding the Sacred Stone of Frelia... It’s been destroyed by the Grado Army!

speaker: Hayden
text: What? That’s impossible! What of the soldiers on watch? There were supposed to be many...

speaker: Soldier
text: The enemy forces... They were led by Caellach the Tiger Eye and Selena Fluorspar! Our soldiers fell before even half a day had past!

speaker: Seth
text: Selena Fluorspar... Only General Duessel is higher in Emperor Vigarde’s esteem... She’s the one.

speaker: Hayden
text: She came personally... So they really do wish to see the Sacred Stones destroyed. Blast...

speaker: Caellach
text: Hah! So this hunk of rock is a Sacred Stone, eh? So much fuss over something as fragile as this. Watch. It crumbles so easily. Do we gain anything by this? Not that I care, but...

speaker: Frelia Soldier
text: Black-hearted...fool... What have...you...done? Without the stone’s...protection... the horrors...will spread...

speaker: Caellach
text: Huh? What’s this? Still breathing, are you? Come. If you’ve any last words, I’ll hear them, fool of Frelia.

speaker: Frelia Soldier
text: You...monster...

speaker: Caellach
text: You waste your last words on insults? And feeble ones, at that... Hardly the right note to enter the eternal on, wouldn’t you say? Well then, die.

speaker: Selena
text: Hold! What are you doing, Caellach?! Our job was to destroy the Sacred Stone.

speaker: Caellach
text: I know that. And I crush it, did I not? But if we don’t clean up these Frelian curs, they might–

speaker: Selena
text: You do not raise your blade to anyone who is powerless to resist you! The emperor does not desire us to kill without cause! That would be murder!

speaker: Caellach
text: Right, the emperor... Your name’s Selena, ain’t it? Tell me, Selena. What makes that pasty- faced old fool’s word so important?

speaker: Selena
text: Wretch... Do you dare insult His Imperial Majesty!?

speaker: Caellach
text: Hey, hey, I’m joking. Don’t get so worked up. I get it now. You’re a true and loyal soldier. I’m leaving before Frelia sends reinforcements. Coming?

speaker: Hayden
text: How could this happen... How could I have allowed our Sacred Stone to be destroyed? Dark energies from the empire’s capital... Evil monstrosities roaming our lands... Vigarde’s mad invasion... And now this, the destruction of our sacred talisman. And we have no idea of Grado’s goals. We are in the dark times once again. But even so, we cannot sit here, wringing our hands. First, we must warn the nations that house the remaining Sacred Stones. If Vigarde seeks to destroy the Stones, they are all in grave danger. Jehanna and Rausten must be warned. The nations must joined together to fight our common foe.

speaker: Eirika
text: Do you think they will believe us?

speaker: Hayden
text: Hm... It is a difficult tale to believe, I must agree.

speaker: Innes
text: I will go, Father.

speaker: Hayden
text: Innes?

speaker: Innes
text: A direct visit from the Prince of Frelia is not something they can ignore. I will travel to Jehanna, where I will forge an alliance with her queen. If our Sacred Stone has been destroyed, the Frelia could be in greater danger. Father, I cannot let you leave the nation in such a time of crisis. It is imperative that I be the one to go.

speaker: Hayden
text: Hmmm...

speaker: Eirika
text: And I will head for Rausten.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Eirika? You know I can’t let you put yourself in such danger.

speaker: Eirika
text: Rest easy, dear brother. I will journey to Rausten by ship across the North Sea. There will be no danger. And I have made a vow. I will fight as you have until the day Renais is liberated.

speaker: Ephraim
text: ...I understand. King Hayden, I will take troops and march on the imperial capital from the west.

speaker: Hayden
text: The west?! Are you saying you will begin an assault on Grado from here?

speaker: Ephraim
text: If we can take Grado Keep, the war will be over. The Sacred Stones will be safe. If we start here and press forward with all our might...

speaker: Hayden
text: And once you reach the capital? Vigarde’s generals will be there waiting for you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: If they oppose us, we will fight.

speaker: Hayden
text: ...You’ve got your father’s foolhardy courage, don’t you? ...Very well. I entrust all our hope to you three. Innes, you will go to Jehanna, Eirika to Rausten, And Ephraim to the imperial capital. Funding you will have, but of soldiers, we have few to spare. For each of you, a difficult road awaits.

speaker: Ephraim
text: If any of us meets defeat, the battle will turn to Grado’s favor. There must be no errors. We must not fail.

speaker: Innes
text: Where I command, there are no mistakes.

speaker: Eirika
text: I have no doubts. I’ll succeed, I swear it. Come, it is time to go!

speaker: Eirika
text: Farewell, Brother. I will return.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Mm... To be honest, I still do not want you to go. I would rather you wait here for my return.

speaker: Eirika
text: Please, Ephraim... I will be fine. There’s no need for you to worry. Mine is the easiest task, and I’ll be in no danger. I’m far more worried about your mission. Challenging the might of an empire with a handful of men?

speaker: Ephraim
text: What’s this now? Have you lost your faith in me?

speaker: Eirika
text: No, of course not. I know your true strength, Ephraim. No one can defeat you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Ha ha! Hearing you say that fills me with confidence. I think I know my own limitations. I won’t overextend my reach. I can’t die and leave you on your own, can I?

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: Let us both survive to be reunited. Give me your word, Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: You have it, Brother.

speaker: Narrator
text: Eirika and Ephraim will now part ways. Which of them will you accompany?

speaker: Kyle
text: Princess Eirika!

speaker: Forde
text: Is your departure time near?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes. Kyle, Forde, I’m traveling to Rausten. I ask that you two serve my brother well.

speaker: Forde
text: Actually, there’s been a slight change of plans.

speaker: Kyle
text: We’re going with you, Your Highness.

speaker: Eirika
text: What? But...

speaker: Kyle
text: Prince Ephraim rides with Frelia’s finest at his back.

speaker: Forde
text: And this was a personal order from the prince himself. He said, I don’t need you loafing around here. Go and keep Eirika safe.?Since when is battling all of Grado loafing about? Honestly!

speaker: Eirika
text: You’re right! My brother’s mission is far more dangerous than mine. I will go and speak with him...

speaker: Kyle
text: Princess Eirika. Prince Ephraim said he’s not concerned for his own safety. These are the words our prince gave us, and we believe he means them.

speaker: Forde
text: That’s the truth of it. There’s no cause for worry, Princess Eirika. We can all attest to the prince’s tenacity. No matter how close death comes, the Pale Horse will not catch him.

speaker: Eirika
text: ...Kyle, Forde... I understand. Thank you for your service and bravery. You are my brother’s most trusted and most valiant companions. I would be honored to have you ride at my side.

speaker: Kyle
text: The honor is ours. We ride for Renais and for Princess Eirika!

speaker: Forde
text: Let’s not work ourselves into a frenzy right now. When the time comes, I will be there to handle things.

speaker: Eirika
text: Of course. I’m depending on both of you.

speaker: Seth
text: Prince Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Is that you, Seth? I’m almost ready to depart. I’m leaving Eirika in your care.

speaker: Seth
text: Actually, milord... We have the honor of riding with you.

speaker: Ephraim
text: What? What about Eirika?

speaker: Seth
text: The princess informs me that she will be accompanied by a Frelian escort. She tells me she does not need a large retinue on such a small ship.

speaker: Ephraim
text: I understand, but we must be prepared for anything. I will be fine, Seth. Please go and attend Eirika.

speaker: Seth
text: Lord Ephraim, this is Lady Eirika’s wish. She implored us to lend our blades to you on the front lines... She spoke to each of us individually. She knelt before us and beseeched us to go. Her sincerity, her concern... We could not help but be moved by her plea.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Oh, Eirika... Very well. You will all come with me. But steel yourselves. This will not be an easy journey. I want only volunteers who are unafraid of meeting death.

speaker: Seth
text: I’ll let the others know. I must tell you, milord–they are already preparing to depart. They know the risks they are taking, and not a one will be deterred.

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth has mapped out a route for us. We’ll travel south of Renais and pass through Serafew into Grado territory.

speaker: Moulder
text: Hmm... That would seem a sensible plan. Assuming, of course, that we can avoid any run-ins with Grado soldiers...

speaker: Vanessa
text: Princess Eirika, may I have your leave to scout ahead? From the sky, I’ll have a better chance of spotting any nearby troops.

speaker: Moulder
text: We’re yours to command, Your Highness. Will you give your permission?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, of course. Keep an eye out for enemy bowmen though, Vanessa.

speaker: Vanessa
text: Yes, Your Highness, I shall. I shall prove myself worthy of the honor of your trust.

speaker: Eirika
text: She seems very...sincere.

speaker: Moulder
text: Sincere...Yes, quite.

speaker: Bone
text: Hey, boss! We’ve found more villages ripe for the picking.

speaker: Bazba
text: One, two, three... Ha ha ha! I love a good war! With all those soldiers preoccupied, we’re free to pillage as we please! Right, Bone–you’re in charge. Grab everything that’s not nailed down and bring it to the hideout.

speaker: Bone
text: I’m on it.

speaker: Ross
text: Dad! Bandits approaching!

speaker: Garcia
text: Hmmm... I’m getting you out of here, Ross. You stay close to me!

speaker: Bone
text: Let’s start with that village there! Go to it, boys! It’s all yours. Cut down anyone fool enough to get in your way. I’m heading west around the mountains to the other villages.

speaker: Ross
text: Unnnng!

speaker: Garcia
text: Ross? What is it? What’s wrong?

speaker: Ross
text: It’s nothing! It’s just a scratch! You’re a warrior, Dad, and I am your son. I won’t be beaten so easily.

speaker: Garcia
text: Don’t risk yourself so foolishly... We need to get you some help. Please! Someone help my son!

speaker: Vanessa
text: Ah! This looks serious. I must report back to Princess Eirika at once.

speaker: Vanessa
text: I have bad news. The village to the east is under attack by bandits.

speaker: Eirika
text: Bandits?!

speaker: Moulder
text: We have arrived at our first dilemma. We must move quickly and attract as little attention as possible, but...

speaker: Eirika
text: But I cannot stand by and watch innocents be harmed. Vanessa, how fare the villagers?

speaker: Vanessa
text: I spotted one injured person. He appeared to be just a child.

speaker: Eirika
text: Father Moulder, can your staff help him?

speaker: Moulder
text: Well, yes, I can heal his injuries with my staff, but... I cannot do it from here. He’s too far away. I must be near him.

speaker: Vanessa
text: Princess, please leave this to me. I shall bring the boy here.

speaker: Moulder
text: All right, Vanessa. It’s up to you.

speaker: Vanessa
text: Very well. I’m off.

speaker: Man
text: Hm? What is it? What’s all the ruckus? What? B-bandits?! Spread the word, everyone! Close the village gates! Thank you for your warning. Please, accept this small token.

speaker: Woman
text: This is terrible...What are we going to do? The Bandits are so close. If we can’t find some way to protect ourselves, the village is doomed.

speaker: Selena
text: Perhaps...

speaker: Eirika
text: People, listen to me! You must close the village gates immediately. Hurry, before the bandits arrive!

speaker: Selena
text: Who are you? You aren’t from one of the neighboring towns, are you. And your weapons give you away... You’re no peasant.

speaker: Eirika
text: I am Er... My name is Erina. I’m a mercenary.

speaker: Selena
text: A mercenary named Erina, is it? There’s more to you than that, I feel. But don’t worry–it’s none of my affair. I haven’t told you who I am yet, have I? I am Selena, a general in Grado’s army.

speaker: Eirika
text: Ah!

speaker: Selena
text: Is something wrong?

speaker: Eirika
text: No...uh, nothing.

speaker: Selena
text: It looks like these villagers have some bandit troubles. I would like to help, but I have orders... I’m to leave for the capital immediately, and I cannot stay. You’re armed, and you claim to be a mercenary. Will you help them?

speaker: Eirika
text: Um...

speaker: Selena
text: Is there a problem?

speaker: Eirika
text: No! Of course I’ll help them! It’s just...You’re one of Grados’ generals...Why...

speaker: Selena
text: These aren’t soldiers. They’re people. Should they suffer because their leaders fight? I’ve petitioned your aid. Take this as payment.

speaker: Selena
text: And who are you? You don’t look like one of the local peasantry. As you can see, the villagers have some bandit troubles. I would like to help, but I have orders to follow... I am required to quit this area at once. I would ask you to aid them in this fight. I will pay you for your trouble, of course.

speaker: Young Lady
text: The most wonderful man rescued me. He was dressed like a mercenary, but he had an air of elegance about him... He gave me this elixir. I’m sure it will help you on the battlefield.

speaker: Ross
text: Hey, listen! My village is being attacked by bandits. My name’s Ross. Come on! You have to help me wipe those thugs out!

speaker: Eirika
text: All right, just... Just take a deep breath and calm down, Ross. Leave the villages to us. We’ll drive off the bandits. Seth, take the boy somewhere safe.

speaker: Ross
text: No! Wait! I’m going to fight, too!

speaker: Eirika
text: But...

speaker: Ross
text: My father is out there all alone, fighting those bandits. I’ve got to get back to him as quickly as possible! I’m the son of the great Garcia! As long as I have my axe, no bandit will ever defeat me!

speaker: Eirika
text: All right, I can see you’re not going to be swayed... But you must promise that you will stay close to us.

speaker: Ross
text: Dad!

speaker: Garcia
text: Ross?! Boy, what did I tell you!? What are you doing here? Don’t worry about me. Hurry up and get yourself to safety!

speaker: Ross
text: Did you really think I could just run away while you fight, Dad? You taught me that fighters fight for what’s important to them! There’s no way I’m leaving! I’m fighting just like you!

speaker: Garcia
text: Ross... All right, listen to me. We’ll cut our way out of here together!

speaker: Bone
text: Wait a minute! Wh-who are you?

speaker: Bone
text: Urgh...Blast...

speaker: Garcia
text: You saved my son. I owe you my thanks.

speaker: Eirika
text: It’s not necessary...

speaker: Seth
text: ...Hold on a moment... Aren’t you..the great Garcia? You fought for Renais, didn’t you?

speaker: Eirika
text: Seth, do you know this man?

speaker: Seth
text: He was a troop commander for Renais until around ten years ago. When I was a recruit, the soldiers used to tell so many tales about him. They called him a daring and fearless fighter for Renais. Master Garcia, you must know the peril our homeland faces right now... Can we impose upon you to lend your strength to Renais once again?

speaker: Garcia
text: ...I’m sorry. I’m retired now. I’m not a soldier anymore. It’s... a decision I made long ago.

speaker: Seth
text: Master Garcia...

speaker: Garcia
text: ...When I was a soldier, I lived my life fighting for my country’s honor. I left no time for my family. I spent my life fighting for faceless, uncaring nobles. When my wife fell ill and died, I met the child she had left behind... At that moment, I finally realized what my duty had cost me.

speaker: Garcia
text: I stood at my wife’s grave and promised her I would be a father to our son. I’m done with armies. I’m done with fighting, except to protect my son. I’ve no regrets. I’m the boy’s father.

speaker: Ross
text: You...you blasted fool! Father, what’s all this nonsense I’m hearing?

speaker: Garcia
text: Ross!

speaker: Ross
text: If you’re not going, then I will! I’m a fighter! I know I can do this!

speaker: Garcia
text: Ross, what are you saying? I...

speaker: Ross
text: Dad, please! Listen to me! I respect you more than any other man in the world. I know you gave up being a soldier for me. I know that! But how can you throw away such a big part of yourself? You’re a warrior at heart! You can’t give that up and be happy!

speaker: Ross
text: Look at me, Dad! Have you seen me fight? I’m not a child anymore. I’m a warrior, like you. You’re free to worry, but I can survive on my own!

speaker: Garcia
text: ...Ross.

speaker: Ross
text: You want to challenge me, Father? I’m a fighter! The best in all of Ide! I’m not gonna lose to you! I’m not gonna lose to anyone!

speaker: Garcia
text: ...You’re right. You’re a good soldier, Ross.

speaker: Garcia
text: Sir Seth... If these old bones of mine can still serve, I’d like to join you.

speaker: Ross
text: Dad...

speaker: Garcia
text: Looks like my boy grew up while I wasn’t looking... He’s tougher than I thought. He doesn’t need my help. I’ve raised him as best I could, but he’s right. I’ve nothing to fear. I should fight. I will fight.

speaker: Ross
text: Dad!

speaker: Man
text: Thank you so much for your help. Please, stay the night and rest...

speaker: Eirika
text: We would if we could, but we have much to do and far to travel. Your safety is reward enough.

speaker: Man
text: Ah, well... My, that is a splendid bracelet you’re wearing.

speaker: Eirika
text: Thank you. My father gave this to me.

speaker: Man
text: It’s a wonderful gift. But you should be careful, wearing such a valuable item so openly. Since Renais was invaded, things have become so dangerous around here. There are gold-hungry thieves and bandits everywhere. The most wicked are Bazba’s Bandits. They are...cruel beyond words. If you have something they want, your life is worth less than nothing. Just the other day they assaulted some travelers and...Oh, it was awful.

speaker: Eirika
text: I...I can’t believe such things...

speaker: Man
text: Oh, Renais is finished, mark my words. The Grado Empire’s stolen our future. Our only hope against them was that Prince Ephraim would prevail, but... Rumor has it that he’s on the verge of being crushed by Grado’s vast numbers. These are dark days. Travel with care.

speaker: Eirika
text: Ephraim...

speaker: Ephraim
text: It’s time to start. Are you ready, Eirika?

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, Ephraim. Let’s begin.

speaker: Ephraim
text: Tell me, though: why do you want me to teach you to fight? I thought you didn’t care for violence...

speaker: Eirika
text: I do not like uncivilized behavior. I think one can solve one’s problems without fighting. And yet...

speaker: Ephraim
text: And yet what?

speaker: Eirika
text: I’ve always relied on you to protect me, Brother. I would rather not be such a burden to you in the future. So, I thought maybe I should learn to protect myself...

speaker: Ephraim
text: I’m your brother. Brothers are supposed to protect their sisters. It’s nothing for you to worry about. It’s no cause for concern.

speaker: Eirika
text: Yes, but... I am your sister. Sisters are supposed to worry about their brothers. So I would like to learn something of swordplay, if only a little. And maybe, someday, I can protect you in your time of need... So please, Ephraim.

speaker: Ephraim
text: All right, all right. How could I say no? Honestly, once you get an idea into your head, that’s it. I might as well give in. It’s agreed. I’ll teach you, but won’t hold back because you’re my sister. And I want no complaining once we’ve started, Eirika.

speaker: Eirika
text: Complain? Me? Never!

speaker: Colm
text: Oops! Beg your pardon.

speaker: Eirika
text: Hey!

speaker: Seth
text: Princess, are you all right?

speaker: Eirika
text: Y-yes... Someone bumped into me is all. I was jarred.

speaker: Seth
text: Hm? Your Highness, where is your bracelet?

speaker: Eirika
text: My bracelet? It’s...gone. Where could it be? Did that man–

speaker: Seth
text: I’ll find him!

speaker: Eirika
text: Don’t worry about it, Seth. That bracelet was a gift from my father, but Ephraim needs our help. I can’t let sentimentality get in the way of my duty.

speaker: Seth
text: No, Princess... We must retrieve your bracelet regardless of cost. You cannot lose it. Let’s go. We must hurry.
